story:
With Little Dragon learning will never feel the same again. Little Dragon is the first learning app that knows how you feel, making it easier to master concepts and skills. Your children will learn about school subjects and other areas of interest more happily and efficiently. Learning and playing will become closer than ever. 

Little Dragon does this by constantly reading and responding to your emotions: when things are getting too difficult or too easy, Little Dragon will adjust the content to keep you in an ideal flow of learning.

  • Focus on each individual child 
    When children are given consistent one-to-one attention they can feel recognised and understood.  
  • Game based, emotionally intelligent Learning App
  • One-to-One Tutor that continually improves understanding of your ways of learning through interaction
  • Funny and ergonomic backpack that will reinforce the relationship of your child with the Little Dragon Tutor
  • Unparalleled Insights into the experience of learning for better teaching
  • A Versatile Platform open to 3rd-Party Developer Content
  • Uncompromising Data Anonymization
Find much more information on our page.

 

Our core understanding is that:

  • Early experiences of learning have profound long lasting effects on our lives
  • ALL children deserve the best opportunities to learn
  • Kids naturally love to learn - adults just need to nurture that
  • All children are unique with their own way of doing things
  • A ‘one-size fits all’ educational system stifles the joy of learning for most 
  • Learning and playing can be two sides of the same coin

 

1 - Hello Little Dragon

Inspired by ‘old-school’ tamagotchi ©, Hello Little Dragon is your very own learning buddy in full play mode. Little Dragon is usually happy to see you, though he’ll frown and scowl if the mood takes him - or if you look at him the wrong way.  He’s full of character, makes children smile and encourages them to play and learn.  You can nurture Little Dragon, show him love, and be delighted at how he sees you and responds.

   

   

Little Dragon responds to users states by reading facial expressions. 

 

What's up Little Dragon? (part of Hello LD)

Feelings fuel and colour pretty much all of our experiences, and so we want to help children learn about theirs - the earlier we start to nurture emotional understanding the better.  In our groundbreaking new game - 'What's up Little Dragon?' -  our cute and curious hero will accompany his little human learner in exploring everyday situations and the emotions that come along.

We’re confident that kids and parents alike will enjoy and learn from this game and excited to get your feedback and input.  What’s most emotionally challenging for your child?  Maybe we can work together to help all of our kids make sense of their feelings and thrive in making friends and enjoying relationships.  

 

2 - English Reading Games

English is the most studied language on the planet and, while it is notoriously difficult, smooth acquisition of the ability to read English underpins the general experience of school and has lifelong implications. Accordingly, our first set of traditional ‘academic’  learning content takes kids to other worlds where the alphabet and sounds of letters await in a range of fun games. 

In designing this flagship content we have worked with a range of national reviews, policies, and approaches to teaching.  Our cutting-edge contribution to this highly contentious field of education will integrate a range of existing best practices with the entirely new Little Dragon interface.  


Little Dragon hatches. Let's unlock these other planets together … literally ,-)

 

3 - MY LITTLE DRAGON backpack

This puppet and case evolved from the starting point of bringing Little Dragon more to life by giving him a body.  iPads are cool, but they’re not very huggable. 

Our Little Dragon Puppet really has life.  When our designer and seamstress Jina made the first one, not only was it hugged within minutes of being introduced to our little learners, but we realised it was also a backpack.  The next part of My Little Dragon's life was when we recognised its ergonomic properties: as an iPad stand it helps your child avoid slouching into poor postures, huddled over a tablet for example, protecting against neck and back strain.  Win win.  We can't wait to see your My Little Dragon stories unfold!

My Little Dragon unlimited edition: Body, Backpack, and Ergonomic Case

 

4 - Buy One - Donate one

We are especially committed to reaching the kids on the fringes: the ones whose ‘special educational needs’ challenge teachers and parents the most, and the many at risk of being left behind.  This means working with those at the front line in ways that they need.  Our newest initiative is a partnership with a learning centre for refugee children under UNHCR in Malaysia.

Extending education to kids with least access has been part of our mission since inception.  So, as part of this crowdfunding campaign we are partnering with a UNHCR supported school serving refugee children.  We are doing this to raise awareness of the particular challenges facing these children struggling to access school in Malaysia and to bring them into our project from the get-go.  Like children everywhere, these amazing kids are who Little Dragon is for and their involvement is essential in helping us shape it for their needs.  We welcome 10 backers who want a My Little Dragon themselves to cover production costs only so that you can share the same again.  With these 10 Little Dragons in a school dozens of kids will also get to experience personalised emotionally intelligent learning.

 

5 - Video Conference Workshop
You get all elements of Little Dragon (My Little Dragon + Games) PLUS we will join you wherever you are via the interweb: one or all three of our founders will beam into your home, classroom or boardroom for an hour to give targeted guidance on aspects of our project that matter to you.
 
 

6 - Little Dragon UNIQUE Edition  

Each of these is brought into being through an intimate process of material selection and careful handcrafting (see images above).  As Jina meticulously and lovingly breathes life into these creatures the population of Little Dragon siblings in her workshop slowly grows...   If you decide you want to take one of these into your home you will get your uniquely numbered My Little Dragon and a certificate of creation signed by Jina.    

My Little Dragon UNIQUE edition designed and handcrafted by Korean Designer Yoon Jina Kim in Yunnan.

 

7 - Little Dragon Classroom Edition

Be one of the first teachers worldwide to work with this new technology: Get Little Dragon App with full access to all learning games + classroom analysis tool. You will also enjoy ongoing support over one school term so that you and your students can make the most of learning with Little Dragon. Choose the perk that fit's your schools needs best. 

 

Experimental Class with first Little Dragon prototype in Yunnan, China. 
January 2016. Check out our blog for more information.

 

8 - Emotional Learning Workshop

Get a condensed and personalized access to our team’s expertise. If your organization is anywhere near as excited by our mission as we are, you will probably have a notion of how much we have learned since inception. We will bring what we have, field our workshops to what you are doing, and share our insights on where you might go with Emotional Learning and AI driving Education.

 

We are confident that we can ship a first, limited version of Little Dragon to our Early Backers for Christmas 2016. 

After receiving your much needed feedback, our goal is to ship Little Dragon with a full set of English Reading and Emotional Learning games by March 2017. 

By May 2017 we will be able to roll-out classroom tools for teachers and other educational professionals.

We will keep our backers up to date with our progress and let you know if we encounter any setbacks.

 

  • Help us develop Little Dragon to maturity: We need $50,000 to put our emotion engine into operation. With this funding we will be able to complete development of our first set of innovative learning content and deliver the first ever iPad-based emotionally attuning AI tutor.

Since the base work for the app is done we can focus on integrating amazing games. Depending on your preferences we will dedicate about  50% of the funding to manufacture outstanding backpacks to give Little Dragon a real world body.

 

  • We need Parents, Teachers and the wider education community to support the idea by fielding it in their schools and homes.

  • We want to reach out to publishers, content creators and people who care about education to explore new ways of innovating learning.  

 

  • You will be a pioneer in the field of emotional human-machine interaction. Be one of the first to experience a machine responding directly to your feelings.

  • If you're a parent: Give your child the opportunity to learn more playfully and efficiently, in a truly 21st century way.

  • If you're a teacher: Empower your classroom work, and gain individualised understanding of your students from lesson feedback and analyses.

  • If you are working in the field of emotional learning technology: Get us to share our insights in workshops tailored to your specific interests, wherever you are.

 

For you: You will experience now and first-hand the essential integration of emotion and educational technology. Not only will you will gain an insight into how the next generation of children will learn, you will also have a chance to help shape that future. 

Happy learning through total immersion is at the core of our idea

For your children: Your kids can be among the first generation to experience a truly computer-mediated and emotionally guided form of learning. Little Dragon will be your child's personal tutor who better understands strengths and interests the more they play together. By making learning more enjoyable, the  iPad ‘screen time’ that children already love will boost their studies and better compliment other activities in school.

Little Dragon is aiming to deliver a new teaching method to the classroom

For teachers and schools: Personalised learning with Little Dragon will reduce the stress and wide-ranging effects of boredom, frustration and disruption in the classroom. With increased one-to-one attention more children will be able to learn happily at their own pace, enjoy greater success in school, and benefit from the extra time and insights available to teachers. So we will see happier and more successful schools composed of self-confident individuals who do what they love and love what they're doing.  

English Learning Activity in Binju, Yunnan (China)

 

Challenges and Innovations

As an emotionally-attuning AI-based one-to-one tutor, Little Dragon is taking-on two fascinating challenges familiar to all teachers who want to help children learn happily and efficiently: 

Challenge ONE: Making sense of complex patterns of human emotional expressions and providing attuned interactions.

Challenge TWO: Delivering optimally appropriate content to the learner at each step of his or her learning adventure.

This is how Little Dragon is innovating to provide an attentive and responsive teacher for each child:

 

Innovation ONE: Little Dragon reads and analyses patterns of user behaviour, facial emotion expressions, and other sensory data.  A range of insights from behavioural and educational sciences then inform the ways in which the system reacts. Little Dragon is designed to constantly improve its efficiency by trying different approaches based on the user’s individualised and situational pattern of interaction.  In other words: Little Dragon will experiment and optimise based on what works best to support the learner’s progress.

Innovation TWO: During preliminary sessions with Little Dragon, each child will play calibration games that will help the system understand what level of difficulty and types of lesson suit that child at that moment. As the child continues to learn and progress, the type of activity, content, and timing of delivery will be based on the individual child’s patterns of emotional engagement and ability.  Accordingly, learning content within Little Dragon will be composed of games that appeal to certain senses and moods, with a challenge level that is just right. 

 

We are Artha, an international team of teachers, researchers and developers in a wide range of disciplines. We have in our ranks pioneers of brain computer interaction and biomedical engineering, developmental psychologists, mathematicians, story writers and designers. Our teachers have decades of combined experience, working with students of all ages and walks of life, from global top 100 universities to developing countries.

 

Team Artha checking the latest field data, as we realize the camera is rolling

We are a fast growing team with strong background in face recognition, machine learning, psychology, education, game development and agile software implementation. 

 

 

Our software developers look back at more than ten years of production experience. We also bring experience from a variety of corporate settings, ranging from heavy weights like Siemens to Start-ups in Europe and China. Check out our page to get to know the team around Little Dragon.

While we love to learn, many of our team members experienced school as a boring and frustrating place - far from ideal. We want to help create a learning environment that we wished for in our childhoods and is still lacking for most kids today.

We are using Affectiva's amazing Affdex SDK for Face Analysis. 

 

Affectiva, an MIT Media Lab spin-out, is a key player in human emotional interaction with computers. We integrate their SDK for face analysis to get a real time picture of the learners emotional expression. Their emotion analytics are - apart from the actual game data - our most valuable data source.

 

 

We will never compromise in protecting your personal data:  it’s yours, and we will ensure that it stays that way.  Our mission includes protecting your privacy, and not commodifying your data.
That's one reason why we are addressing You to get the project started.  

 

 

You are a teacher who is passionate about giving every child a chance to be recognised and flourish in school.  Please share your energy, expertise, and experience so that we can join you on your mission.

You are a progressive parent, maybe with a child in a school that is committed to keeping up to date.  Help us to make your voice heard when it comes to trying new ways to make learning more efficient and happier.

You are a game-/screen-/interaction-designer on the look-out for a great new challenge. Help us to build amazing learning games by contributing your time.

You are into education, psychology or similar field and want to volunteer in a pilot project. Join us in one of many field tests across the globe! 

You are working in the not-for-profit or NGO sector, and see the potential of Little Dragon for a project you know and love. Teach us about it, and see how we can work together to make it better. 

You just want to team up with us to advance the field of personalized education because you know it’s cool and will revolutionise the way we learn!

You aren’t any of the above, and you are interested in Little Dragon. We really want to hear from You.

Please get in touch with us and we can talk about how to work together.

 

 

1. When will Little Dragon be available?

The app will be available for public download at the beginning of 2017. However, we are aiming to deliver a first powerful version of Little Dragon to our backers by Christmas 2016.

2. For what devices will Little Dragon be available for?

We are currently developing the App for iPads running an up-to-date iOS. As resources permit we will extend to other operating systems.  If we exceed our funding target of $50000 by 50 % we will be able to deliver an Android Version as well!

3. What kind of Lesson Content will be available?

To start with we deliver learning activities for preschool and primary school aged children. The flagship content will include activities to support Emotional Intelligence and English Reading (see Learning Content above).  

4. In which languages will Little Dragon be available in?

Little Dragon’s first language will be English, though – being attuned to behaviour and emotional expression - much communication will be nonverbal. Other language versions  will follow.

5. Who can use Little Dragon?

Everybody. At first we are focusing on preschool and primary school kids. Over the longer term we will offer content for all age groups.

6. There is an abundance of learning Apps out there - How is LD different?

Even the most advanced learning apps currently on the market are limited to evaluating performance through mechanical input when adjusting content for the learner. By contrast, Little Dragon also gathers streams of user emotional expression and contextual data to infer state of engagement and adjust the individual child’s learning experience. This is a leap forward in personalising education. 

7. The Data is highly valuable - Do you plan on selling it?

We are not going to sell data to any 3rd party. We protect our users anonymity by strict separation of personal data and learning data. This is important because learning data, especially when enriched with biometric data is a valuable source of information that needs to be protected. Responsible use of data is one motivation for us to start this project.

8. Will Teachers lose their jobs?

Absolutely not. In fact, we can only imagine that with Little Dragon and other such approaches the profession will attract and retain more teachers. Many of our teachers are stretched to breaking point: class sizes, and the impossible task of tailoring their teaching skills to a huge range of learners, is clearly at the heart of the problem. A Guardian survey in March of 2016 found that almost half of the teachers in England plan to leave the profession in the next five years: 82% stated that their workload is unmanageable, and almost three quarters said that the workload has a serious impact on their physical and mental health. Little Dragon will feedback on each student’s progress and teachers can take a more active and informed role in guiding them through school. Teachers will have more time, energy, and mental space to plan more broadly, collaborate with other teachers on innovative activities and ways that technology and other resources can be used. There is unlimited possibility for wonderful synergies between our teachers and Little Dragon.

9. Are kids not already spending too much time on iPads?

We really don’t want to encourage kids and families to be spending more time staring into screens. Our primary emphasis is on well-being. With Little Dragon’s ability to attune to a child’s level of ability and engagement we can make learning happier and more effective. This frees kids and families to do other stuff. So we achieve better screen time, not more screen time.

10. I Have much more questions!

Awesome! Have a look at our website and see if you find your answers there, and/or please contact us!
story_txt:
With Little Dragon learning will never feel the same again. Little Dragon is the first learning app that knows how you feel, making it easier to master concepts and skills. Your children will learn about school subjects and other areas of interest more happily and efficiently. Learning and playing will become closer than ever. Little Dragon does this by constantly reading and responding to your emotions: when things are getting too difficult or too easy, Little Dragon will adjust the content to keep you in an ideal flow of learning.

Focus on each individual child When children are given consistent one-to-one attention they can feel recognised and understood.  
Game based, emotionally intelligent Learning App

One-to-One Tutor that continually improves understanding of your ways of learning through interaction

Funny and ergonomic backpack that will reinforce the relationship of your child with the Little Dragon Tutor

Unparalleled Insights into the experience of learning for better teaching

A Versatile Platform open to 3rd-Party Developer Content
Uncompromising Data Anonymization


Find much more information on our page. 



Our core understanding is that:

Early experiences of learning have profound long lasting effects on our lives
ALL children deserve the best opportunities to learn
Kids naturally love to learn - adults just need to nurture that
All children are unique with their own way of doing things
A ‘one-size fits all’ educational system stifles the joy of learning for most 
Learning and playing can be two sides of the same coin




 

1 - Hello Little Dragon
Inspired by ‘old-school’ tamagotchi ©, Hello Little Dragon is your very own learning buddy in full play mode. Little Dragon is usually happy to see you, though he’ll frown and scowl if the mood takes him - or if you look at him the wrong way.  He’s full of character, makes children smile and encourages them to play and learn.  You can nurture Little Dragon, show him love, and be delighted at how he sees you and responds.
   
   
Little Dragon responds to users states by reading facial expressions. 
 
What's up Little Dragon? (part of Hello LD)
Feelings fuel and colour pretty much all of our experiences, and so we want to help children learn about theirs - the earlier we start to nurture emotional understanding the better.  In our groundbreaking new game - 'What's up Little Dragon?' -  our cute and curious hero will accompany his little human learner in exploring everyday situations and the emotions that come along.
We’re confident that kids and parents alike will enjoy and learn from this game and excited to get your feedback and input.  What’s most emotionally challenging for your child?  Maybe we can work together to help all of our kids make sense of their feelings and thrive in making friends and enjoying relationships.  
 
2 - English Reading Games
English is the most studied language on the planet and, while it is notoriously difficult, smooth acquisition of the ability to read English underpins the general experience of school and has lifelong implications. Accordingly, our first set of traditional ‘academic’  learning content takes kids to other worlds where the alphabet and sounds of letters await in a range of fun games. 
In designing this flagship content we have worked with a range of national reviews, policies, and approaches to teaching.  Our cutting-edge contribution to this highly contentious field of education will integrate a range of existing best practices with the entirely new Little Dragon interface.  

Little Dragon hatches. Let's unlock these other planets together … literally ,-) 3 - MY LITTLE DRAGON backpack
This puppet and case evolved from the starting point of bringing Little Dragon more to life by giving him a body.  iPads are cool, but they’re not very huggable. 
Our Little Dragon Puppet really has life.  When our designer and seamstress Jina made the first one, not only was it hugged within minutes of being introduced to our little learners, but we realised it was also a backpack.  The next part of My Little Dragon's life was when we recognised its ergonomic properties: as an iPad stand it helps your child avoid slouching into poor postures, huddled over a tablet for example, protecting against neck and back strain.  Win win.  We can't wait to see your My Little Dragon stories unfold!



My Little Dragon unlimited edition: Body, Backpack, and Ergonomic Case

 

4 - Buy One - Donate one
We are especially committed to reaching the kids on the fringes: the ones whose ‘special educational needs’ challenge teachers and parents the most, and the many at risk of being left behind.  This means working with those at the front line in ways that they need.  Our newest initiative is a partnership with a learning centre for refugee children under UNHCR in Malaysia.

story:
An acceptance to Uppsala University is a big deal, Uppsala is on the lists of the 100 best universities in the world and the program that I applied to only accept 14% of the applicants (The proof that I was accepted to the masters program at Uppsala University can be found in the gallery) But not only is the university a great choice but for someone like me who are passionate about renewable electricity, Sweden really is the place to go to. Sweden makes green technology a big priority and because of that the country has become the first country in Europe to meet the renewable energy targets that was set by the EU for 2020. Sweden already met those goals 2012, eight years before schedule! (http://www.swedishcleantech.se/english/cleantechsectors/renewableenergy.4.32e88512143a838073927fe.html) 

My country Brazil is a developing country and it’s struggling with developing infrastructure that both is sustainable but also meets all the needs of the people. This is something my higher education in Uppsala could prepare me to start changing. Brazil is one of the most financially unequal countries in the world and only around 30% of kids in school continues to high school. My country needs a change and I know I can contribute to that change. 

You might wonder why I can’t pay for the education myself but here is the truth, I come from a working class family, but my mother happens to prioritize education. She was a professor before she retired, but retired people in Brazil don’t really get a good enough pension so I have to help my family out every month. I have a stable job in a government owned company, but it doesn’t pay much compared to the salaries in North America or Europe. Compared to those standards I earn close to nothing. I need your help to be able to do this. 

My plan is to get a doctors degree in renewable electricity production, hopefully in Sweden and after that I want to open the first factory in Latin America that produces solar panels. There is a high demand in Brazil for solar panels, but it’s expensive especially right now when we all know about the political situation here in Brazil. People have a demand and a need, but it’s just not sufficiently met by my society. I know I have the ability to contribute to my society. 

I also want to help people like me one day, maybe even some day I can create a foundation that can give out scholarships for higher education. It all comes down to will I be able to get the education and the advanced knowledge I need to really make this happen? This is where you come into the picture. With your help I can do this!  

What I have done so far 

  • I have a bachelors degree in electrical engineering at Franca University
  • I have worked at Eletrobras Furnas for 10 years
  • I received a scholarship through the Brazilian governmental program  Science without Boarders. They stopped giving out scholarships one or two years ago due to the lack of money in the Brazilian government.
  • Thanks to the scholarship I was able to spend a year in  the U.S., one semester in Jackson, Mississippi and one semester in Fullerton, California.

How you can help and what you can get in return

  • All the money will specifically go to making my masters education happen, which means it will go to my semester tuition fee, insurance and a flight ticket.
  • I will need the total of $19850 USD for one year. The money will be divided on 2 semester tuition fees of $8925 (One academic year $17850). Health insurance costs around $1000 and airplane ticket to Sweden around $1000 USD.
  • My perks are unique, amazing things from my home state in Brazil, from the city Ouro Preto. A historical city which is more than 400 years old.
  • Ouro Preto is the only place in Brazil where they make items out of soap stone. So all the items, except the "namoradeira" sculptures (Woman in the window), are made out of this type of stone.
  • If I don't achieve my goal the money will be returned to you who tried to help me.

Changing lives 

  • By helping me you are NOT just helping me, you are helping my family, my community, my society, because when I return to Brazil, after this masters program, I will be able to make a real contribution to the progress of my society, bringing with me my new knowledge and running new projects in solar systems to produce renewable electricity through photovoltaic systems.
  • One day I want to pass on the opportunity to others by helping them achieving a higher academic education. 


Other ways you help

Please, if you are not able to directly help financially then share this on your social media and help us spread the word under the hashtag #HelpAnderson.
Another way you can help us out by letting us help you! 
Are you thinking about getting solar panels? Then Anderson can guide you through the process and help you come up with an estimate on the price for the project. 
Do you have a small company perhaps and need help with your digital marketing? Maybe you need help with the social media for your company, or maybe you need help with your blog? Then Anna can help you, she is already helping out a scientist  in Stockholm/Sweden with a facebook page about Swedish obstetrics (link to the facebook page www.facebook.com/researchongivingbirth).
If you are interested in hiring us then contact Anna on her Facebook, or Anderson through the contact button on this page.
story_txt:
An acceptance to Uppsala University is a big deal, Uppsala is on the lists of the 100 best universities in the world and the program that I applied to only accept 14% of the applicants (The proof that I was accepted to the masters program at Uppsala University can be found in the gallery) But not only is the university a great choice but for someone like me who are passionate about renewable electricity, Sweden really is the place to go to. Sweden makes green technology a big priority and because of that the country has become the first country in Europe to meet the renewable energy targets that was set by the EU for 2020. Sweden already met those goals 2012, eight years before schedule! (http://www.swedishcleantech.se/english/cleantechsectors/renewableenergy.4.32e88512143a838073927fe.html) 


My country Brazil is a developing country and it’s struggling with developing infrastructure that both is sustainable but also meets all the needs of the people. This is something my higher education in Uppsala could prepare me to start changing. Brazil is one of the most financially unequal countries in the world and only around 30% of kids in school continues to high school. My country needs a change and I know I can contribute to that change. 


You might wonder why I can’t pay for the education myself but here is the truth, I come from a working class family, but my mother happens to prioritize education. She was a professor before she retired, but retired people in Brazil don’t really get a good enough pension so I have to help my family out every month. I have a stable job in a government owned company, but it doesn’t pay much compared to the salaries in North America or Europe. Compared to those standards I earn close to nothing. I need your help to be able to do this. 


My plan is to get a doctors degree in renewable electricity production, hopefully in Sweden and after that I want to open the first factory in Latin America that produces solar panels. There is a high demand in Brazil for solar panels, but it’s expensive especially right now when we all know about the political situation here in Brazil. People have a demand and a need, but it’s just not sufficiently met by my society. I know I have the ability to contribute to my society. 


I also want to help people like me one day, maybe even some day I can create a foundation that can give out scholarships for higher education. It all comes down to will I be able to get the education and the advanced knowledge I need to really make this happen? This is where you come into the picture. With your help I can do this!  
What I have done so far 

I have a bachelors degree in electrical engineering at Franca University
I have worked at Eletrobras Furnas for 10 years
I received a scholarship through the Brazilian governmental program  Science without Boarders. They stopped giving out scholarships one or two years ago due to the lack of money in the Brazilian government.
Thanks to the scholarship I was able to spend a year in  the U.S., one semester in Jackson, Mississippi and one semester in Fullerton, California.

How you can help and what you can get in return
All the money will specifically go to making my masters education happen, which means it will go to my semester tuition fee, insurance and a flight ticket.


I will need the total of $19850 USD for one year. The money will be divided on 2 semester tuition fees of $8925 (One academic year $17850). Health insurance costs around $1000 and airplane ticket to Sweden around $1000 USD.
My perks are unique, amazing things from my home state in Brazil, from the city Ouro Preto. A historical city which is more than 400 years old.
Ouro Preto is the only place in Brazil where they make items out of soap stone. So all the items, except the "namoradeira" sculptures (Woman in the window), are made out of this type of stone.

If I don't achieve my goal the money will be returned to you who tried to help me.    Changing lives 
By helping me you are NOT just helping me, you are helping my family, my community, my society, because when I return to Brazil, after this masters program, I will be able to make a real contribution to the progress of my society, bringing with me my new knowledge and running new projects in solar systems to produce renewable electricity through photovoltaic systems.
One day I want to pass on the opportunity
to others by helping them achieving a higher academic education. 


Other ways you help
Please, if you are not able to directly help financially then share this on your social media and help us spread the word under the hashtag #HelpAnderson.
Another way you can help us out by letting us help you! 
Are you thinking about getting solar panels? Then Anderson can guide you through the process and help you come up with an estimate on the price for the project. 
Do you have a small company perhaps and need help with your digital marketing? Maybe you need help with the social media for your company, or maybe you need help with your blog? Then Anna can help you, she is already helping out a scientist  in Stockholm/Sweden with a facebook page about Swedish obstetrics (link to the facebook page www.facebook.com/researchongivingbirth).
If you are interested in hiring us then contact Anna on her Facebook, or Anderson through the contact button on this page.

story: Connected to a celebrity? - Unlocking Lineage -
story_txt: Connected to a celebrity? - Unlocking Lineage -

story:
Radio King Academy

RKO Academy is our community arts school.  It was set up to provide opportunities for individuals within local communities who share the immense passion for the art of music and broadcast media (radio production) as we do here at RKO. What we believe we are doing in effect is bridging the growing gap between the entertainment industry and the people. We designed a course that is flexible and designed to meet the needs of people of various ages and radio interest levels. Our courses are integral in helping build up participants with their confidence in recognising their passions and progressively pursuing careers in their chosen fields.

Reaching our crowd funder target means we can offer up to 10 schools our services by the end of 2017;  positively effecting the lives of up to 250 young people. 

What We Need & What You Get

We aim to raise £30,000 for Radio King Academy, this will go towards tutor costs, digital  broadcast equipment and administrative materials such as memory sticks, electronic Whiteboards and electronic notepads  that can be used in our practical and theory based sessions. 

We have exciting Unique perks on offer for all contributing financially. Our perks include  1 Year RKO Event Access, Sponsored Radio Shows, RKO Broadcast Day, RKO Merchandise, Broadcast Days at Your Residence.

The Impact

As a contributor to Radio King Academy you not only get to witness the progression of our project but will be directly responsible for positively changing the lives of young people who may be on the periphery of being at risk. Your kind contributions means Radio King Academy can make a significant contribution to addressing a number of the pressing issues faced by our young people.

We've had the opportunity to work with youth centres and schools all across London. We are fortunate to work with exclusion schools using our skills to boost students confidence preparing them to return to mainstream schools with a better understanding and awareness of being responsible and positively creative. Below is a live example of our courses in action and the Radio documentary that was created from the project.

A Day with Vital Youth (Westminster) https://vimeo.com/108993944

Master The Word Radio Documentary:  https://soundcloud.com/create-3/master-the-word-radio-documentar

 

Risks & Challenges

Working with young people and industry standard technology means we are privy face the risks and obstacles such as:

  • Safeguarding for young people
  • loss or damage of equipment

Our solutions:

Reaching our fundraising target will mean that we can ensure that all tutors involved in delivering courses can be fully DBS checked and approved. Disclosure and Barring checks is a national mandatory requirement when working with young people.

Ensuring that our equipments are fully insured under all occasions is a solution to overcome damage or loss.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially. Here are other ways you can help :

  • Word of mouth; Spread the word amongst your networks, friends and family.
  • Share our Indiegogo page on your social media networks whether Twitter, Instagram, SnapChat, FaceBook  or any other Social media platform with an audience.

Thank You for your time and support :)

Radio King Academy

story:
En Français ci dessous:

English:

From earth and clay

Hey dear friends, My name is Mohamed Zied GHARBI, and i'm a Tunisian architect and founder of " from Earth & Clay" and NGO which aim to promote the raw earth construction in Tunisia.

This mode of sustainable construction has several virtues, that they are environmental, social or economic, seen that we can find this raw material  just under our feet and that it belongs to everybody

I discovered the raw earth architecture through workshops, and it was the love at first sight(lightning stroke). So I decided that I was going to make it as my job and my commitment. That's why I had the idea to be candidate for a diploma of specialization in earth architecture  in France, to be capable of training(forming) future architects and  builders of raw earth construction, because in Tunisia we need it especially in rural areas.

I was accepted to do this  specialisation in  earth architecture,I was accepted to make this  specialization in raw earth architecture, it's the only available studies  which exists in the world with  MIT(MASSACHUSETTS INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY) in the USA and they  accepts only 22 students every two years, thus it is a privilege to be among them,

but stays the financial barrier which block me to realize this objective for myself and my country.

That's why I launched this crowdfunding compaign to collect money ti be able to star my studies.
I count on you my friends, thank you in advance and see you soon.

 

costs:


_ Visa for France: 80 euro

_Travel costs: 200 euro 
_ University fees for the first year: 980 euro 

+ CVEC ( contribution to the sudent comunity): 90 euro
_  Accommodation : 400 euro per month = 1200 euro for the first 3 month

_ Overall living costs for the first three month: 3650 euro (according to the french consulat in Tunisia)

those turn out to be: 6200 euro to start my studies

converted to USD: about 7250 $

 

Here is the link to the official website of the  raw earth construction studies: 

http://craterre.org/enseignement:dsa-architectu...

 

Again, I am very grateful for you taking the time to view this. If you have any further questions, please feel free to reach out to me :)

Email: ziedgharbi90@gmail.com

 

Français:

de Terre & d'Argile

Je suis Mohamed Zied GHARBI, Architecte Tunisien et président de l'association " de Terre & d'Argile" une association qui a pour objectif la promotion de la construction en terre crue en Tunisie.

Ce mode de construction durable a plusieurs vêtus, qu'elles soient environnementales, sociales ou économiques, vu que sa matière première se trouve juste sous nos pieds et qu'elle appartient à tout le monde.

J'ai découvert la terre crue à travers des chantiers participatifs, et cela été un coup de foudre. Donc j'ai décidé que j'allais en faire mon métier et mon engagement. C'est pour cela que j'ai eu l'idée de candidater pour un diplôme de spécialisation en terre crue en France, pour être apte à former de futurs architectes et bâtisseurs de la terre crue, car en Tunisie nous en avons besoin surtout dans les zones rurales.

J'ai été accepté  pour faire cette formation de spécialisation en terre crue ,en sachant que c'est la seul formation qui existe dans le monde avec celle de l'MIT au USA et que cette formation n'accepte que 22 étudiants chaque deux ans, donc c'est un privilège d’être parmi eux, mais reste la barrière financière qui m’empêche de réaliser cet objectif pour moi-même et mon pays.

C'est pour cela que j'ai lancé cette compagne de crowdfunding pour collecter de quoi demarer ma formation.

Je compte sur vous mes amis, merci d'avance et à bientôt.

coûts:


_ Visa pour la France: 80 euro

_ coût du voyage : 200 euro
_ frais d'inscription : 980 euro 

+ CVEC ( contribution à la vie étudiante et de campus): 90 euro
_  logement : 400 euro/mois = 1200 euro pour les trois premier mois

_ coût de la vie en générale : 3650 euro (d’après les information communiqué par le consulat de France en Tunisie)

cela fait : 6200 euro pour commencer mes etudes.

Converti en dollar americain: 7250 $

Voici le lien vers le site officiel  de la formation DSA, Architecture de terre, cultures constructives et développement durable que je vais entamer:

http://craterre.org/enseignement:dsa-architectu...

Encore une fois, merci d'avoir pris le temps de lire, et si vous avez d'autre questions vous pouvez me contacter sur mon adresse mail ci-dessous :)

Email: ziedgharbi90@gmail.com

story:
About Me.

Firstly, THANK YOU for visiting my page. I'm humbled that you are reading my pitch.

I'm Felix Brunger, former DJ, now a professional actor and soon to be acting student.

This is my story...

 

Six years ago, after a successful career in music, I decided to take my first acting class. It had been a long time coming since my last one in secondary school. Five classes later (petrified but absolutely hooked) I found myself enrolling on a 16-week course training in the Miesner Technique at The Actors' Temple, London. It was a complete roller coaster but I loved every second. On completion, I went out fresh into the industry and had the good fortune of being cast in many professional projects. Significant highlights included the one-man show, ‘The Anorak’, 'My Favourite Madman' at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival and short film 'In Retrospect'. Following  these successes I signed with an agent.

Since finding my life path, my desire to train at an accredited drama school has been paramount. In pursuit of producing work of the highest level of artistic quality, this postgraduate diploma is instrumental in my development. It will support my commitment to pursuing the study and craft of acting. Deepening my knowledge I will be prepared for expertise in critical analysis; expanding my understanding of it's historical and cultural context.

Your investment is a means of transformation for me. You will not only be contributing to my development as a student in the classroom, but postgraduation your help will enable a foundation to create excellent work. It will open doors for me in theatre, film, television and radio.

One goal post training is to continue to write and produce my own work with my seedling production company, The Faculty Productions. It’s aim is to produce new exciting cross platform work with the spirit of collaboration at it’s heart

https://www.felixbrunger.com/

https://www.actorstemple.com/

 

What this Training means to mean:

Fact : Accredited Drama schools are notoriously tough to gain places at.

The chances are slim, with on average a few thousand hopefuls auditioning at each school for one of the coveted 12 or so places. Do the maths and you'll see that this opportunity is EPIC! 

Good training lays down the groundwork from which to excel from. Not only will I have an extensive toolbox of skills in which to create from, I'll also be mentored by some of the top teachers in the profession, who are all working and relevant in the profession. The process will enable me to work in many different acting based environments with confidence, knowledge, a spirit of enquiry and with my imagination.  

Drama schools like DSL offer a stamp of recognition and quality with in a highly competitive industry. In such a high risk environment with tight budgets and limited time; casting directors, producers and directors need to have absolute confidence in the talent they select. I believe this training would reinforce my development as an emerging actor, and enable me to take my work to the next level.

Drama Studio London ( DSL)

Drama Studio London is a founding member of the Federations of Drama Schools in the UK - one of the 20 accredited schools which offer the highest standard of training in the vocational drama sector. It has an established reputation, with notable alumni including Emily Watson ( OBE), Forest Whitaker and Pip Torrens. https://www.dramastudiolondon.co.uk/

The Nitty Gritty

The total cost of my course is £14,723 ( including Trinity Exams) -  I'll be applying for a Career Development Loan, as sadly there is no Student Finance available for this course. The maximum I can apply for being £10,000 (roughly 80%) if successful, and it all needs to be paid back when the course is complete. 

I've never been shy of grafting or working hard for something I believe in, so along side this campaign, Yours Truly is brightening up the days of many a confused tourist in Covent garden, working full time in a restaurant ( Meryl Streep waited tables to pay for Yale don't cha know!). In addition to this I have planned to work part time during my training to support myself. Due to the intense nature of the course, it may not always be an option. However I am willing to try!

Why £3000 and not the whole thing?

After much thought, I've decided to pitch my campaign at an amount I hope can be realistically achieved in the small time frame of 8 weeks - with kind and generous support.  

If I were to break this goal however, it would be an absolute bonus as every penny goes towards the course fees and extras needed:

Here is a list of some of the Extras:

Books, play scripts,  practice kit, jazz shoes & trainers, stationary, weekly travel costs, food, theatre trips organised by DSL, graduation Head Shots, spotlight casting /imbd profile /Equity Membership.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not everyone is in a position to make a donation. BUT ... If you like my campaign and believe in the cause, please do share the love with a Tweet, a shout out on Facebook or simply spread the word.

I'm in absolute GRATITUDE for all your efforts and hope you enjoy the ride with me!

Much love,

Felix xxx

Some T's & C's Folks :

I want you to get the most out of your perks as you deserve the BEST!.

Please do send me correct email details for me to reward you with your treats & credits!. I'd like to stay GREEN to help the planet - so I'll be sending  rewards in digital form/Electronically where ever I can.

IndieGoGo will not ask you for Social Media profile names, so feel free to send me your Twitter/ Facebook handles so I can find you online. If you don't have social media, don't worry - You will still get shout outs & credits.

For Exclusive Yoga Class:  Divine yoga teacher Sadie Tonks will be leading the flow at Yotopia in the heart of Covent Garden ( 3 mins walk from Covent Garden tube). Mats and equipment will be provided. Feel free to bring a bottle of water and a towel as we are gonna sweat!) Full details to follow. Check out the studio website & Sadie's Instagram page here : https://www.instagram.com/sadiemtonks/?hl=en http://yotopia.co.uk/ .

*If you are unable to make the event after pledging, I'm sadly not able to offer refunds. I'm fully committed to fulfilling this pledge, but in the unlikely event of circumstances out of our control, I would have the right to substitute teachers. You would of course be notified in advance. 

This is a private event so any questions regarding it, please get in touch with me directly not the studio.

Invited Audience:  This PRIVATE link is for you. I kindly request refraining from posting it prior to the official release. Enjoy the privacy - I made it especially for you! 

For Patrons - Let's hang!  Your Special live performance and Q&A with me will take place at an agreed time & location with in the London area. If London is not an option for you, no problem let's SKYPE. Or I'm more than happy to negotiate travel arrangements with you outside of London if appropriate for both parties.  Our Q&A will give you the chance to ask me as many questions as you like related to my work and training. The session will be recorded. 

I do hope you enjoy your Gifts as much as I did creating them for you!

https://www.felixbrunger.com/
https://www.actorstemple.com/
 
What this Training means to mean:
Fact : Accredited Drama schools are notoriously tough to gain places at.
The chances are slim, with on average a few thousand hopefuls auditioning at each school for one of the coveted 12 or so places. Do the maths and you'll see that this opportunity is EPIC! 
Good training lays down the groundwork from which to excel from. Not only will I have an extensive toolbox of skills in which to create from, I'll also be mentored by some of the top teachers in the profession, who are all working and relevant in the profession. The process will enable me to work in many different acting based environments with confidence, knowledge, a spirit of enquiry and with my imagination.  
Drama schools like DSL offer a stamp of recognition and quality with in a highly competitive industry. In such a high risk environment with tight budgets and limited time; casting directors, producers and directors need to have absolute confidence in the talent they select. I believe this training would reinforce my development as an emerging actor, and enable me to take my work to the next level.
Drama Studio London ( DSL)
Drama Studio London is a founding member of the Federations of Drama Schools in the UK - one of the 20 accredited schools which offer the highest standard of training in the vocational drama sector. It has an established reputation, with notable alumni including Emily Watson ( OBE), Forest Whitaker and Pip Torrens. https://www.dramastudiolondon.co.uk/
The Nitty Gritty
The total cost of my course is £14,723 ( including Trinity Exams) -  I'll be applying for a Career Development Loan, as sadly there is no Student Finance available for this course. The maximum I can apply for being £10,000 (roughly 80%) if successful, and it all needs to be paid back when the course is complete. 
I've never been shy of grafting or working hard for something I believe in, so along side this campaign, Yours Truly is brightening up the days of many a confused tourist in Covent garden, working full time in a restaurant ( Meryl Streep waited tables to pay for Yale don't cha know!). In addition to this I have planned to work part time during my training to support myself. Due to the intense nature of the course, it may not always be an option. However I am willing to try!
Why £3000 and not the whole thing?
After much thought, I've decided to pitch my campaign at an amount I hope can be realistically achieved in the small time frame of 8 weeks - with kind and generous support.  
If I were to break this goal however, it would be an absolute bonus as every penny goes towards the course fees and extras needed:
Here is a list of some of the Extras:
Books, play scripts,  practice kit, jazz shoes & trainers, stationary, weekly travel costs, food, theatre trips organised by DSL, graduation Head Shots, spotlight casting /imbd profile /Equity Membership.
 
Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not everyone is in a position to make a donation. BUT ... If you like my campaign and believe in the cause, please do share the love with a Tweet, a shout out on Facebook or simply spread the word.
I'm in absolute GRATITUDE for all your efforts and hope you enjoy the ride with me!
Much love,
Felix xxx
Some T's & C's Folks :I want you to get the most out of your perks as you deserve the BEST!.Please do send me correct email details for me to reward you with your treats & credits!. I'd like to stay GREEN to help the planet - so I'll be sending  rewards in digital form/Electronically where ever I can.IndieGoGo will not ask you for Social Media profile names, so feel free to send me your Twitter/ Facebook handles so I can find you online. If you don't have social media, don't worry - You will still get shout outs & credits.For Exclusive Yoga Class:  Divine yoga teacher Sadie Tonks will be leading the flow at Yotopia in the heart of Covent Garden ( 3 mins walk from Covent Garden tube). Mats and equipment will be provided. Feel free to bring a bottle of water and a towel as we are gonna sweat!) Full details to follow. Check out the studio website & Sadie's Instagram page here : https://www.instagram.com/sadiemtonks/?hl=en http://yotopia.co.uk/ .*If you are unable to make the event after pledging, I'm sadly not able to offer refunds. I'm fully committed to fulfilling this pledge, but in the unlikely event of circumstances out of our control, I would have the right to substitute teachers. You would of course be notified in advance. This is a private event so any questions regarding it, please get in touch with me directly not the studio.Invited Audience:  This PRIVATE link is for you. I kindly request refraining from posting it prior to the official release. Enjoy the privacy - I made it especially for you! For Patrons - Let's hang!  Your Special live performance and Q&A with me will take place at an agreed time & location with in the London area. If London is not an option for you, no problem let's SKYPE. Or I'm more than happy to negotiate travel arrangements with you outside of London if appropriate for both parties.  Our Q&A will give you the chance to ask me as many questions as you like related to my work and training. The session will be recorded. I do hope you enjoy your Gifts as much as I did creating them for you!

story:
IN SPANISH

"Viajando por la Educación" es un proyecto que recorre Latinoamérica en vehículo, visitando y filmando escuelas alternativas al modelo de aprendizaje tradicional. Con el objetivo de llegar a México y realizar un documental sobre las escuelas visitadas. Actualmente estoy en Colombia y quiero cruzar a Panamá, pero se corta la carretera Panamericana, sólo se puede cruzar el vehículo en barco. Este video es para poder recaudar fondos para pagar el traslado y así poder continuar el proyecto por América Central. Muchas gracias!

IN ENGLISH
"Traveling through Education" is a project that goes through Latin America by vehicle, visiting and filming alternative schools, different from the traditional learning model. The objective is to reach Mexico collecting information that can then be used to make a documentary about the schools visited. I am currently in Colombia and I want to cross to Panama, but the Pan-American Highway is no longer going through the border of Colombia and Panama; you can only cross the vehicle by boat!
This video includes some information about the first 3 years of the project. It has been prepared to help raise funds to pay for the cross over to Panama and so to make it possiblle to continue the project through Central America and reach Mexico! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

OUR VISION 

Let's Imagine is a non-profit organization that offers education to youth across the globe focusing on self-empowerment, emotional wellbeing and nature-connection.

OUR MISSION 

Our mission is to create sustainable solutions by teaching youth to have compassion for themselves, their communities and the environment.

Y.A.E CURRICULUM 

The curriculum that we have developed blends yoga, art and earth-based learning. 

Why Yoga - 

Yoga, through breath and awareness, provides space to step back and regulate your response to stress in a calm and thoughtful manner. Studies have shown that yoga can help build a sense of optimism. This in return has a positive impact on academic and social development.  

Why Art -

If yoga is the journey to the self, art is the truest expression of the self. Yoga connects us to the creative potential that dwells within, while art enables us to manifest and express infinite creative possibilities. 

Albert Einstein said, "Creativity is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited, whereas imagination embraces the entire world, stimulating progress, giving birth to evolution." We do not quote Einstein to discredit knowledge, but rather to raise awareness to the importance of creativity.

We trust that art helps foster emotional development of a child and encourages children to think creatively.

Why Earth-based practices -

Earth-based practices complete the circle in the powerful trifecta of teaching yoga, earth, and art; it is both the beginning, where the seed is planted, and the end, where the fruit has blossomed. We aim to guide children towards remembering their roots in the natural world by facilitating educational experiences in nature.

Why is this campaign important?

Let's Imagine is hosting our first free yoga camp program in Lovina, North Bali,Indonesia. Let's Imagine has partnered with Bali Children Foundation to host yoga camps to local Balinese youth.

The sustainability of this project is a huge value of ours and to help ensure a lasting impact, we created a scholarship to help students continue their yoga education in the hope that job opportunities in this field can unfold.  

This scholarship will not only benefit the selected student, but also their community as they are invited to come back to our future yoga camps to teach and share their path. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $5,500.00 to cover the cost of a full scholarship for Ratih, a local Balinese student, to attend a 200 hour yoga teacher training. In return, you will receive a Mudras for Health and Healing Coloring Book. 

Unique Perks

“You can’t live a perfect day until you do something for someone who will never be able to repay you.” -John Wooden 

By purchasing our Mudra Coloring Book, you help make it possible for Ratih to attend a yoga teacher training. Beyond this, you'll receive a coloring and journaling book that has been designed with love.

This coloring book will break down a handful of mudras, which are hand gestures used during meditation that carry specific goals of channeling your body’s energy flow. For our first coloring book, we have selected commonly used mudras that have been championed for centuries for their efficiency in providing health and empowerment.

This intricate, artful coloring book will teach you about different mudras, their benefits, how to use them and when to use them. The mudra drawings were hand drawn by artist and Let's Imagine volunteer, Curt Bean. Get lost in your design and learn to heal yourself with the help of powerful mudras! 

*Please note that in addition to the cost of the Mudra Coloring Book ($15.00), we kindly ask for $5.00 for shipping within the U.S. and $8.00 for international shipping. 

Where will the funds go if we do not reach our goal?

If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds will be stored in our 'Let's Imagine Scholarship Fund', where they will remain until we receive adequate funding to cover the cost of a yoga teacher training.

The Impact

Since our first yoga camp, Ratih showed a commitment to learning yoga.

Ratih is deeply passionate to continue her yoga journey and further her yoga education. If granted this scholarship, she would give back to her local community by sharing her knowledge. She would be qualified to be a yoga teacher at future Let's Imagine camps, which we believe would help our organization have an even stronger impact on Balinese youth. Ratih will be a role model for her fellow peers and the younger students.

Risks & Challenges

Some risks we might face are not raising enough to reach our goal of providing Ratih a full scholarship to attend a yoga teacher training. Perhaps we also risk yoga schools not accepting Ratih into their program. 

However, we are both confident and optimistic that we will reach our fundraising goal. Aside from this campaign, we can also host donation based yoga classes and events to help us reach our goal. Additionally, we will ask local studios in Bali if they could offer a discounted rate for our scholarship recipient. We are relentless in our pursuit to find a school that is both fitting for and accepting of Ratih and our future scholarship recipients. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot purchase a Mudras for Health and Healing Coloring Book today, you can still help! 

Here's How:

·        Spread the word! - talk about our campaign with your friends, family, colleagues and network. 

·        Share it on social media - Promote our campaign and tag us on your social media accounts to reach an even larger network

story:
Party Like It's 2001

Life is short--and worth celebrating. So I've decided to throw a high-school reunion. 

On August 27th 2016, Brighton High's class of 2001 will hold its 15-year reunion at Snowbird resort. But here's the catch--we're only going to do it if enough people sign up--we need at least 75. If we don't hit our goal, no one has to pay and we'll try again in 5 years:)

If you want to come, now's the time to sign up and front the money. You can also sponsor additional aspects of the party if you're inclined to contribute beyond the minimum level. 

Anyone can contribute, but only those who attended Brighton High School in Utah anytime from 1999 to 2001 (and their significant other) may attend this event. 


Why Get Together

It seems our society values direct interaction and tradition less and less. I think our relationships are worth maintaining, and our milestones are worth celebrating.


How To Order & Reserve Your Spot

Enter the right amount and donate in this campaign, and make sure to NOT donate anonymously:). You can also select a perk level rather than entering a specific amount, and just buy that perk.

The Budget

I've not spent a lot of time shopping. Sorry. I hate shopping:)
Snowbird rooms cost $400 to rent, and catering costs will be $41 per plate plus tax and service charge (which comes to $53.30). 
Indiegogo and Merchant Services have to take their cuts as well. Yes that costs each of us a little more money to use these services, but I think it's the best alternative. I don't think it's fair to ask any one person to front significant sums of money--that responsibility should fall to the group as a whole. 
At 75 people, our cost per person should be about $64.  
Our cost per person drops as more people sign up. So share this campaign and sign up if you can make it. If you would like to sponsor something additional--whether you'll make it or not--you can also do that in this campaign. 
This campaign is not meant to be profitable. Should we have additional budget, I will use those funds to spruce up the reunion, or distribute refunds. I reserve the right to make that determination on my own.

Other Ways You Can Help

I don't have time to produce an elaborate event. I'll run the finances and provide 100% transparency, and hire Snowbird to cater the event for us. That's basically it. If you are part of our graduating class (whether directly, through marriage, or some other material way) you can volunteer to help. If we want decorations, DJ, video, slide show, contests, awards, etc--please contact me and let me know what you want to be in charge of. (Or, if you donate to fund one of the extras which I can outsource, I'll handle that).

If you or your business can donate items for prizes, please contact me to do so.
