story:
Helping is a challenge and the challenge is for all

Our students needs chairs, desks, shelves for books and a proper yard to play.

Retos El Salvador is a group of young people committed to our country. The goal as an association is to improve the quality of education and contribute to the development of communities across the country that have economical needs. We help them to overcome this situation for that reason we are willing to take all the challenges.

In late 2013 and early 2014, Retos was managing and working in Reto # 1, which aim was to support the Centro Escolar Caserio Coquiamita, Sonsonate. The project was divided into two phases: school support and community support. For the first stage, the infrastructure of the school was improved where 50 students were beneficiaries. In the second phase more than 165 peoplewas provided  with drinking water and health and nutrition issues.

The 2015 Challenge, Retos #2, consists in collecting funds to provide assistance to the Complejo Educativo canton San Lucas; located in Sonsonate, El Salvador.

The amount collected will be used to improve the infrastructure of the educational complex. In addition, Retos has an alliance with FEPADE that intends to invest the same amount collected for the quality of education.

We are committed to the development of this community through education. We want a better future for our children. That's why we are acting right now, you can be part of this challenge too.



Retos El Salvador es un grupo de jóvenes comprometidos con nuestro país. El objetivo como asociación es mejorar la calidad de la educación y con ello, contribuir al desarrollo de las comunidades del país que presentan carencias económicas. Queremos ayudarlos a salir adelante, y para ellos, estamos dispuestos a asumir todos los desafíos.

A finales de 2013 y principios de 2014, Retos estuvo gestionando y trabajando en el Reto #1, cuyo objetivo era dar apoyo al Centro Escolar Caserío Coquiamita, Sonsonate. El proyecto se dividió en dos fases: ayuda a escuela y apoyo a la comunidad. Para la primera etapa, se mejoró la infraestructura del centro escolar en donde 50 alumnos resultaron beneficiarios. En la segunda fase, se apoyó a más de 165 personas con agua potable y temas de salud y nutrición.

El Reto para el año 2015, Reto # 2, consiste en la recaudación de fondos para brindar  ayuda al complejo educativo cantón San Lucas; ubicado en Sonsonate, El Salvador.  

El monto recaudado se destinará a mejorar la infraestructura del complejo educativo. Además, Retos posee una alianza con FEPADE que propone invertir la misma cantidad recolectada para infraestructura en capacitación y calidad educativa.

Estamos comprometidos con el desarrollo de esta comunidad, por medio de la educación.  Queremos un mejor futuro para nuestros niños y jóvenes. Es por eso que estamos actuando desde ya, tú también puedes ser parte de este reto.

story:
Online Refugee Forum: Short Summary

At this moment more and more refugees make the step from their insecure homelands to the safe haven that Europe seems to be. However, as the European countries seem not to be able to provide answers on what will happen next with the refugees; we might provide them with an online tool to help themselves.

At the moment refugees have few information about their travels and destinations and because of this human traffickers take their last money to help them with this. With our online platform we hope to free the refugees from needing to spend their last money on those scams human traffickers play on them.

What do we think refugees need:

A daily updated map of Europe to plan their travel

  • With prices for transport (buses, trains) and/or transport that will be provided by the different national governments.
  • Information on border controls and borders that might be closed.
  • Information about camps and other places to sleep on the route.
  • Information on how the different countries will welcome refugees.

A platform to share information

  • As people from different countries, languages and religions might want to share their personal stories with each other. To give new refugees an idea how the European countries will welcome them, how the camps look like and what kind of change they will have in a specific country on staying their.
  • As the refugees might look for lost family members and communicate with the home countries to see in what way they might unite with them again.

An overview about the possible new homelands

  • How are the European countries planning to take in the refugees.
  • What are the religious and moral standings in the different countries. To give refugees the change to adapt.

In general: An online forum made for and with refugees to empower them to make their own choices and to let them help each other.

Online Refugee Forum: What We Need

To setup the online platform we need funds for:

  • Creating a responsive forum website where refugees can communicate with each other, where we can add information.
  • Translating the forum from English to French, German and Arabic.
  • Financial support to contact persons (refugees themselves) in countries & camps in the European countries. To receive trustworthy information from first hand to update the website.

Online Refugee Forum: Ways You Can Help

In what way we would like you to help us?

  • Please fund us! Even the smallest amount can make a difference!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share our story on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Tell your friends, colleagues and family members about this campaign!

Try to imagine to be one of them. Lost and with few or no money in a strange country, running away from wars, suppression and/or poverty!

story:
Index

  1. Project Summary
  2. Project Description
  3. About Me
  4. Why It Needs To Be Funded?
  5. Equipments and Expenses
  6. Project Routeplan
  7. Gifts
  8. Timeline

Dreaming is nice. Who doesn’t dream? Everywhere, eyery moment we dream many things. This project was also a dream. And waited for more than two years.



I’m a teacher. Science teacher. A teacher’s dream is just about children. About their thoughts, feelings, moods… When you look into the eyes of a child, you see the purity, sincerity, innocence to the finest details. This project needs to be funded, because it will make you feel their worlds. 




As I said, I am a teacher. I'm trying to improve myself constantly. I love to look at the flow of life. I love to produce, to create something. I researched variety ways to satisfy my creation instinct. I got this feeling and force, and the second time I finished university. I studied Photography and Camera Operation in Anadolu University. I graduated from university in May 25, 2015 as high honour student with CGPA 3.89/4.00. (97.25/100) Here is my international diploma supplement:



In Turkey, teachers’ salaries are less than $750. That’s why this project really needs to be funded. I’ll buy necessary equipments for the project with funds. Also i don’t want to realize this dream myself. For these reasons i need for your help. When the project successfully completed, you will receive bills of products with emails. Be a part of this dream.







The project will contain children that have different socio-economic and cultural features.


                                                                         Routeplan

                                          


                                                    

The Eyes of Children Project wil start in Çorum,Turkey. Çorum is a typical Central Anatolian city. In Çorum, you can find a general expression about the majority of children in Turkey. So we’ll start there.


                                    

The second destination is Ankara,Turkey. As you know, Ankara is the capital city of Turkey. Ankara hosts many types of people from many cities. So the city will present a complete mosaic about children.


                                       

The third and last destination is Mersin,Turkey. Mersin is a seaside city near the Mediterranean Sea. It takes immigration depends on easy living conditions. Especially from the East of Turkey. So, the project will contain children that have grown with Eastern culture and seaside culture.

In Mersin, life is cheap and the weather is usually hot. For that reason many Syrian people began to live in Mersin. This project will also contain Syrian children. Their fears, worries, hopes, dreams… maybe their new lifes… in their eyes.

(Logo in gifts photos will be replaced with real project photos.)

First 10 backers ($5) will give their money back. They will also get their gifts !


For $5 Sticker (60mm X 60mm)


For $8 Bookmark (180mm X 55mm)


For $10 Message Card (100mm X 100mm)


For $20 Photo Strip (200mm X 50mm)


For $30 Desk Calendar (290mm X 210mm)

                                          


For $40 Signed Photo Print (400mm X 300mm)


For $50 Photo Block Print (700mm X 500mm)


For $75 Signed Mini Photo Book (90mm X 60mm) (25 pages-50 photographs)


For $100 Signed Photo Book (300mm X 200mm) (22 pages-50 photographs)


For $250  1xPhoto Book + 3xPhoto Blocks + 1xPhoto Print  + 1xDesk Calendar + 1x Photo Strip  + 1xMessage Card + 1xBookmark + 1xSticker


For $500 Credit in Photo Book + 2xPhoto Book + 5xPhoto Blocks + 1xMini Photo Book + 1xPhoto Print  + 1xDesk Calendar + 1x Photo Strip  + 1xMessage Card + 1xBookmark + 1xSticker

story:
Years ago (1999 - 2001), when I was studying Graphic Design, I volunteered in Maloka (www.maloka.org), an interactive museum whose main objective is to spread the science and technology to Bogotá's children through interaction with different modules that are designed by adults (I was one of them). In my experience, I learned that there are creative ways of teaching and appropriating science, technology to generate innovation.

Although Maloka is a great place to learn, there are limitations that prevent us from expanding the great purposes that are planned every day.

I think one of those drawbacks, is that the projects that are addressed there (are produced) require experts, scientists committed to the issues and a lot of money, therefore those magnificent ideas, are left in the pipeline looking for funding.

That problem led me to consider the idea of ​​venturing into politics. With the aim of achieving a better institutional participation of our Government in order to direct resources to the projects that were created in Maloka, I decided to leave the Graphic Design career and know the laws of our country, in order to understand how it is governed and Decisions are made. I studied laws.

As a lawyer, and while I was being trained, that idea has been fueled by more ideas. One of them is the creation of the FabLabs. Today, I work in Congress, close to the processes of creating laws and political force, I see increasingly distant the commitment of our governments to generate a public policy that leads to Colombia, especially its childhood, by the paths of science, technology and innovation.

However, Hope does not disappear. If our government can not, we, the citizens, can achieve it one step at a time. Therefore, it is time to take positive action to start spreading science with the help of technology and generate innovation in children.

Bogotá is a city of about 601,948 children between 4 and 14 years of age. They are wonderful years. Creativity and learning ability are at their best. As a community we must take advantage of that potential, in order to expand it so that our future will be more promising and, thus, gradually achieve the reduction of poverty, which hits the growth and development of our country, start to enter a valve of escape.

In Bogotá, Colombia, there are 3 commercial FabLab and 4 university students. These Bogota children do not have access to a FabLab. Although these spaces of experimentation were conceived for major minds, their essence (creating from nothing and empower the local communities) can be of better benefit in the hands of a child (of course, guided by a responsible and expert adult).

Can you imagine the potential of allowing a child to access a FabLab?

With your help we can take an action to promote a better future for the children of Bogotá, Colombia. Create a FabLab designed for children and used by children for children's learning.

Today we own a dream, which I share with you so that we can make it come true. As the campaign progresses, my commitment is to update better details about CREATINNO, the first FabLab for children in LatAm.

To help us, have fun trying to decode our Fibonacci Rewards System. Adding one to one, we will achieve our goal.

Come, Make it happen!

story:
Huntington was founded by teachers who have been in the teaching field for over 40+ years. The Huntington method for learning is proven to work for all students. We emphasize individualized tutoring for each student. We perform an individualized assessment and recommend tutoring program that is tailored on an individual needs. We make recommendations and get to know the student on an individual basis. We prepare the student for next grade level. We provide homework help and report card help. We provide college preparation by providing SAT/ACT exam preparation. We want to instill core values about education, study skills, help improve motivation and self-confidence into our students. All of our core teachers are certified, have background and a degree in education, and have school teaching experience.

Our Services:  

* core subject tutoring in Math, Writing, and English  

* Homework Help and report card help  

* SAT/ACT Exam Preparation * Help Improve Study Skills  

* Work with schools - work with teachers to improve grade point average

* Any subject tutoring for Physics, Chemistry, History, Geography, any school subject grades 1-12

 

 

 We understand that no two students learn alike. With subjects ranging from reading and writing to math and science, our tutoring programs provide personalized instruction based on each student’s individual needs. Regardless if they are struggling with poor homework habits to difficulties due to ADHD, at Huntington, we’ve helped thousands of students quickly improve their grades and build their confidence. We are dedicated to building academic success that will last a lifetime.

HUNTINGTON LEARNING CENTER REWARDS 

 

 

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello, you wonderful people...

 

My name is Warel. I am a Filipino from Tacloban. I am from a poor family, my parents are simple farmers and we had very little already, but in 2013 we lost absolutely everything to the super typhoon Haiyan. It hit my town the hardest. Against all odds, my passion for education is so strong, I have successfully completed my college studies with two Bachelor degrees: Bachelor of Elementary Education & Bachelor of Science in Nursing.

 

[You can read my full story at the bottom.]

 

Right now, I am working in Hong Kong as private nurse. My references are all really good, I am a diligent learner and hard worker. I have continued my education through workshops, books and online. While employed on a full-time contract, I still managed complete a course in Clinical Biotherapy on the side. So, on the paper, my chances look promising. I have the potential and will power to carry the responsibility for my whole family in the Philippines.

 

I could push my education and career as Registered Nurse to this point. However, my opportunities for growth and further education in Hong Kong are very limited. I therefore want to go to Canada, continue education and work there. I am in touch with the Fanshawe college in Ontario and they would like to take me. I am now humbly asking for your support...

 

 

My Goal

 

My plan and dear wish is to continue my study and work in Ontario/Canada. I chose the Fanshawe College for three reasons:

 

1.) The study times can be aligned with a part time job that allows me to earn money while I am enrolled.

 

2.) Their expertise with international students is impressive and they offer several scholarships of which I hope to get one to help me with costs for the second and third term.

 

3.) They are well-connected with the healthcare industry and can be supportive in the post-graduation phase when I will look for permanent employment.

 

Why 6,000 USD

 

I plan to study the Personal Support Worker​ Program starting in September 2018. The total mandatory fees and tuitions for this 1.5-year-study at Fanshawe are $16,708 Canadian Dollars = $13,008 USD. To get started, I need at least $6,078 USD: 

I need to make a tuition down payment, get a visa and a mandatory health insurance for students.

 

  • Tuition down payment: $5,202 USD
  • Visa: $188 USD
  • Health Insurance: $688 USD

 

Ever since my childhood, I have always worked various jobs to keep myself running. So, I will also be able to cover my basic life expenses (food, place to stay, local transportation) by myself. I am furthermore allowed to take on a 20-h student job. I will also apply for a scholarship.

 

Why support me?

 

I am a hard-working and very responsible person with a life-long passion for caring about others. I am eager to study to develop my skills more and enhance further knowledge so that I can provide better care to others: effectively and efficiently! So, when you help me with my professional education, your help will be going to many more people to which I can offer my care after graduation.

 

When you support me, you support an entire family at the same time: I have taken the responsibility to support my parents (farmers) too. Their health is declining, the days on the field in the hot sunshine are getting harder and harder for them. In February my mother passed out twice already. The family’s hope is on me.

 

I am honest. If you received this campaign link from a friend who met me in person, please ask them to give a testimonial about my character. They will confirm that I have strong values and integrity. I am a spiritual person, I believe in universal values like love and compassion. If you think alike, you may consider me a brother on the path, who you can support at bringing more love and compassion into this world.

 

 

Rewards

 

Your generosity will return to you in many ways. That is my belief. My reward and promise to all of you is, that I will support another student one day. After I graduated and become financially stable, I will make a donation of at least 500.00 USD to a student in need.

 

I am already providing free treatments on Sundays and I will continue to do so in Canada. Especially to impoverished or abandoned elderly. 

 

You will receive frequent updates from my life as a student on this campaign website, at least once per term.

 

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

 

Please help to share my campaign with your families, friends and colleagues. Maybe you are willing to put the link to my campaign to your Facebook timeline, which would allow me to have greater exposure.

 

 

With Love and Gratitude,

 

Warel

 

 

- - - - - - - - - - - - 

My Story

 

 

I always look forward rather than backward and I don’t know any self-pity, instead I am a solution oriented, positive thinking person. But I must mention my past to you, just to the extent that you can understand why my education means so incredibly much to me and my family and why I ask for your help with it.

 

I am Warel Lopez. I come from Tacloban in the Philippines. My family still lives in this region.

 

My parents are farmers with no education beyond elementary school, very little money, a small (and most simple) house and a field to grow vegetables.

 

 

School

 

Since my childhood, I truly believe that education is the key to a good life. Even if it meant great sacrifice, pain and struggles… I would never stop learning. These challenges included: no food in school, no new school shoes and uniform, no school bag but only a plastic bag so I can carry my notebooks and no money for transportation. What I had only were notebook, pen and pencils and myself.

 

At a very young age, I already understand what life is and the importance of education. Even without food, no money for transportation, I just sacrificed everyday so I can learn and acquire knowledge for my future. I only walked from our home to my school for a couple of kilometres away, which was crazy far for a child to walk without food.

 

I never blamed my parents about the situation that we had. Not once. I really understood this already at a very young age: Yes, we are in poverty, but yet my parents are indeed hardworking and they do everything for the best of their children. So, I don’t mind what the people may say, what I care for is to get good education so I can help to uplift our economic status. I can really cross mountains just to have education…

 

Looking back, I still had many wonderful experiences, though it was very hard. During elementary years, I already experienced working as a farmer, street vendor for fish and vegetable, pedicab driver and houseboy so we can just have food on the table.

 

I studied and worked hard until I got my first elementary diploma. But then in high school, I experienced even higher levels of challenges. On top of the privations I experienced bullying. Teachers and students were laughing at me because my shoe was too old and too big for a little young boy. I did not give up my education, studied and worked hard and graduated from high school.

 

 

College

 

There were more challenges when I was in college. My parents could not afford helping me with my schooling. I took the scholarship program from the Commission of Higher Education in the Philippines and the scholarship was granted. I could enrol and study!

 

During university years, I only had 50 pesos or 1 USD every day which was for my transportation only, from our home going to college and back. I was always hungry, but I survived! Then after four years, I took the board exam for teachers and I made it.

 

However my life challenges did not stop there. Even though I was already a professional teacher, I simply could not get a job. Instead of teaching, I worked as a construction labour, street vendor for food, driver and houseboy. In Spite of this crisis I never stopped dreaming big. I was still so thirsty for knowledge. Eventually, I decided to change my career: I took the academic scholarship program in the college of nursing at Colegio de Sta Lourdes of Leyte Foundation and passed this exam as well. The scholarship was granted.

 

When I faced the challenges as a student and life inside the college of nursing, I thought I could not make it, because I had no money for the food in the canteen. My clinical instructor Mrs Eva Blesselda Astorga gave me an opportunity to continue: When she knew about my situation, she paid on my behalf. Silently. I could go on. A few months later, I worked a part-time job parallel to my study so I could support my miscellaneous expenses for the school. To tell you, I never experienced to own books ever since from elementary to my two bachelor degrees. Time passed, I graduated and became a registered nurse.

 

 

After College

 

I was getting stronger inside and confident enough in facing any challenges in life. I went to Manila to look for a job as nurse but I experienced discrimination for my simple origin from the country side. I did not land on a job right away and once had nothing to eat for a whole week. I was crazy salivating whenever I smelled food. But I did not give up until I finally got a job. During daytime I worked as ESL teacher, in the nights I worked as a private nurse.

 

Then in 2013, I got the chance to work abroad in Hong Kong as private nurse, so I went. While in Hong Kong, I encountered the biggest challenge in my life yet, when the super typhoon Haiyan landed and we lost our home and the little livelihood of my parents. This was the strongest and deadliest tropical storm in the history of my country - and it hit my very own home! There were dead bodies everywhere, the city totally destroyed and I had no news of my family for a week. I could not accept that so I went home to search them. God bless, I found them and they were alive, but wet without shelter and without hope.

We did not receive support from the government because of the reason that I am working abroad. This was so much painful for me. I cried a lot severely. I couldn’t do anything but accept the reality and move on. I tried my very best, worked day and night without breaks, 7 days a week... and now at least I can provide my parents to have a simple home to live. We can sleep without getting wet once it rains and have the most simple means to live.

 

My parents today

 

Future

 

My big big dream is, to get a further education in Canada. I wish to study, work, live and contribute in the country where people are treated the same and where your hard work can lead to success. Your support will make a tremendous change in my life and means the world to my family. I will never put your help in vain. Thank you and God bless us always.

 

 

Warel

Their expertise with international students is impressive and they offer several scholarships of which I hope to get one to help me with costs for the second and third term. 3.) They are well-connected with the healthcare industry and can be supportive in the post-graduation phase when I will look for permanent employment. Why 6,000 USD I plan to study the Personal Support Worker​ Program starting in September 2018. The total mandatory fees and tuitions for this 1.5-year-study at Fanshawe are $16,708 Canadian Dollars = $13,008 USD. To get started, I need at least $6,078 USD: I need to make a tuition down payment, get a visa and a mandatory health insurance for students. 
Tuition down payment: $5,202 USD
Visa: $188 USD
Health Insurance: $688 USD
 Ever since my childhood, I have always worked various jobs to keep myself running. So, I will also be able to cover my basic life expenses (food, place to stay, local transportation) by myself. I am furthermore allowed to take on a 20-h student job. I will also apply for a scholarship. Why support me? I am a hard-working and very responsible person with a life-long passion for caring about others. I am eager to study to develop my skills more and enhance further knowledge so that I can provide better care to others: effectively and efficiently! So, when you help me with my professional education, your help will be going to many more people to which I can offer my care after graduation. When you support me, you support an entire family at the same time: I have taken the responsibility to support my parents (farmers) too. Their health is declining, the days on the field in the hot sunshine are getting harder and harder for them. In February my mother passed out twice already. The family’s hope is on me. I am honest. If you received this campaign link from a friend who met me in person, please ask them to give a testimonial about my character. They will confirm that I have strong values and integrity. I am a spiritual person, I believe in universal values like love and compassion. If you think alike, you may consider me a brother on the path, who you can support at bringing more love and compassion into this world.  Rewards Your generosity will return to you in many ways. That is my belief. My reward and promise to all of you is, that I will support another student one day. After I graduated and become financially stable, I will make a donation of at least 500.00 USD to a student in need. I am already providing free treatments on Sundays and I will continue to do so in Canada. Especially to impoverished or abandoned elderly.  You will receive frequent updates from my life as a student on this campaign website, at least once per term.  THANK YOU SO MUCH! Please help to share my campaign with your families, friends and colleagues. Maybe you are willing to put the link to my campaign to your Facebook timeline, which would allow me to have greater exposure.  With Love and Gratitude, Warel  - - - - - - - - - - - - My Story  I always look forward rather than backward and I don’t know any self-pity, instead I am a solution oriented, positive thinking person. But I must mention my past to you, just to the extent that you can understand why my education means so incredibly much to me and my family and why I ask for your help with it. I am Warel Lopez. I come from Tacloban in the Philippines. My family still lives in this region. My parents are farmers with no education beyond elementary school, very little money, a small (and most simple) house and a field to grow vegetables.  School Since my childhood, I truly believe that education is the key to a good life. Even if it meant great sacrifice, pain and struggles… I would never stop learning. These challenges included: no food in school, no new school shoes and uniform, no school bag but only a plastic bag so I can carry my notebooks and no money for transportation. What I had only were notebook, pen and pencils and myself. At a very young age, I already understand what life is and the importance of education. Even without food, no money for transportation, I just sacrificed everyday so I can learn and acquire knowledge for my future. I only walked from our home to my school for a couple of kilometres away, which was crazy far for a child to walk without food. I never blamed my parents about the situation that we had. Not once. I really understood this already at a very young age: Yes, we are in poverty, but yet my parents are indeed hardworking and they do everything for the best of their children. So, I don’t mind what the people may say, what I care for is to get good education so I can help to uplift our economic status. I can really cross mountains just to have education… Looking back, I still had many wonderful experiences, though it was very hard. During elementary years, I already experienced working as a farmer, street vendor for fish and vegetable, pedicab driver and houseboy so we can just have food on the table. I studied and worked hard until I got my first elementary diploma. But then in high school, I experienced even higher levels of challenges. On top of the privations I experienced bullying. Teachers and students were laughing at me because my shoe was too old and too big for a little young boy. I did not give up my education, studied and worked hard and graduated from high school.  College There were more challenges when I was in college. My parents could not afford helping me with my schooling. I took the scholarship program from the Commission of Higher Education in the Philippines and the scholarship was granted. I could enrol and study! During university years, I only had 50 pesos or 1 USD every day which was for my transportation only, from our home going to college and back. I was always hungry, but I survived! Then after four years, I took the board exam for teachers and I made it. However my life challenges did not stop there. Even though I was already a professional teacher, I simply could not get a job. Instead of teaching, I worked as a construction labour, street vendor for food, driver and houseboy. In Spite of this crisis I never stopped dreaming big. I was still so thirsty for knowledge. Eventually, I decided to change my career: I took the academic scholarship program in the college of nursing at Colegio de Sta Lourdes of Leyte Foundation and passed this exam as well. The scholarship was granted. When I faced the challenges as a student and life inside the college of nursing, I thought I could not make it, because I had no money for the food in the canteen. My clinical instructor Mrs Eva Blesselda Astorga gave me an opportunity to continue: When she knew about my situation, she paid on my behalf. Silently. I could go on. A few months later, I worked a part-time job parallel to my study so I could support my miscellaneous expenses for the school. To tell you, I never experienced to own books ever since from elementary to my two bachelor degrees. Time passed, I graduated and became a registered nurse.  After College I was getting stronger inside and confident enough in facing any challenges in life. I went to Manila to look for a job as nurse but I experienced discrimination for my simple origin from the country side. I did not land on a job right away and once had nothing to eat for a whole week. I was crazy salivating whenever I smelled food. But I did not give up until I finally got a job. During daytime I worked as ESL teacher, in the nights I worked as a private nurse. Then in 2013, I got the chance to work abroad in Hong Kong as private nurse, so I went. While in Hong Kong, I encountered the biggest challenge in my life yet, when the super typhoon Haiyan landed and we lost our home and the little livelihood of my parents. This was the strongest and deadliest tropical storm in the history of my country - and it hit my very own home! There were dead bodies everywhere, the city totally destroyed and I had no news of my family for a week. I could not accept that so I went home to search them. God bless, I found them and they were alive, but wet without shelter and without hope.We did not receive support from the government because of the reason that I am working abroad. This was so much painful for me. I cried a lot severely. I couldn’t do anything but accept the reality and move on. I tried my very best, worked day and night without breaks, 7 days a week... and now at least I can provide my parents to have a simple home to live. We can sleep without getting wet once it rains and have the most simple means to live. My parents today Future My big big dream is, to get a further education in Canada. I wish to study, work, live and contribute in the country where people are treated the same and where your hard work can lead to success. Your support will make a tremendous change in my life and means the world to my family. I will never put your help in vain. Thank you and God bless us always.  Warel

story:
Short Summary

Over the past couple of years we have immersed ourselves into developing India's startup ecosystem - building technology solutions for the innovation-led community to engage startups and influencers productively. Such a unique hands-on learnings, along with the drive to promote the sports ecosystem, makes us want to realise objectives of 'Support Indian Football' campaign. Here's a brief background of the team:

  • Our audience solution has been used to incentivise crowds across 200+ locations - college campuses, F&B outlets, corporate offices, at sports stadiums and during conferences.
  • We organise meet-ups like 'Sports Crowd Pitch' where national-level sportspersons get to interact with corporates and influencers. During the recent FIFA World Cup 2018, we engaged sports enthusiasts at corporate parks and F&B outlets.
  • Personally I have followed sports extensively, covering various tournaments as part of Yahoo! India and by sharing stories across mainstream media channels and websites like Goal.com.
  • Also via the NGO Dreamadream, I helped them find partners to collaborate on their life-skills program that uses football as a medium to impact those skills. Today their program benefits 2000+ underprivileged students in India.

Your campaign support will help encourage some of the change-makers do even more to solve the challenges of a young and emerging India - a country where 600 million are under the age of 25 and 300 million live under poverty. By ensuring that the young and underprivileged football talents' professional training costs are covered, and increasing the country's football footprint - we trust the beautiful sport to enable many more youngsters realise their dreams, including being story to India's sporting successes.

What We Need & What You Get

Beyond the personal motivation, we have some perks for you:

US$10 (INR 700) - You get 1+1 match tickets, which can also be used to bring an underprivileged child to experience the match at the stadium. Our team of engagement curators will ensure a 'fun & purposeful' experience whether your team wins or loses.

US$20 (INR 1400) - Along with all the perks of the US$10 reward, you will also receive latest and autographed merchandise from a football star.

US$250 (INR 17K) - This amount will be used to support the professional training of a young talent at top soccer academies for a minimum period of 6 months. You will be able to connect with, and track the talent's progress during the period.

US$950 (INR 65K) - Join the traveling contingent of Indian Football supporters and cheer the team during the AFC Asian Cup, UAE 2019 - a top tournament which India has qualified for. India's in Group A, along with hosts UAE, Thailand and Bahrain. Your travel tickets (equivalent to minimum flight costs from Bangalore-AbuDhabi & return), local accommodation and match ticket(s) will be covered. During the trip the team will ensure a compelling experience for fans.

According to the contribution numbers for each of the perks, the funds will be allocated to realise the respective goals within the next 3-6 months. The more you contribute, more the beneficiaries. 

The Impact

It has been proven world-over that a sport like football can help enhance life-skills development, especially among the young and vulnerable. The World Health Organisation (WHO) in 1999 identified these five core cross-cultural areas of life skills: 

  • Decision-making and Problem-solving
  • Creative thinking and Critical thinking
  • Communication and Interpersonal skills
  • Self-awareness and Empathy
  • Coping with Emotions and Coping with Stress.

Beyond team-building and life-skills development, as a teammate and sports influencer, Abhijit once shared - Sports can play a huge role in rejuvenating countries. Be it the USA’s Men’s Ice Hockey team in 1980, South Africa’s Rugby WorldCup winning side of 1995 or India beating Pakistan in the 2007 Cricket World T20 Finals - sports successes have brought people together.

Risks & Challenges

Whatever the challenge we may encounter along the way, we are confident of engaging relevant stakeholders and realising objectives. This is where being adept with the WHO life-skills and keeping one's focus on the bigger goal helps. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would be really grateful for your monetary contributions as well as having you share about the campaign contribution with your networks. Don’t forget to use Indiegogo sharing tools, the campaign images, videos and links we have, as well as updates shared from events and live-screenings with the hashtag #SupportIndianFootball. Your every effort counts and together we can make change happen.

story:
"Raising a child includes countless moments of joy—but it also comes with its fair share of challenges. Perhaps one of the greatest obstacles parents face these days is the high cost of raising their children......From daycare to diapers, the expenses that accompany raising a child can be a financial burden for parents everywhere.  " Jenna Davis - Crowdfunding Expert

At Jadele Daycare Center we offer childcare services to infants & toddlers aged 6-24 months. 

Our services are flexible & affordable to suit a modern-day familywith a  modest income & a tight schedule.

Quick facts

. Longlasting & nurturing care 

. Trained & qualified staff

. Safe, affordable & flexible

. Nurturing environment

. Social, cognitive & Physical development

. Lots of fun!

 

             

 

What we need & What you can offer.

 Our goal is to raise $4000 as per the budget estimate. The funds will be used for:-

Registration, Licences & permits

Insurance 

Advertising & Marketing 

Payroll & Hiring ( first 3 months) 

Rent (first 3 months) 

Supplies (educational materials) 

Remodelling & Overhead costs 

Inventory 

Equipment & Safety 

Food ( first 3 months) 

 

Inspiration behind the Campaign

This year the founder of Jadele got to work as a trainee School Administrator. She couldn't find a daycare to leave her 18 months old baby. Reason, she's below admission age of 2 years. Her frustration grew when she had to turn away parents who came to seek admission for their below 2yrs babies (most schools & daycare centers in the locality only admit 2yrs+). She decided to set up a daycare that could accomodate children aged 6-24 months so as to offer reprieve to such parents, bridge the market gap & still be a mother to her child.

 

 

The significance of you contribution

By contributing to this campaign you'll help us combine passion (motherhood & caregiving) with enterprenuership as we help families raise their babies while they make ends meet.

What happens if we dont reach my goal?

If, unfortunately we don't reach our goal backers will get to choose which cause/charity/campaign to donate the proceeds to.

Our objective for this campaign.

We plan to open a modern daycare center which caters for the holistic needs of every child. 

Image courtesy of : www.bestonedesign.com

With the current financial crisis, especially in most developing countries (Kenya included) young parents would appreciate a little help raising their little ones as they try to make ends meet. Early stages of a child's development is vital. As the world strives to invest in ECD, we'll try to offer my expertise as ECD teachers & Caregivers.

 

Previous Project

The founder worked as a volunteer assistant graduate  (VGA) with the G-UNITED Programme (KE) in partnership with Evidence Action, whereby she helped improve literacy levels for struggling learners in G1-G3. Also, together with a co- VGA  they started an initiative under the name G-gundue Initiative. Its aim was to educate locals on the importance of girl-child education & the danger of early pregnancies & forced marriages for under-aged girls.

The Outcome

We're aware that not all campaigns reach their target & not everybody is a giver. A comment, referralor a word of encouragement is also welcome. We're looking for philanthropists willing to part with $1. Are you passionate about Early Childhood development? This is the campaign for you.

story:
An appeal to the audience of the creator of the project Anastasia Smogunova:

Why am I talking about this now?

Where is this idea coming from in my mind and my partners’?

It’s quite simple.

All my regalia you can read in the credits, but the most important and number one for me today is that I am mother of two teenagers.

I have been living with them for quite a long time and that hard period that we had in our life started a little bit earlier.

We are passing it and are already approaching the finish line.

I developed a system of a certain approach to these teenagers, which gives its results.

We know how to build a school of dream for our children. School of generation!

We want to create a school in which each child will be interested to learn, achieve academic, creative and sports victories, communicate, be friends and just live. This unique space for study and life will help students realize all cognitive requests and dreams in one place, form the skills necessary in our time, saving their time, energy and health!

 Support our project, our children, be with us!
story_txt:
An appeal to the audience of the creator of the project Anastasia Smogunova:
Why am I talking about this now?
Where is this idea coming from in my mind and my partners’?
It’s quite simple.
All my regalia you can read in the credits, but the most important and number one for me today is that I am mother of two teenagers.
I have been living with them for quite a long time and that hard period that we had in our life started a little bit earlier.
We are passing it and are already approaching the finish line.
I developed a system of a certain approach to these teenagers, which gives its results.
We know how to build a school of dream for our children. School of generation!
We want to create a school in which each child will be interested to learn, achieve academic, creative and sports victories, communicate, be friends and just live. This unique space for study and life will help students realize all cognitive requests and dreams in one place, form the skills necessary in our time, saving their time, energy and health!
 Support our project, our children, be with us!

story:
At Medita Spanish, we have developed a mindful learning method that is centered on the process of learning, not on the content.

We hack your brain so you are at peak performance to learn. Because learning a language is 80% about mindset and 20% about skills.

We use a mix of guided meditations, mindful practices, and NLP to create a perfect learning environment. If you have focus, have the right motivation, and your anxiety and your stress levels are down, you will be more open to learn and the knowledge will stick.

So you might be asking, how can I meditate and learn Spanish at the same time? First of all, meditation is a natural cognitive enhancer. It doesn’t always have to be you sitting in silence on your yoga mat. It can actually be something that is a reflective experience. This is why we developed a “mind active” method for our guided meditations.

Most meditations are focused on being body passive / mind passive. You relax your mind and body and go into a deeper meditative state, almost to the point where you fall asleep. Your pulse slows, your mind slows, and your body becomes slower and more mindful.

 

Our method is different. It’s not body passive, it’s mind active. We use higher frequency voice patterns and upbeat sounds in our guided meditations. This is a subtle but key way of keeping your mind active and energized during these meditations. The difference in our meditations and others is that we are boosting your brain power and unlocking specific belief systems to help shift your mindset for maximum learning potential.

 

We have meditations for every subject in typical Spanish curriculum. For example, some of our meditations are about physical descriptions and characteristics. We also have a visualization about somebody you love. We do this because the more personal it is, the more your mind relates to the lesson.

 

We also have meditations for things that directly affect your learning process, like anxiety, confidence, and resilience. We even have meditations specific for traditional Spanish courses, such as: before an exam meditation and before conversation class.

We are able to analyze how you feel before and after the meditations.This allows us to measure your progress so we will be able to tell you what works best for you. Because our motto is:

If you can't measure it, you can't improve it.

Who else is in our team?

We have clinical psychologists, Spanish language PhDs, NLP experts, mindset experts, meditation experts, communication experts…and we are just getting started!

Mindful Learning and Choose Your Own Topic. Each type of meditation focuses on different aspects of learning or Spanish curriculum.

We have between 25 to 30 meditations for each mastery level, which covers both casual and formal situations and conversations you would have in Spanish. 

This content is standardized based on the Instituto Cervantes curriculum, which is the Spanish curriculum that is followed worldwide. Regardless of what level of Spanish you’re at, or what region you’re in, all curriculum is based on this because it is the international institute of the Spanish language.

We’re so excited about this VIP group experience, because we believe in supporting our supporters and continuing with our mission to help change how the world learns. 

In this unique and exclusive community, you will get access to great content and resources, including:

You also get a lot of benefits as a sponsor, including all the perks and benefits that our app contributors receive (like lifetime access to the app), plus:

The ability to be featured on our website as a sponsor, have access to our exclusive community of influencers and other changemakers, a chance to participate in meet and greets with industry experts, the chance to expand your own audience and followers, and opportunities to collaborate and build revenue. 

 

Research has shown that students aren’t able to process all the information in one class sitting. In some cases, you only retain about 10% of what you are learning, and yet, this is how language is taught in traditional learning environments. This is because the traditional learning process isn’t set up to help you succeed. You’re sitting in a classroom and being taught only to memorize vocabulary words and conjugation. You’re just learning phrases and sentences in pieces so you can pass an exam and get a good grade. This is not an effective way to learn a language.

 

Happy students + “The importance of mindset”

Learning a language is 80% about your mindset and only 20% about skill. The way you think determines how you learn.

 

The right mindset gives you motivation, and builds confidence and resilience, so you are not only okay making mistakes, you’re using them to grow. But you can only do this is if you know how to retrain your brain and prime it for maximum learning potential.

Would you like to help us spread the word? Send us an email to hi@meditaspanish.com

We would love to hear about you! We will be running a contest for the people who bring in the most founding members. And we have some amazing prizes lined up!

 

That’s right! We won two bronze Stevies for the American Business Awards - One for Startup of the Year and one for Tech Startup of the Year.

We also have a visualization about somebody you love. We do this because the more personal it is, the more your mind relates to the lesson. We also have meditations for things that directly affect your learning process, like anxiety, confidence, and resilience. We even have meditations specific for traditional Spanish courses, such as: before an exam meditation and before conversation class.We are able to analyze how you feel before and after the meditations.This allows us to measure your progress so we will be able to tell you what works best for you. Because our motto is:If you can't measure it, you can't improve it.
Who else is in our team?We have clinical psychologists, Spanish language PhDs, NLP experts, mindset experts, meditation experts, communication experts…and we are just getting started!Mindful Learning and Choose Your Own Topic. Each type of meditation focuses on different aspects of learning or Spanish curriculum.We have between 25 to 30 meditations for each mastery level, which covers both casual and formal situations and conversations you would have in Spanish. This content is standardized based on the Instituto Cervantes curriculum, which is the Spanish curriculum that is followed worldwide. Regardless of what level of Spanish you’re at, or what region you’re in, all curriculum is based on this because it is the international institute of the Spanish language.We’re so excited about this VIP group experience, because we believe in supporting our supporters and continuing with our mission to help change how the world learns. In this unique and exclusive community, you will get access to great content and resources, including:You also get a lot of benefits as a sponsor, including all the perks and benefits that our app contributors receive (like lifetime access to the app), plus:The ability to be featured on our website as a sponsor, have access to our exclusive community of influencers and other changemakers, a chance to participate in meet and greets with industry experts, the chance to expand your own audience and followers, and opportunities to collaborate and build revenue.  Research has shown that students aren’t able to process all the information in one class sitting. In some cases, you only retain about 10% of what you are learning, and yet, this is how language is taught in traditional learning environments. This is because the traditional learning process isn’t set up to help you succeed. You’re sitting in a classroom and being taught only to memorize vocabulary words and conjugation. You’re just learning phrases and sentences in pieces so you can pass an exam and get a good grade. This is not an effective way to learn a language. Happy students + “The importance of mindset”Learning a language is 80% about your mindset and only 20% about skill. The way you think determines how you learn. The right mindset gives you motivation, and builds confidence and resilience, so you are not only okay making mistakes, you’re using them to grow. But you can only do this is if you know how to retrain your brain and prime it for maximum learning potential.Would you like to help us spread the word? Send us an email to hi@meditaspanish.comWe would love to hear about you! We will be running a contest for the people who bring in the most founding members. And we have some amazing prizes lined up! That’s right! We won two bronze Stevies for the American Business Awards - One for Startup of the Year and one for Tech Startup of the Year.

story:
Hello backers. I am Ling. I was born and raised in a small farming village in mainland China. Growing up, I didn't have any toys or electronics, life was about going to school, working on our farm, it was very quiet and peaceful.

On my fifth birthday, my uncle who worked in the city gifted me with a radio. I fell in love with it immediately. It was my first window to the outside world.  Every night after finishing all my school and housework, I would lay in bed holding my precious radio and listening to all the daily news and stories. My favorite part was the music program, which always came at the end of the night, but I always waited for it. Music was like magic, it soothed all my tiredness, calmed my soul, painted a colorful picture of the bigger world that I dreamt to see, and it also taught me many songs. I began to sing and hum all day long, on my way to school, herding animals, cooking, cleaning... When I was happy, singing made everything even brighter. When I was sad, singing offered me comfort and peace. Even though I was not good at singing, I loved every minute of it. Little did I know then, that radio, music, and singing would change my life drastically. It encouraged me to be brave and adventurous, it inspired me to step out of my little village, explore and embrace all the adventures. 

Fast forwarded 30 years later, I graduated college with multiple degrees, traveled around the world, and have settled in Oshkosh, Wisconsin. I now have two little ones, my daughter Miao Miao (Chinese for "little fire")/Ember (her English name) is almost three years old. My son Ran Ran (Chinese for "rising")/Ezran (his English name) is a year old. As I have been exploring this new chapter of my life as a mama, I find myself singing again, the same songs I learned from the radio when I was a child. Singing and dancing with my children has become our favorite activity together. Not only has it bonded us closer, but it also sparked my children's interest in learning Chinese. I cannot help but feeling proud when Miao Miao points things out everywhere she goes and ask me "Mama, what's this in Chinese?"  This love and joy were what inspired me to create this book, "Sing along with Miao Miao". 

 It has our favorite songs from both China and America, it sings in Mandarin Chinese, with both English, Chinese, and Pinyin (the alphabetical pronunciation) lyrics. Even if you do not know any Chinese, you can still sing along with your little one following Pinyin. I hope this book can help my kids and kids everywhere learn Chinese while having fun singing.

In the process of making this book, there were many challenges.  Such as finding the right artist for our illustrations, and fixing the battery problem.  Luckily, we were able to find solutions and overcome all the challenges in the end. What kept me going forward and stopped me from giving up was all the help and support from my dear family and friends. Also, it is my dream to share this with all of you around the world, and my belief that it will bring joy and happiness to you and your little ones. This book is my way to share my childhood memories with my children, and I hope it will spark inspiration for all parents.  Let's be proud of where we came from, let's celebrate the journey we had to take to get here today, let’s share that with our children, and connect them back to our roots in any way we can.   

With the help from some wonderful friends and many months of hard work; finally, I was able to make a sample book this month. Everyone who has seen it fell in love with it, and they all asked me when they can get a copy. However, as I am a stay-at-mom right now without an income, finances have become a big roadblock in moving forward. I am very grateful that I can share my story and create this campaign here, and I am hoping it will help me complete this journey. Right now, we need $10,000 to get the book published and for sale which includes $5,000 for book production and $5,000 for packaging and shipping. To show our deepest gratitude, all backers will get a 32% discount on the book's original price, plus free shipping. Backers will also get the book as soon as they are produced (in early July) before official publication. Even if we don't reach our entire goal by the due date, the funds will still go to book production.  Every effort will be put into publishing this book. 

Any help you can offer us, no matter big or small, will all be greatly appreciated. Even if you cannot contribute, we understand, you can still help us by sharing our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools. We thank you all very much for your time and consideration. Thank you for helping to make my dream come true and making a difference in the world.

To show our deepest gratitude, all backers will get a 32% discount on the book's original price, plus free shipping. Backers will also get the book as soon as they are produced (in early July) before official publication. Even if we don't reach our entire goal by the due date, the funds will still go to book production.  Every effort will be put into publishing this book. 
Any help you can offer us, no matter big or small, will all be greatly appreciated. Even if you cannot contribute, we understand, you can still help us by sharing our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools. We thank you all very much for your time and consideration. Thank you for helping to make my dream come true and making a difference in the world.

story:
Programa is an easy to use software tool that combines a simple, yet powerful programming language with an intuitive user interface.  Programa’s computing environment is ideal for anyone who wants to learn computer programming. Programa was built to minimize the time it takes someone to understand writing and debugging computer programs. In addition, its powerful visualization tools allow you to produce exciting graphs and plots so you can easily explore the results of your project.

Why ….

Today there are no software programming tools designed to make it easy for everyone to learn how to program. Most entry-level tools are too simple to provide beginners with a deep understanding of programming and not powerful enough to develop meaningful, functional computer programs.  At the same time, most professional programming tools are too complicated and discourage, rather than encourage, people to attempt to learn programming.

Programa bridges this gap by using a template-based coding style, with integrated learning concepts, instant feedback on code errors, and program monitoring to create an environment where you can easily create and test a computer program. Programa gives users instant gratification.

How Programa came to life …..

There are so many different software packages and programming languages … virtually something different for every application. With so many options out there, how does one decide even where to start their programming journey? This is programming chaos.

We relied on our many years of software experience and our deep understanding of many of these environments and languages to find a better way. We started with a blank sheet of paper. From there, we used best practices, features, and capabilities of the leading programming environments and languages as insights for Programa and then added new features to improve ease-of-use and the best possible user experience. Programa represents a radical change that will help you and your children quickly and easily understand how to program and communicate with computers.

What’s next ...

Now that the basics of Programa have been built, we plan to optimize the user interface, test, and bring Programa to you.  We need your help to make this happen. We want you to be a part of bringing Programa to market.


The Impact

For Parents

Want to work on fun projects with your children? Want them to learn how to program computers so they have an incredible advantage on their future? Programa offers an easy to use environment that can help you do this … and the best part, you don’t need to have computer programming experience … you can learn side-by-side with your children. 

For Professionals

You have been in the workforce for many years. Everybody around you writes code for computers, tablets, and smartphones. Do you want to learn how to program computers to better communicate with your co-workers? Would you like to develop quick prototypes for your ideas?  Programa is the tool for you. It will help you learn how to write code quickly and easily without the need to spend time studying textbooks and manuals.

For Teachers

Computer science education is essential for all children to succeed in an ever challenging and competitive working environment. Most of the schools today do not teach computer science …. this must change. Want to change this and add computer science to your school’s existing curriculum? If you are one of the few where computer science classes are implemented, wouldn’t it be great to have a tool that can improve participation and success of your students? Want to give your students a new path to future success?  Programa provides an easy transition from the simple block-based programming methods to full-fledged programming environments in a fun and easy environment.  Programa is designed to make sure children are successful when they try increasingly complex computer programming projects.

Use of Funds

The core functionality of Programa has been developed and tested on an iPad. We need additional funds to finalize and improve the user interface, to develop the web app, and test ... test ... test. The following chart illustrates how we plan to use the funds from this campaign.


Perks

Our current plan is to offer Programa on an annual subscription basis for named users. The named users will be able to use Programa on any of the available platforms. Annual licenses will commence on January 1st, 2016. 

As a contributor starting at Adopter level and above  you will enjoy unlimited access to Programa for the years to come. 

You can contribute to our campaign in one of the following ways:


One-Year Licensing: Single license for a full year starting January 1st, 2016 for the Programa app on all platforms that are available. 

Unlimited Licensing: There is no time expiration of Programa and it applies to all available platforms.

School/School-District Donations: We make a donation of the Programa web app to a school/school-district of your preference for the 2016-2017 academic year. We will also include a full-year coursework. 

  1. Donation can be made to high, middle, or lower schools only (public or private)
  2. Please visit our   School List to see the list of schools where donations have already been made
  3. On the same page, fill the form  with the school name of your preference, city, state, and country
  4. A confirmation email will be sent to you
  5. If a school/school-district has already received the donation from another supporter, you get the chance to select a new one.

Influencing Programa: If you are excited as we are about Programa and want to participate in the definition process, the Influencer category is the right one for you. As an Influencer, you will have access to Programa's preliminary specifications so you can have an impact on its features before it gets released to the market. You will have direct access to the engineering team and you will be able to participate in monthly design review meetings.

Schedule

We believe that a web-based platform is the most suitable for Programa since it makes the tool available to everyone, everywhere. However, for users and organizations prefer to have Programa installed locally on their devices, we will support other platforms according to the following schedule: 

The user interface among these platforms will be identical so you will have the same look and feel whether you are accessing Programa from your own device or via the internet.

On Dec 15th, 2015 we will deliver to you a Programa beta version running on an iPad so that you can start learning right away. We also want your feedback and we want you to be part of team that will help us define and release the official Version 1.0 of Programa to the market.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate you taking the time to review our campaign.  If you can't contribute, but you are excited about Programa you can always help:

  • Make some noise about Programa
  • Share our campaign with friends
  • Share you suggestions and ideas with us
  • Let us know what has kept you or your family from learning programming
  • Post it in social media and blogs

All of the items above can be accomplished easily with Indiegogo’s share tools!
