story:
Our Mission:

Our mission is to encourage independent and successful spellers who are empowered by their own ability to spell words correctly without relying upon spell-check technology.

Our Story:

Hello! My name is Olivia Kasper.  I am a college sophomore and entrepreneur from Alpharetta, GA. When I was nine years old, I developed a spelling tool called Spell-A-Cadabra to help myself learn how to spell without rote-memorization because I was such a terrible speller.  Spell-A-Cadabra is a unique, child-friendly, three-step spelling tool that initiates analytical thinking and can be used anywhere.  By the time I was 16, I had conducted two professional, research studies with over 200 students.  Not only did I prove that my tool could be used with any spelling curriculum to help kids spell much better, I also discovered that the students using my tool remembered their spelling words long after their spelling tests!  The success that Spell-A-Cadabra brought each child was so exciting with an average improvement of an entire letter grade, and words that were remembered over a month later!  After seeing how well these 200 students responded to Spell-A-Cadabra, I have made it my mission to get it into the hands of as many children as possible.

What we Stand for:

Finally mastering my spelling words was such a personal relief and affected me in such a positive way, that I want to share my tool with as many other students as possible.  By using my method, before I knew it my spelling in general had improved (not just my weekly tests) because I began to “think” about the letters in a word, instead of trying to “remember” what I had tried to memorize. 

I believe every child deserves the opportunity to excel educationally, and in life.  Since reading, writing, and spelling are all intertwined, if one area is strengthened the others benefit.  I want every child to have access to a Spell-A-Cadabra kit, in hopes that they struggle less in school and achieve a new level of self-confidence.  The Spell-A-Cadabra Campaign strives to ignite a strong foundation of educational brilliance within each child.  For every Spell-A-Cadabra perk sold, Spell-A-Cadabra kits will be donated to children, classrooms, schools, or organizations, at no cost to the recipient.  Our goal is to start by contributing to children in the pre-k through third grade.  With the help of our supporters, we can immediately enhance a child’s self esteem as well as academic confidence and success. 

Give a Little Get a Lot:

The spark of an individual is nothing compared to the flame of a group.

Our goal for this campaign is to raise a minimum of $250,000 dollars.  Our production costs are low, so every penny donated to us goes a long way helping to make a huge impact quickly.  Our pledge streamlines our proceeds directly towards the continued production of the original version of Spell-A-Cadabra, the 8” by 11”, dry-erase form of our spelling tool, that allows children to take it “on the go” and learn anywhere.  

We are also excited to serve our recipients who have questions about the Spell-A-Cadabra tool with an online Spell-A-Cadabra Resource Center, designed to answer questions about the product and provide personal assistance. We will also use some of the proceeds to convert our website into an iPhone and Android cellphone friendly platform. 

The “giving” opportunities are endless, and we are hoping that classroom teachers and parents alike will rally their children to begin helping other classrooms across the USA!

Our Perks:

For every donation made, contributors receive our popular “SpellStrong” wristband, and their own Spell-A-Cadabra kit.  In addition, a matching kit will be donated to a school on their behalf.  Depending upon the contribution level, rewards get added to the initial perk.  The best part is that as the levels increase so do the number of children who receive kits!  Other unique perks include cool squish balls, hip tumblers, and fashionable tee’s. Top level contributors receive a commemorative, framed certificate that can be displayed in classrooms to encourage and remind students of their generosity.  After donating, depending upon your perk you can tell us more about where you would like your Spell-A-Cadabra kit to be sent. Don't worry, if you don't have a school in mind, we have lots to choose from. If you don't suggest a school we will happily take care of that for you.     

As a flexible campaign, if we are unable to reach our goal, we will still divide our proceeds between the production of original Spell-A-Cadabras, and the Spell-A-Cadabra Student and Teacher Resource Center, sending out as many Spell-A-Cadabra Kits as possible.

The Impact:

There is nothing like the infectious spirit of doing something kind to help someone!  

There is a humble healing that the giver and the receiver both get that makes the world a more compassionate place.  I believe that thankfulness is contagious and when people are thankful, they too are more likely to pass the goodness forward.  Contributors of this campaign are voluntarily helping to give back to the overall educational wellbeing of our nation’s children. Through the donations and enthusiasm of contributors this campaign will shine an essential spotlight on the educational importance of each child, while getting the actual Spell-A-Cadabras into the hands of students much quicker than I could manage independently.  Sponsors will create lifelong positive change in their local schools, their community and our country with improved learning, better test scores and higher graduation rates.  Ultimately, we have faith that this will extend into successful employment with global merit.

We “Gotta” Start Somewhere:

This is the first Spell-A-Cadabra Campaign.  However, I have run two successful, professional test trials on the product.  First, testing its efficacy against the traditional, rote-memorization spelling methods found in premier spelling products used today, and second targeting its long-term memory retention.  In both studies, Spell-A-Cadabra proved superior.

Possible Roadblocks:

As a young entrepreneur and inventor of a spelling tool, I have had an enormous hurdle trying to gain a proper introduction to, as well as earn respect within a multi-billion dollar industry.  Not surprisingly, the educational industry can be competitive and exclusive.  This campaign lends exciting credibility and the support necessary to jump-start the mass production of our spelling tool as it matriculates into the lower elementary school systems and gains momentum through our united efforts and positive results.

In an age that relies heavily upon the technology of spell-check, I believe that the answer for success rests with getting back to basics and empowering our children to think smarter.

Other ways to Help:

Your monetary contributions are an important part of the key to getting a Spell-A-Cadabra in the hands of every child, but you can help even if you cannot donate money.  Your support and kind words through social media are invaluable, and will help ensure that we have the enthusiasm and resources necessary to get the Spell-A-Cadabra kit into American households and schools.  Linking this page to your friends is worth its weight in gold.  Help us make noise and use your contacts!  It takes a village! We also welcome private messages regarding any child, class, school, and/or organization that could benefit from this amazing, educational tool.

story:
Summary 

Learnconnect: an online community that connects students in the same majors from schools nearby.

Students constantly need help on school workload and the need for collaboration can never be over emphasized as the benefits are social, psychological, academic, and assessment. Working together cooperatively would accomplish shared learning goals of each student.

 What We Need & What we Get

There are millions of students out there which is a big opportunity and we need your help to raise 15000 USD which will go into the project.

The Impact

· Higher achievement and greater productivity Among students;

· More caring, supportive, and committed relationships, and;

 · Greater psychological health, social competence and self-esteem.

Milestone

We already have beta version of the project ready.

story:
THE PITCH:

TSC Talks, is a Podcast that delivers an unfiltered view of families living with chronic, often life-threatening conditions. Inspired by the many challenges faced by families dealing with "Tuberous Sclerosis Complex", TSC Talks is developing a guidebook on Cannabinoids and Caregiving. This new tool will provide families with the latest and most progressive resources to navigate the complicated world of cannabinoid medicine, CBD, and everything in between!

Many families searching for remedies for the host of medical issues faced by TSC, autistic, and other IDD (Intellectually and Developmentally Disabled) individuals have held back in using cannabis. Research indicates that cannabis could provide relief for a large number of ailments. But information is often confusing and inaccurate. Experts provide conflicting opinions. Serious health concerns have been caused by poorly made and badly regulated products. The latest safety scare has claimed the lives of at least 19 and hospitalized hundreds across more than a dozen states. Families are justified in their reluctance to incorporate cannabis into the care regimen for their loved ones.

CBD and Cannabinoid medicine could relieve the phenomenal stress that IDD families experience daily from their loved one’s chronic disorders. But it will be years, probably decades, before cannabis medicines are produced with the same consistency and safety we expect from a bottle of aspirin.

The TSC Guidebook will test popular cannabis health products, and report on: the accuracy of labeling, organic certifications, contamination (pesticides, chemical residue, unlisted ingredients), and quality/quantity of cannabinoids. It will also provide a compilation of information from TSC Talks and experts on the state of cannabis medicine. The book will be published in Early 2020.

THE NEED:

We are just at the beginning of “officially” understanding a plant that has been used by humans for thousands of years. Consumers face a myriad of choices with little guidance to assist them. Rules on what can be purchased and how it is inspected and regulated vary by state. Consumers cannot be confident in the quality or safety of cannabis.

As the cannabis economy continues to grow, we will undoubtedly see more stories about safety and quality. National testing standards would help consumer confidence. Some publications and blogs do provide basic review products. Some states require merchants to test their products and provide test results if requested. You can even use third-party home tests to verify some product claims.

But is that enough? In other industries, third parties provide consumers with information and tools to help choose products. Good Housekeeping, the granddaddy of independent third-party testing, opened its first test facility in 1924. Zagat and the Michelin guides rate restaurants. Ziff Davis tests computers and technology under laboratory conditions and publishes the results. 

OMINOUS WORDS:

A recent investigation by the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) linked the deaths of at least 12 consumers with hundreds of cases of hospitalization. All evidence points to vaping products containing THC (tetrahydrocannabinol), the chemical responsible for marijuana's “high”.

The cannabis industry is growing up quickly, and consumer safety testing not keeping up with the growth. A comprehensive cannabis guidebook is a vital step towards improving the safety of cannabis consumers! Accuracy and precise medication management are of utmost importance, and one of the most challenging aspects, of any chronic medical condition. Consumers need a better understanding of CBD and Cannabis-related products. One wrong move could be devastating for those that live with complicated and chronic medical and mental health issues 

TSC TALKS:

Jill Woodworth created the podcast TSC Talks.  Inspired by the condition known as Tuberous Sclerosis Complex, the podcast discusses issues relevant to those affected by TSC, IDD and/or Autism. It is a forum where families, healthcare, and other professionals can share with the world their exponential challenges and raw unfiltered views.

TSC and other IDD conditions require massive amounts of integration and communication. Without that, those affected, and their loved ones, have little chance of achieving medical and psychological stability, or adequate quality of life. TSC families are at the mercy of the many disconnects in our outdated care systems. Providing hope for these stressed families is a big part of our mission. And…

The purported benefits of cannabis is a big part of that hope. But the stories of danger and poor product safety have made many families cautious. Here at TSC Talks, we’ve been in equal parts both fascinated and concerned over the explosive growth of the CBD & Cannabinoid medicine market in the US and just how this impacts those with diverse concerns such as TSC, Autism, IDD.

TSC Talks is launching a series of discussions about the benefits and safety issues facing TSC families who use cannabis-based health products. Including… one with a parent using CBD to treat her son’s severe TSC related epilepsy, another with a Cannabis activist, cancer survivor and parent to a daughter with epilepsy and Autism,  and how cannabis medicine can manage seizures and mitigate behavioral symptoms associated with Autism spectrum disorders and improve the quality of life for many.

At the same time, we will launch the crowdfunding campaign for our cannabis guidebook, allowing the podcasts and crowdfunding campaigns to work together as we interview a pharmacist who works in a marijuana dispensary, medical marijuana dispensary owners and reach out to medical professionals, parents, and individuals who have experienced the benefits of Cannabinoid Medicine.

PERSONAL EXPERIENCE:

My personal motivation for starting this fundraiser is simple. Life is unfair. Those living with and managing life-threatening chronic conditions must accept this reality daily. We need every tool we can get. Cannabinoid medicine is an incredible tool. It has great potential for more successful outcomes, for less reliance on multiple prescriptions, and for improved overall mental and physical health.

Jill and her daughter have had incidents with CBD and Cannabinoid products that were terrifying and frustrating, but provided the impetus to dig deeper into this topic. Several years ago while on multiple prescriptions, her daughter had a reaction to a mix of cannabis and prescription medication. Her “bad trip” (psychotic break) forever changed how she viewed this powerful substance. Jill’s daughter substituted a different brand of CBD supplement (but supposedly the same product); instead of relieving anxiety so she could sleep, she had a lengthy seizure.

Neither Jill nor her daughter was aware of the dangerous interactions between these Cannabis-based products and prescribed pharmaceuticals. In a recent TSC Talks podcast episode with a well-known Cannabis Activist, Mike Robinson, a light bulb went on as Mike described the dire need for the public to be aware of the risk of how CBD and Cannabinoid medicines interact with prescribed medications… and the need for medical professionals to learn how to treat the patients that use these products.

THE BOOK!

The book will be electronic, rather than print. While our goal is to raise $7,500 to create the most basic book, the more we raise the more we can do! Initially, we will select 20 or more products, focused on CBD oil. With greater funding, we will be able to expand into vapes, edibles, and other products (that require a different testing methodology), and we will cover a wider range of tests (see below).

Chapters: The cover will include original art, from Jill Woodworth’s daughter Sara. The book will contain chapters on cannabis, risk, and benefits, best research so far, traditional uses for cannabis, how to understand the label, and other consumer-oriented information.

Analysis: The most basic analysis will include comparisons of ingredients, content quantity, problematic chemicals, certifications (to operate [in which states?], frequency of merchant testing, food handling, organic certification, etc.), customer complaints & reviews, and basic tests for contamination. As more funds are raised, more products, more types of products, and more forms of testing (pesticides, chemical residue, unreported ingredients, potency, etc.) will be planned.

Testing the Tests: Because there has been an enormous improvement in-home testing kits and devices, we will add a stretch goal for “testing the tests”. This is especially important for medical cannabis, where it is vital that there is a high level of consistency from product to product or even batch to batch. That level of consistency would have prevented the seizures that Jill’s daughter experienced when she changed brands of CBD oil.

Interaction: Because there is so much variability, and if the project is a runaway success, we want our donors to participate in the design and completion of the book. We want to regularly communicate with donors and give them the opportunity to vote on new stretch goals and work with our team to deliver a relevant and effective book that helps them in their lives.

Next Year: If we are successful this year, we want to continue to build on that success in the future. Late in 2020, we want to produce a new, bigger book, covering more merchants in more depth. By 2021 we hope to convert the book to a database so that new reviews are immediately available.

WE NEED YOUR HELP!

We will be looking to EVERYONE AND ANYONE to give us feedback on which new chapters, products, and tests you want in the book, what products to test and if you have suggestions on guests for the podcast, we want to know! This is an interactive project and the more we are able to engage with our supporters, the more we can find ways to creatively guide the scope of the book to be as inclusive, informative and interesting as possible.  We hope to hold some live online events to interact with our audience, supporters....anyone looking to pose questions and contribute to the conversation on Medical Cannabis, CBD, Cannabis in general, your experiences, thoughts, insights, we want to hear them.  

OUR TEAM

Includes: Jill Woodworth, Lisa Larson, Chris Niccolls and Amora Correa.

Jill Woodworth: Human being, writer, podcaster. Chronicler of being human. Case manager of 5 offspring, 3 with Tuberous Sclerosis Complex. Managing the aspects of Intellectual Disability and Autism presents significant challenges as a human being, parent, caregiver, or sibling. TSC causes benign tumors to grow in the organs of the body. There is no cure but there are ways of managing care. That’s why I started TSC Talks, and it’s why TSC Talks is now taking a deep dive into cannabis medicine.

Lisa Larson: Audio editor and Business Manager of TSC Talks, parent of two adult children, and married for 28 years to a man who is a paraplegic and deals with frequent pain and spasticity common with spinal cord injuries. When Jill asked me if I was interested in helping her on the podcast, I thought I’d give it a shot.  It wasn’t long before I was fully immersed in the podcast process, learning everything I could about audio editing as well as Tuberous Sclerosis Complex and other related conditions.  While I do not have anyone in my family affected, I became deeply affected by the unbelievable situations and circumstances of our guests as they shared their rugged stories dealing with the complex, chronic, often life-threatening manifestations of TSC, etc.  I’m energized by the opportunity to better understand Cannabinoid medicine, starting with CBD, crowdfunding to be able to find and test the most effective products, to provide a guide for families, while continuing to produce exceptional audio content to enrich and inspire. 

Chris Niccolls:

Chris is the President and Chief Operating Officer of Nicky’s Gardens of Hope, a new non-profit, developing services to care for adults with Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities, (IDD) such as autism. Chris & Jill previously worked together on projects for Nicky’s Gardens and decided that collaborating on the Cannabis Project would be a great way to spread information about cannabis SAFETY and aid families that deal with IDD. Prior to Nicky’s Gardens and TSC Talks, Chris was an executive at global financial firms, investment banks, insurance companies, and research organizations. Chris’ expertise is in program design & reengineering and is responsible for the technical design of our Cannabis Project.

Amora Correa:

Amora is a journalism student, writer in the making, and mother of two. She is the Design Editor for the Goings on in The Gardens Newsletter at Nicky's Gardens of Hope, as well as a grant consultant for Nicky's Gardens of Hope.

TESTING:

A minimum of 20 products will be tested, although we want to test many more. And we will…. Depending on how much we raise.

Our first focus is CBD oil, but with greater funding, we will expand (vapes, edibles, creams, etc.) Note: Different products may require different and incompatible tests

If we fail to raise the minimum funding, we will still report on… ingredients, content quantity, problematic chemicals, certifications (to operate [in which states], frequency of merchant testing, food handling, organic certification, etc.), customer complaints & reviews, and basic tests for contamination.

If we raise more money we will test more products, more types of products, and more forms of testing (pesticides, chemical residue, unreported ingredients, potency, etc.). AND add a new section to talk about consumer-level testing kits.

The book will contain chapters on cannabis, risk, and benefits, best research so far, traditional uses for cannabis, how to understand the label, and other consumer-oriented information.

Interaction: we want to be very interactive with donors.

We will periodically put out questions and surveys to determine the direction of the book.

As funding rises, we want donor feedback on which new chapters, products, and tests they want in the book.

We want the book to be as useful and relevant as possible for the donors.

Thank you for supporting this project!

https://tsctalks.com

Jill, Lisa, Chris & Amora
story_txt: THE PITCH:TSC Talks, is a Podcast that delivers an unfiltered view of families living with chronic, often life-threatening conditions. Inspired by the many challenges faced by families dealing with "Tuberous Sclerosis Complex", TSC Talks is developing a guidebook on Cannabinoids and Caregiving. This new tool will provide families with the latest and most progressive resources to navigate the complicated world of cannabinoid medicine, CBD, and everything in between!Many families searching for remedies for the host of medical issues faced by TSC, autistic, and other IDD (Intellectually and Developmentally Disabled) individuals have held back in using cannabis. Research indicates that cannabis could provide relief for a large number of ailments. But information is often confusing and inaccurate. Experts provide conflicting opinions. Serious health concerns have been caused by poorly made and badly regulated products. The latest safety scare has claimed the lives of at least 19 and hospitalized hundreds across more than a dozen states. Families are justified in their reluctance to incorporate cannabis into the care regimen for their loved ones.CBD and Cannabinoid medicine could relieve the phenomenal stress that IDD families experience daily from their loved one’s chronic disorders. But it will be years, probably decades, before cannabis medicines are produced with the same consistency and safety we expect from a bottle of aspirin.The TSC Guidebook will test popular cannabis health products, and report on: the accuracy of labeling, organic certifications, contamination (pesticides, chemical residue, unlisted ingredients), and quality/quantity of cannabinoids. It will also provide a compilation of information from TSC Talks and experts on the state of cannabis medicine. The book will be published in Early 2020.THE NEED:We are just at the beginning of “officially” understanding a plant that has been used by humans for thousands of years. Consumers face a myriad of choices with little guidance to assist them. Rules on what can be purchased and how it is inspected and regulated vary by state. Consumers cannot be confident in the quality or safety of cannabis.As the cannabis economy continues to grow, we will undoubtedly see more stories about safety and quality. National testing standards would help consumer confidence. Some publications and blogs do provide basic review products. Some states require merchants to test their products and provide test results if requested. You can even use third-party home tests to verify some product claims.But is that enough? In other industries, third parties provide consumers with information and tools to help choose products. Good Housekeeping, the granddaddy of independent third-party testing, opened its first test facility in 1924. Zagat and the Michelin guides rate restaurants. Ziff Davis tests computers and technology under laboratory conditions and publishes the results. OMINOUS WORDS:A recent investigation by the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) linked the deaths of at least 12 consumers with hundreds of cases of hospitalization. All evidence points to vaping products containing THC (tetrahydrocannabinol), the chemical responsible for marijuana's “high”.The cannabis industry is growing up quickly, and consumer safety testing not keeping up with the growth. A comprehensive cannabis guidebook is a vital step towards improving the safety of cannabis consumers! Accuracy and precise medication management are of utmost importance, and one of the most challenging aspects, of any chronic medical condition. Consumers need a better understanding of CBD and Cannabis-related products. One wrong move could be devastating for those that live with complicated and chronic medical and mental health issues TSC TALKS:Jill Woodworth created the podcast TSC Talks.  Inspired by the condition known as Tuberous Sclerosis Complex, the podcast discusses issues relevant to those affected by TSC, IDD and/or Autism. It is a forum where families, healthcare, and other professionals can share with the world their exponential challenges and raw unfiltered views.TSC and other IDD conditions require massive amounts of integration and communication. Without that, those affected, and their loved ones, have little chance of achieving medical and psychological stability, or adequate quality of life. TSC families are at the mercy of the many disconnects in our outdated care systems. Providing hope for these stressed families is a big part of our mission. And…The purported benefits of cannabis is a big part of that hope. But the stories of danger and poor product safety have made many families cautious. Here at TSC Talks, we’ve been in equal parts both fascinated and concerned over the explosive growth of the CBD & Cannabinoid medicine market in the US and just how this impacts those with diverse concerns such as TSC, Autism, IDD.TSC Talks is launching a series of discussions about the benefits and safety issues facing TSC families who use cannabis-based health products. Including… one with a parent using CBD to treat her son’s severe TSC related epilepsy, another with a Cannabis activist, cancer survivor and parent to a daughter with epilepsy and Autism,  and how cannabis medicine can manage seizures and mitigate behavioral symptoms associated with Autism spectrum disorders and improve the quality of life for many.At the same time, we will launch the crowdfunding campaign for our cannabis guidebook, allowing the podcasts and crowdfunding campaigns to work together as we interview a pharmacist who works in a marijuana dispensary, medical marijuana dispensary owners and reach out to medical professionals, parents, and individuals who have experienced the benefits of Cannabinoid Medicine.PERSONAL EXPERIENCE:My personal motivation for starting this fundraiser is simple. Life is unfair. Those living with and managing life-threatening chronic conditions must accept this reality daily. We need every tool we can get. Cannabinoid medicine is an incredible tool. It has great potential for more successful outcomes, for less reliance on multiple prescriptions, and for improved overall mental and physical health.Jill and her daughter have had incidents with CBD and Cannabinoid products that were terrifying and frustrating, but provided the impetus to dig deeper into this topic. Several years ago while on multiple prescriptions, her daughter had a reaction to a mix of cannabis and prescription medication. Her “bad trip” (psychotic break) forever changed how she viewed this powerful substance. Jill’s daughter substituted a different brand of CBD supplement (but supposedly the same product); instead of relieving anxiety so she could sleep, she had a lengthy seizure.Neither Jill nor her daughter was aware of the dangerous interactions between these Cannabis-based products and prescribed pharmaceuticals. In a recent TSC Talks podcast episode with a well-known Cannabis Activist, Mike Robinson, a light bulb went on as Mike described the dire need for the public to be aware of the risk of how CBD and Cannabinoid medicines interact with prescribed medications… and the need for medical professionals to learn how to treat the patients that use these products.THE BOOK!The book will be electronic, rather than print. While our goal is to raise $7,500 to create the most basic book, the more we raise the more we can do! Initially, we will select 20 or more products, focused on CBD oil. With greater funding, we will be able to expand into vapes, edibles, and other products (that require a different testing methodology), and we will cover a wider range of tests (see below).Chapters: The cover will include original art, from Jill Woodworth’s daughter Sara. The book will contain chapters on cannabis, risk, and benefits, best research so far, traditional uses for cannabis, how to understand the label, and other consumer-oriented information.Analysis: The most basic analysis will include comparisons of ingredients, content quantity, problematic chemicals, certifications (to operate [in which states?], frequency of merchant testing, food handling, organic certification, etc.), customer complaints & reviews, and basic tests for contamination. As more funds are raised, more products, more types of products, and more forms of testing (pesticides, chemical residue, unreported ingredients, potency, etc.) will be planned.Testing the Tests: Because there has been an enormous improvement in-home testing kits and devices, we will add a stretch goal for “testing the tests”. This is especially important for medical cannabis, where it is vital that there is a high level of consistency from product to product or even batch to batch. That level of consistency would have prevented the seizures that Jill’s daughter experienced when she changed brands of CBD oil.Interaction: Because there is so much variability, and if the project is a runaway success, we want our donors to participate in the design and completion of the book. We want to regularly communicate with donors and give them the opportunity to vote on new stretch goals and work with our team to deliver a relevant and effective book that helps them in their lives.Next Year: If we are successful this year, we want to continue to build on that success in the future. Late in 2020, we want to produce a new, bigger book, covering more merchants in more depth. By 2021 we hope to convert the book to a database so that new reviews are immediately available.WE NEED YOUR HELP!We will be looking to EVERYONE AND ANYONE to give us feedback on which new chapters, products, and tests you want in the book, what products to test and if you have suggestions on guests for the podcast, we want to know! This is an interactive project and the more we are able to engage with our supporters, the more we can find ways to creatively guide the scope of the book to be as inclusive, informative and interesting as possible.  We hope to hold some live online events to interact with our audience, supporters....anyone looking to pose questions and contribute to the conversation on Medical Cannabis, CBD, Cannabis in general, your experiences, thoughts, insights, we want to hear them.  OUR TEAMIncludes: Jill Woodworth, Lisa Larson, Chris Niccolls and Amora Correa.Jill Woodworth: Human being, writer, podcaster. Chronicler of being human. Case manager of 5 offspring, 3 with Tuberous Sclerosis Complex. Managing the aspects of Intellectual Disability and Autism presents significant challenges as a human being, parent, caregiver, or sibling. TSC causes benign tumors to grow in the organs of the body. There is no cure but there are ways of managing care. That’s why I started TSC Talks, and it’s why TSC Talks is now taking a deep dive into cannabis medicine.Lisa Larson: Audio editor and Business Manager of TSC Talks, parent of two adult children, and married for 28 years to a man who is a paraplegic and deals with frequent pain and spasticity common with spinal cord injuries. When Jill asked me if I was interested in helping her on the podcast, I thought I’d give it a shot.  It wasn’t long before I was fully immersed in the podcast process, learning everything I could about audio editing as well as Tuberous Sclerosis Complex and other related conditions.  While I do not have anyone in my family affected, I became deeply affected by the unbelievable situations and circumstances of our guests as they shared their rugged stories dealing with the complex, chronic, often life-threatening manifestations of TSC, etc.  I’m energized by the opportunity to better understand Cannabinoid medicine, starting with CBD, crowdfunding to be able to find and test the most effective products, to provide a guide for families, while continuing to produce exceptional audio content to enrich and inspire. Chris Niccolls:Chris is the President and Chief Operating Officer of Nicky’s Gardens of Hope, a new non-profit, developing services to care for adults with Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities, (IDD) such as autism. Chris & Jill previously worked together on projects for Nicky’s Gardens and decided that collaborating on the Cannabis Project would be a great way to spread information about cannabis SAFETY and aid families that deal with IDD. Prior to Nicky’s Gardens and TSC Talks, Chris was an executive at global financial firms, investment banks, insurance companies, and research organizations. Chris’ expertise is in program design & reengineering and is responsible for the technical design of our Cannabis Project.Amora Correa:Amora is a journalism student, writer in the making, and mother of two. She is the Design Editor for the Goings on in The Gardens Newsletter at Nicky's Gardens of Hope, as well as a grant consultant for Nicky's Gardens of Hope.TESTING:A minimum of 20 products will be tested, although we want to test many more. And we will…. Depending on how much we raise.Our first focus is CBD oil, but with greater funding, we will expand (vapes, edibles, creams, etc.) Note: Different products may require different and incompatible testsIf we fail to raise the minimum funding, we will still report on… ingredients, content quantity, problematic chemicals, certifications (to operate [in which states], frequency of merchant testing, food handling, organic certification, etc.), customer complaints & reviews, and basic tests for contamination.If we raise more money we will test more products, more types of products, and more forms of testing (pesticides, chemical residue, unreported ingredients, potency, etc.). AND add a new section to talk about consumer-level testing kits.The book will contain chapters on cannabis, risk, and benefits, best research so far, traditional uses for cannabis, how to understand the label, and other consumer-oriented information.Interaction: we want to be very interactive with donors.We will periodically put out questions and surveys to determine the direction of the book.As funding rises, we want donor feedback on which new chapters, products, and tests they want in the book.We want the book to be as useful and relevant as possible for the donors.Thank you for supporting this project!https://tsctalks.comJill, Lisa, Chris & Amora

story:
What is the Polymath Protocol?

 

Well, first off let's talk about what it means to be a polymath in the first place.

 

/ˈpälēˌmaTH/

Noun

a person of wide-ranging knowledge or learning.

 

In other words a “Renaissance Man,” or “Jack of all trades.” Not all, but some of us have many interests in a wide array of disciplines. I have always found it difficult to undertake all of the projects I have drummed up whether it is learning an instrument, a new language, meditation or just physically working out. With all this expansive ambition, I have become so overwhelmed I tend not to do anything.

 

That’s where the Polymath Protocol came into being.

 

As people we have a tendency to see ourselves as already being a master at the endeavor we are trying to embark on, or we see our book as though it is already written without the work and time needed to truly bring it into being.

 

By doing a small amount in the morning and a little longer in the afternoon it forces us to move toward our goals in a much slower pace and yet yield results.

 

There are four categories and four different modifier cards in the deck. These different categories serve to help manifest a well rounded polymath. You determine what tasks, projects, games, workouts, ect. that you do when drawing a card each morning. (Unless instructed to do otherwise.)

 

Here’s how it works.

 

Draw 1 card in the morning. (except when instructed not to.)

Follow the instruction written on the card, within the category on that card. It’s that easy!

It is important NOT to “trade” in a card for a different category, this defeats the random sense of following this particular protocol for self growth. For example, you may feel like you have been doing MENTAL activities for a while and would like to switch it up. DONT! Follow the instructions on the card!

After you have completed the PM instruction, discard and wait until morning to draw a new card.

When you have drawn the last card in the deck shuffle them and begin anew!

story:
Sažetak

Na Međunarodnoj matematičkoj olimpijadi svake godine sudjeluje oko 100 država svijeta. Svaka država šalje ekipu od najviše šest učenika koji pokušavaju riješiti što više zadataka na natjecanju.

Organizacija tako velikog događaja bi Hrvatsku učinila još povezanijom sa svim državama svijeta i dodatno bi ju povezala s velikim svjetskim kompanijama koje sponzoriraju ovo natjecanje.

Što nam je cilj?

Za organizaciju ovog natjecanja u Hrvatskoj trebat će oko 10 milijuna kuna.

Ukoliko se, brojeći sve načine financiranja, sakupi dovoljno sredstava, Hrvatska će se javiti za organizaciju IMO-a u prvom slobodnom terminu. Novac će se dati na raspolaganje Hrvatskom matematičkom društvu koje će predvoditi kandidaturu Hrvatske.

Ako konačna suma ne bude dovoljna, novac će se iskoristiti za promicanje matematike u Hrvatskoj preko raznih projekata, kao npr. Ljetna/Zimska škola matematike itd.

Napominjemo kako je ovo dugoročna kampanja i novčani cilj zadan ovdje je samo dio onoga što nam treba kako bismo uspjeli. Podijelite li 10 milijuna kuna s brojem stanovnika u Hrvatskoj, ispada da svatko treba dati 2.50 kuna. Ukoliko kolektiv demonstrira snagu, uspjet ćemo u ovom golemom cilju.

Posljedice

Organizacija IMO-a u Hrvatskoj imala bi dalekosežne (pozitivne) posljedice za Hrvatsku.

Podsjetimo se, Hrvatska je bila domaćin prvenstava u rukometu, vaterpolu, futsalu itd., no države koje su sudjelovale na tim manifestacijama odavno znaju za Hrvatsku. Na IMO-u sudjeluje preko 100 država svijeta i dobar dio njih ne zna naći Hrvatsku na karti. Jasno, svi ljudi povezani s matematikom u tim državama bi tada čuli za Hrvatsku što otvara šansu za proširenje turističkog tržišta.

Također, velike međunarodne kompanije koje sponzoriraju IMO bi se na ovaj način dodatno približile Hrvatskoj što bi potencijalno ojačalo hrvatsku poziciju na znanstvenom i tehnološkom tržištu.

story:
Dizajnerica and Kul Pong Klub started a unique PROGRAM OF VIRTUALIZATION AND WEB ACCESSIBILITY OF CHILDREN'S PICTURE BOOKS. Our member Rea Ban got the opportunity to be shown on our web as a young author and also to inspire kids to join us and teach them of the possibilities of writing their own stories. We created our workshops where we teach the art of writing and how to be safe on the internet. We encouraged them to be creative, show them how to smartly use social media and spend less time on bad content and unsafe environments. We provide individual and group classes with interesting subjects and tools where they can express themselves.

Along goes the Ping Pong Klub where all Kids and recreatives can play recreationally and just have fun or spare excess of free time or energy. That is why we need larger space for our player and creatives in the same Club at the same place!

The result of the cooperation between Dizajnerica and Kul Pong Is a platform for young authors that can be a leaping board for the future or a place of fun where we promise lots of laughter, education and creativity and playing fun Ping Pong :)

KIDS ARE SPENDING QUALITY TIME WITH US!

e-mail: kulpongklub@gmail.com
web: www.kul-pong-klub.hr

READ PUBLISHED PICTURE BOOKS FROM OUR LITTLE AUTHORS

...................................................................................................................................................

Dizajnerica i Kul Pong Klub pokrenuli su jedinstveni program VIRTUALIZACIJE I WEB DOSTUPNOSTI DJEČJIH SLIKOVNICA. Naša članica Rea Ban prva je dobila priliku da ju na webu prikažemo kao mladu autoricu. Time želimo i ostalu djecu i mlade inspirirati da nam se priključe. Najprije u postavljanju njihovih već gotovih djela, ali i da u sklopu virtualizacije krenemo sa svojim radionicama na kojima bi osim kreiranja vlastitih bajki djecu, i sve koji to žele, educirali o sigurnosti na internetu, naučili ih da se isti može koristi za kreativnost, da se virtualni svijet i društvene mreže mogu pametno koristiti. Želimo im pokazati da i oni mogu dizajnirati svoj svijet te da naša kreativnost ne mora doma skupljati prašinu. Svi imaju šansu biti autori kao i čitati djela ostale djece te tražiti inspiraciju u njihovoj kreativnosti. Time ih želimo potaknuti da istražuju, stvaraju. I što više vremena razvijaju svoju kreativnost manje će biti izloženi lošim sadržajima, bit će u manjoj opasnosti kojoj su danas izloženi na društvenim mrežama i u digitalnom dobu.

PROLISTAJTE I PROČITAJTE SLIKOVNICE KOJE SMO OBJAVILI DO SADA

Sada želimo spojiti i Kul Ping Pong Klub sa Kreativcima. U stolnoteniskom klubu djeca i rekreativci mogu osim natjecateljski igrati i rekreativno, tek toliko da kvalitetno utroše višak svog slobodnog vremena ili energije. Zato nam je potreban veći i uređen prostor kako bismo mogli imati sve ovo u isto vrijeme na istome mjestu!

e-mail: kulpongklub@gmail.com
web: www.kul-pong-klub.hr

story:
Year 13

Responding to the Boston Globe's recent Valedictorians Project, which highlighted the significant barriers Boston high school graduates face in realizing their college and career aspirations, Digital Ready and the Wentworth Institute of Technology are launching a Year 13 for Boston high school graduates this Fall. With support from City Councilor Michael Flaherty, Year 13 is an innovative bridge year that ignites students’ passions, equips them with the skills necessary to navigate a complex, technology-driven world, and ultimately connects them to high-wage jobs in Boston’s innovation economy. 
 
Boston has a culturally and ethnically diverse population, a thriving and future-oriented economy, dynamic neighborhoods and communities, world-class education institutions, and a rich history of civic engagement and activism. On the other hand, not unlike other major U.S. cities, it also has significant gaps in income and wealth between racial and ethnic groups that have far reaching implications for access to high-quality public schools, affordable housing, healthcare, high wage jobs, and representation in leadership positions. So, it’s not surprising that only 6% of the STEM workforce is Latinx and 7% is Black.
 
This innovative Year 13 initiative will provide a no-cost, accelerated pathway for underrepresented young people—students of color, first-generation college students, students from low-income backgrounds—with the skills, experiences, and networks necessary to build tangible pathways to economic mobility and success in Boston's innovation economy. Year 13 will focus on the intersection of computer aided design (CAD), engineering, computer science, digital fabrication, Building Information Modeling (BIM), and robotics to ready students for the complexity of a constantly evolving economy and society. Using cutting-edge technology, students will "learn by doing" through modular labs and integrated work-based learning experiences taught by faculty and industry experts at the forefront of their fields. Students will leave Year 13 with the confidence, knowledge, and skills needed to successfully transition into college and future career paths related to architecture, engineering, and construction technology—all of which are building the backbone of Boston. 

What We Need & What You Get

Digital Ready is partnering with Fabwright Origins, one of our based learning sites for Year 13 in Dorchester, to offer perks to individuals that make a donation to support youth training in their studio related to design, digital fabrication and product development. Fabwright Origins is a visionary design firm that helps creatives do more using digitally augmented processes and tools.

The perks include;

  • $15 or more- Digital Ready Sticker
  • $50 or more- Digital Ready Tote Bag
  • $75 or more- Digital Ready T-Shirt
  • $100 or more- Fabwright Origins Black Lives Matter T-Shirt
  • $200 or more- Fabwright Origins Stashbox
  • $250 or more- Fabwright Origins Twist Cube
  • $500 or more- Fabwright Origins Wine Box
  • $750 or more- Fabwright Origins AVNCI Clock

The Impact

Wentworth’s President Dr. Mark Thompson stated that “our partnership with Digital Ready provides students with early college experience and immersions into STEM fields while exploring possible future career tracks and getting a head-start to become the next generation of innovators and leaders of Boston."

Year 13 is a unique collaborative partnership focused on giving Boston’s high school graduates the opportunity to excel in an outstanding institute like Wentworth - and in doing so, we will drive systemic change by reimagining what is possible for students.” said Dr. Sarah Cherry Rice, Executive Director and Founder of Digital Ready. “By leveraging the incredible resources and expertise in our city, and with help from our industry partners like Autodesk Inc., MassRobotics and The Boston Society for Architecture and our local community partners such as  Lena Park Fab Lab and Fabwright Origins, we have an unparalleled opportunity to open up access to college and STEM careers in Boston’s innovation economy for Black and Latinx youth. Our students are the innovators Boston has been waiting for.” 

Read more about Year 13 in the Boston Globe.
story_txt:
Year 13
Responding to the Boston Globe's recent Valedictorians Project, which highlighted the significant barriers Boston high school graduates face in realizing their college and career aspirations, Digital Ready and the Wentworth Institute of Technology are launching a Year 13 for Boston high school graduates this Fall. With support from City Councilor Michael Flaherty, Year 13 is an innovative bridge year that ignites students’ passions, equips them with the skills necessary to navigate a complex, technology-driven world, and ultimately connects them to high-wage jobs in Boston’s innovation economy.  Boston has a culturally and ethnically diverse population, a thriving and future-oriented economy, dynamic neighborhoods and communities, world-class education institutions, and a rich history of civic engagement and activism. On the other hand, not unlike other major U.S. cities, it also has significant gaps in income and wealth between racial and ethnic groups that have far reaching implications for access to high-quality public schools, affordable housing, healthcare, high wage jobs, and representation in leadership positions. So, it’s not surprising that only 6% of the STEM workforce is Latinx and 7% is Black. This innovative Year 13 initiative will provide a no-cost, accelerated pathway for underrepresented young people—students of color, first-generation college students, students from low-income backgrounds—with the skills, experiences, and networks necessary to build tangible pathways to economic mobility and success in Boston's innovation economy. Year 13 will focus on the intersection of computer aided design (CAD), engineering, computer science, digital fabrication, Building Information Modeling (BIM), and robotics to ready students for the complexity of a constantly evolving economy and society. Using cutting-edge technology, students will "learn by doing" through modular labs and integrated work-based learning experiences taught by faculty and industry experts at the forefront of their fields. Students will leave Year 13 with the confidence, knowledge, and skills needed to successfully transition into college and future career paths related to architecture, engineering, and construction technology—all of which are building the backbone of Boston. 
What We Need & What You Get

Digital Ready is partnering with Fabwright Origins, one of our based learning sites for Year 13 in Dorchester, to offer perks to individuals that make a donation to support youth training in their studio related to design, digital fabrication and product development. Fabwright Origins is a visionary design firm that helps creatives do more using digitally augmented processes and tools.
The perks include;

$15 or more- Digital Ready Sticker
$50 or more- Digital Ready Tote Bag
$75 or more- Digital Ready T-Shirt
$100 or more- Fabwright Origins Black Lives Matter T-Shirt
$200 or more- Fabwright Origins Stashbox
$250 or more- Fabwright Origins Twist Cube
$500 or more- Fabwright Origins Wine Box
$750 or more- Fabwright Origins AVNCI Clock


The Impact
Wentworth’s President Dr. Mark Thompson stated that “our partnership with Digital Ready provides students with early college experience and immersions into STEM fields while exploring possible future career tracks and getting a head-start to become the next generation of innovators and leaders of Boston."
Year 13 is a unique collaborative partnership focused on giving Boston’s high school graduates the opportunity to excel in an outstanding institute like Wentworth - and in doing so, we will drive systemic change by reimagining what is possible for students.” said Dr. Sarah Cherry Rice, Executive Director and Founder of Digital Ready. “By leveraging the incredible resources and expertise in our city, and with help from our industry partners like Autodesk Inc., MassRobotics and The Boston Society for Architecture and our local community partners such as  Lena Park Fab Lab and Fabwright Origins, we have an unparalleled opportunity to open up access to college and STEM careers in Boston’s innovation economy for Black and Latinx youth. Our students are the innovators Boston has been waiting for.” 
Read more about Year 13 in the Boston Globe.

story:
First experience:
I have been at sea for two weeks this past June. Aboard a sailing boat, my self and 3 others sailed along the southern coast of Spain (Andalucia) and then across the Mediterranean at the Port of Motril near Malaga to the enclave of Melilla, an autonomous Spanish city on the African Coast of the Mediterranean Sea. 

about me in the press:
http://redearedgnome.blogspot.com/p/in-press.html

This was as part of a cultural project, as a visual-artist/blogger, in participation with others from different mediterranean and European countries (Spain, Italy, Tunis, Algeria, Poland to name a few).This link will take you to the website of the organisation of this event that gave me my first sailing experience:

    http://www.clandestineintegration.org

   and an article written about it:

http://www.piuculture.it/2015/01/integrazione-clandestina-mediterraneo/

      Of the many wonderful experiences I had during those two weeks I learned many things about sailing, and had hands-on experience at the helm, night watches where we had to keep clear of big cargo ships and other traffic, and of course time with the dolphins!

      Now I am enamoured with sailing and seek to sail again, and again. To improve my chances of sailing again and to do so with more confidence, less dependance, and more involvement it is necessary to get certified. This is kind of like applying for a driving licence after you've learned the basics of car operation.

How you can help/where your contributions will be spent:-

      Through your contributions which will be directly paid as fees to cover travel costs and course/certification fees I may become a certified skipper. The levels of progress, and other competence certificates, after this are many (all the way to oceanmaster) and this is the main first step to be able to skipper a sailing boat and crew and sail it within limited distances from the shore.

     More about the certification can be found here:
                                                              http://www.rya.org.uk
     This campaign is to raise money to enrol in the "day skipper" course, followed by the "coastal skipper" course. The rest of the money is to cover travel expenses (airfare), certification costs and visa fees.
Follow this link for more about becoming a day-skipper:-
http://www.rya.org.uk/coursestraining/courses/sailcruising/Pages/Dayskipper.aspx

     Please note that any remaining funds will contribute to my team-mate and brother's (Sari Yuhanna) skipper certification. He is currently certified "RYA Competent Crew" and looking forward to the next step. 

Where will I do the courses/exams/become certified?

      I'm planning to move to Greece (Thessaloniki) very soon, last week of September, for the start of a Greek language course in October for study at the Aristotle University there. Working on the visa and other formalities. Depending on where I find a centre with English-speaking instructors I may be able to enrol in a centre on the coast there or in the UK.

Why sail?

      Sailing is a great way to travel, see various parts of the planet, meet people either as crew members or in ports moored and at beaches when anchored. There is very little cost beyond daily maintenance such as F&B and virtually no impact on the environment since the motor is usually only used to go in and out of port or to get back on course in case the wind is blowing you in a different direction. Sailing boats are definitely eco-friendly especially if compared to motorboats and other engine powered boats/ships/cruisers. Compared to flying, driving or taking a seat or berth on a cruise ship, a sailing boat's carbon footprint is very insignificant. Solar panels integrated on the surface of the boat by the manufacturer or later fitted on by the owner(s) is the main source of electrical energy during a journey, instead of gallons of gasoline! Bigger sailing boats even have wind turbines.

      Some of you may be wondering, but he doesn't have a sailing boat! Well, that is another feature of being a sailor, there is demand for your skippers (certified sailors that are first in charge of the boat) even without your own boat. For example, people sometimes buy a boat but can't sail it themselves, other experienced sailors would like assistance on longer trips and are also eager to teach others to bring the overall level up. Some owners and skippers actually just want to meet peers and enjoy good company on board a sailing boat at sea. Being a competent sailor is a gateway to a very intricate community of sea-farers and enthusiasts, millionaires and people who depend more on their skill and spirit than their finances. Not to mention the history of mankind and sea which spans back thousands of years before the first engine or pair of functional wings. I simply want to be part of this rich heritage, culture, and world. If not for anything else, for the adventure and the spirit of adventure!

          to see more about the sailing community goto:

                                                             http://www.crewbay.com/ 

                                                             http://www.crewseekers.com/

As evidence of good will and to inspire your confidence in me, I will keep posting on my blog(s) and you can follow my progress there.

More about me can be found on my blog:

http://redearedgnome.blogspot.com

and on this page where links to me in the press and in online articles can be found:

http://redearedgnome.blogspot.com/p/in-press.html

story:
Queremos ampliar nuestras instalaciones y equipos para crear un Campus Tecnológico para los más jóvenes, 

En el que puedan aprender y crear. Usando metodologías especializadas en educación STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics), con el mejor material de apoyo y a través de la realización de variados tipos de actividades.

Para que aplicando la tecnología de forma creativa: planteen, diseñen y creen soluciones a los problemas actuales y futuros de la humanidad, 

Las enseñanzas se ampliaran a niños de familias con pocos recursos económicos, niños operados de tumores cerebrales y viajes pedagógicos a países en vías de desarrollo para luchar contra en analfabetismo tecnológico.

Lets help FutureKidsNow ¡¡ We want to expand our facilities and equipment to create a Technology Campus for youngs and kids.
The teachings will be  extended to children from families with low incomes, children operated due to brain tumors and educational travels to developing countries to fight agains technological and digital illiteracy.
On campus they will be able to learn and create. Using specialized methodologies in education STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Mathematics), with the best material support and through modern types of activities and workshops.
Using technology creatively: they will arise, design and create solutions to current and future problems of mankind.﻿

story:
Our Mission

  • To provide a safe, no nonsense place for people to educate themselves on the safe handling of firearms. 
  • To increase proficiency through training, training, and more training.
  • To educate the masses through community education and outreach.
  • Provide a social gathering and meeting space for like minded firearm enthusiasts.

Our Vision

  • Four state of the art climate controlled indoor firing ranges.
    • At least one of those being a tactical range to provide realistic training
  • Pro Shop
    • Buy, Sell, Trade and Consign firearms
    • Ammunition
    • Firearm rental
    • Safety gear, holsters, bags, and vaults.
  • Gunsmith,
    • Cleaning
    • Maintenance and repair
    • Customization
  • Coffee Lounge
    • Relax before or after shooting and enjoy a cup of coffee and a pastry
  • Drop in Child Care center
    • Make sure the little ones are safe and entertained while you train.
  • Platinum Lounge
    • Relax in a club style setting with all the major games on television
    • Gun valet to hold your firearm after you shoot to enjoy the lounge
    • Lounge concierge 
    • VIP Shooting lanes
    • Working licensing but we envision a full service bar to enjoy a drink with friends after you shoot.

Community Involvement

We want to be able to reach out to everyone to help spread the word about safe firearm handling and responsible ownership. To reach as many people as possible, we will offer a free introduction to firearm safety course, to anyone who is even slightly curious. 

Free firearm safety courses for any child 12 or younger.

Beyond training we will establish the Armored Cow Gun Club Victim No More foundation to equip and train victims of domestic abuse referred by local sheriffs. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are calling this a fund raiser for seed money. It's going to cost a lot more than the $350,000 we are seeking to open the doors. But the bank won't take us seriously unless we can come to the table with the $350,000. It's also an all or nothing campaign, meaning we won't collect unless we can meet our goal. Fund raising rules by Indiegogo have us restricted to a 60 day window.

Why so many perks? Because you worked hard for your money and the boss doesn't think you'll want to separate with it unless you're going to get something out of it. If you want to chip in money without claiming a perk to help us out, that would be great, but we know there is no such thing as a free lunch so we worked hard to get as many perks together as we could offer and still be within the rules and policies of Indiegogo. 

More about the Perks

As we started looking for vendors, we started asking them if we could use some of their products for the perks. Almost all of them we approached said yes. So if we hit our fund raising goals, we will do a mass purchase of these products and have them shipped to the boss's house. His wife is going to love having all that stuff in her living room. Then we will get them shipped out to you. 

The memberships are the meat and potatoes of our fund raising goals.

We have three different tiers of memberships. Brass, Platinum, and Founding.

Any membership will come with a 30 day, 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you pre-purchase your membership during this Indiegogo campaign, you will have 30 days from the day we open the doors to decide if you like the club or not. For what ever reason, even if it's you don't like the colors we decided, you can get your membership initiation fee refunded. 

Brass, the basic club membership tier.

Brass membership level is for a single person and has these benefits:

  • No range fees
  • Schedule up to 10 days in advance up to two hours a day range time 
  • One hour free hand gun rental per year (excludes NFA; you cover the ammo),
  • Complementary firearms safety check each year
  • Ten (10) one (1) hour range passes per year,
  • FFL transfer fee of $15 (normally $30; excluding NFA)
  • Members only sales
  • Members only discounts
  • Members only product offerings
  • Discounted range ammo
  • Members only events and leagues
  • Free membership t-shirt

Brass + membership level is a spousal membership and includes all Brass benefits.

Brass + Family membership level covers spouses, and all dependents under the age of 18, includes all Brass benefits plus:

  • Discounted access to range child care center, the Armored Calf.

Platinum, our VIP membership tier.

Platinum membership is a spousal membership and enjoys all the benefits our Brass members enjoy and include:

  • Platinum Lounge
  • Access to Platinum Shooting Lanes
  • Priority access standard range
  • 10 guest passes per year (allows guest access to all Platinum lounge amenities)
  • Special pricing on all Pro Shop Non-Firearm items
  • One (1) Firearm purchase at cost per year
  • Free paper targets
  • Complementary use of all rental firearms (you just cover the ammo)
  • Free use of conference room (subject to availability, reservation required)
  • Firearm valet
  • Discounted gunsmithing
  • Discounted training
  • Schedule range time 14 days in advance (limit 2 hours a day)

Platinum + Family enjoy all the same benefits as the Platinum membership plus:

  • Free access to range child care center, the Armored Calf while on the range.
  • dependents receive 20% discount of initiation fees when they join independently.

Founding Member, VIP membership plus tier. 

Founding Member membership is a spousal membership and include all Platinum membership benefits plus:

  • 4 guest passes per month (allows guest access to all Platinum lounge amenities)
  • One (1) firearm purchase at cost every six (6) months
  • 50% discount on all classes
  • Schedule range time up to 30 days in advance (limit 2 hours a day) 
  • Founding membership is willable
  • Your name on the founding members wall 

Founding Family membership is a spousal membership and covers all dependents in the household under the age of 18, This level enjoys all the Founding Member benefits plus:

  • Free access to range child care center, the Armored Calf while on the range
  • Dependents receive 30% discount of initiation fees when they join independently

Please contact membership@armoredcowgunclub.com for information on becoming a Founding Member or Founding Family.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times can be hard, and a roof over your head and food in your belly is top priority so we understand if you can't contribute right now. Maybe you can help us other ways!

Our advertising budget is tight. Help us get the word out, share with all your friends on Facebook, Twitter, or via email using Indiegogo share tools. If 100 people had 20 friends each and they shared this, there would be 2,000 people seeing this. If each of those people had 20 more friends and shared this we would be seen by 40,000 people. That's a lot of people and if it was all done through sharing it would save us a lot of money.

See, you can help us out financially and you don't even have to open your wallet.

Our advertising budget is tight. Help us get the word out, share with all your friends on Facebook, Twitter, or via email using Indiegogo share tools. If 100 people had 20 friends each and they shared this, there would be 2,000 people seeing this. If each of those people had 20 more friends and shared this we would be seen by 40,000 people. That's a lot of people and if it was all done through sharing it would save us a lot of money.
See, you can help us out financially and you don't even have to open your wallet.

story:
Short Summary

People with disabilities, both children and adults alike in the Philippines do not get the support they need. Non Governmental Organizations have been an intrinsic part in empowering them in order for them to have quality lives. 

It is saddening that they do not get benefits however PWDs in the Philippines have proven to be capable and skilled, able to contribute only if they will be given the opportunities to do so. 

Twinkle, our crowdfunding initiative aims to be a HELPING ARM to these NGOs and people with disabilities. Their stories need to be HEARD and they deserve to be given ALL KINDS OF SUPPORT because their lives are absolutely important. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign aims to raise 10,000 Pesos or 200 US Dollars 

These will be going to three NGOs namely 

My Children's House of Hope- MCHH is a school for the  impoverished deaf community in the Philippines. 

Philippine Society for Orphan Disorders- PSOD is an institution that helps children born with rare diseases survive through medication and hospital assistance. However because of the lack of legal support , it is difficult for them to sustain funds for expensive medication. 

Foundation for These-Abled Persons- FTI empowers adults with disabilities through giving them livelihood and employment as well as training. 

All of this will be collected by August 15, 2016 and donated to these institutions. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our advocacy! Share the plight of PWDs in our country and let us all help each other in empowering them and allowing their stories to be heard

Donate now through Indiegogo or see more of our campaign at https://www.facebook.com/twinkleaiesecupd/

story:
Short Summary

This year, we, the University of Southern Mississippi Chapter of the Society of Physics Students are hosting our regional physics conference, which is open to the public.  We hope to make it an exciting and epic Physics conference. As a student group it is our goal to expose the community to the fun and exciting aspects of science.  Physics is the driving force behind all technological developments.  Frequently people, students in particular, feel intimidated by science.  With your help we will foster a greater thirst to pursue knowledge, understanding, and maybe an education in science, in the minds of young people .

Please join us if you are able this event is free and open to everyone!

What We Need & What You Get

We currently have some of the money we need to fund our event, but to make it an epic, unforgettable event we need just a couple more things. We are asking for $3285 to use to make all these awesome things and to help fund our physics conference.

 Your donations will allow us:

  • To make a Tesla Coil to play music and use as a demonstration
  • To make a transparent pool of Non-Newtonian fluid for people to play on
  • Help us have an Epic, Nerdy costume party
  • Help us have better food catered from a local restaurant and more!
If we go over our initial goal we have some further stretch goals to take this to the next level!  We will update this later.
We are offering several perks for donating:
  • We are currently making 3 different shirts for our event
  • We will have posters for the theme of our event
  • We will also give out Physics kits that can be used to do a variety of demonstrations. 
  • We will also upload videos of our party, a video of people playing on our pool of Non-Newtonian fluid, and a video of our awesome guest speaker!

Spread the Word!

While we'll be posting info all over our Facebook, we can only reach so many people! So please, use the IndieGoGo share tools to let everyone know about this awesome conference!

Risks & Challenges

While this is our first conference of this magnitude we our very confident in our abilities. We have been planning this conference since May 2014. We have sought advice from people who have planned similar events before so that we can ensure our plan will succeed. 

Please see our video :)
