story: n/a

Help Support Child-led, Hands-on, Experiential Learning!

Contributions will help The Lab for Hands-On Learning fund development of a new community outreach effort; construction of a new outdoor play-garden and work space; and cover operational expenses for Homeschool and Afterschool Enrichment Programs in the Arts and Sciences for children 3-12 years old in NE Los Angeles.

 

The Lab Mission and Goals

The Lab for Hands-On Learning is a uniquely different kind of enrichment center that is implementing current ideas about applied academics in an innovative way.  

The LAB believes that every child is a free and independent learner capable of determining the course of their own learning experiences. We know that children learn best when they participate in play with a diverse group of peers, and are free to inquire after topics and pursue goals that are immediately meaningful to their own lives and experiences.

We know that educational opportunities are best facilitated by caring adults skilled at providing thoughtful support for children’s social-emotional development, including fostering healthy peer relations, and helping children negotiate conflicts peacefully. Teachers at The Lab extend play and learning in a non-directive manner that encourages participation and collaboration over rote memory or repetitive exercises.

The Lab provides mixed-age, play-based, project-based, and interest-based learning in the arts and sciences for children 3-12 years old, conducted in a safe, stimulating environment staffed by adults trained to support children’s learning and emotional regulation. The Lab delivers a curriculum that promotes independent thinking, critical assessment, and creative problem solving.

The Lab’s curriculum and method emphasize process over product, and we strive to help children learn tools, methods, and understandings needed to become self-directed, empathetic, achieving adults. We hope, ultimately, that The Lab can be a place where children learn about themselves as they learn about the world around them.

 

Our History and Programs

The Lab for Hands-on Learning was founded in the belief that children truly thrive when they are given the chance to lead their own learning. Lab founders  have seen this belief in action in the field of early childhood education, where we have worked as teachers in various progressive models such as Regio Emellia, and Waldorf; in our roles as youth organizers working on grassroots popular education, and social entrepreneurship campaigns with at risk teens; and, of course in our own parenting.

The initial spark for The Lab, however, came from Gloria Williamson when, after trying unsuccessfully to find an environment that fostered the same kind of creativity and connectedness between peers that her children had grown in throughout preschool, she found herself thinking more and more about establishing that space herself.

After consulting with Efrim Chiavetta and others, the idea for The Lab went through several drafts and conceptual iterations. We discussed everything from being a modest arts based afterschool program for neighborhood children, to building a large scale project that incorporated a continuing education component for adults, and a fully accredited high school program.

Ultimately, Efrim and Gloria decided to give The Lab a test run as a Summer Camp. We leased a temporary space on the very scenic craftsman campus of Neighborhood Universalist Unitarian Church in Pasadena, launched a website, outlined what we call our Muses, or sources of inspiration for each week of programming, and began to accept registrations.

Once the Summer was under way, we very quickly realized we were on to something. We were told, often with enthusiasm and relief, that the approach we were taking - letting children take the lead on their projects, to learn through trial and error, and to take materials and ideas in directions entirely their own - was something that many families had been looking for for a long time. And this was particularly true of homeschooling families.

Over the next three months, as we watched the Summer Camp succeed beyond anything we had anticipated, we came to know many of these families, what kinds of factors contributed to their decision to homeschool, and what they were looking for in a supplemental program. And at each step along the way, we were encouraged to continue what we had started into the fall, and for the rest of the school year.

And that is just what we did. We leased another, smaller, room on the same campus, and launched The Lab Homeschool Support program, which not only continued the same child-led approach to arts and sciences we had started in the Summer, but also began a Parent Education component, because we know the vital importance of parental self care as well.

Having outgrown our temporary classroom in a matter of months, we found a new home in Eagle Rock, a community with a reputation for family friendly businesses and “hometown” atmosphere. And we could not be happier about our choice.

Currently we are offering Homeschool Enrichment and After School Programs five days a week, and on occasional Saturdays. We host a weekly Parent Discussion to give parents a chance to talk over issues, questions and challenges pertinent to their own parenting life. We hold a monthly speaker series that gives parents a chance to talk with experts in fields related to child development, education, and psychology. And once a month we open The Lab in the evenings to give children a chance to socialize together while parents enjoy a night out on the town at one of our local small business.

We are immensely excited about, and very proud of what we have achieved in such a short time, and particularly of the work we get to do every day, but we need help getting to the next level.

 

The Curriculum

Curriculum at The LAB is designed to both engage and follow a child’s natural curiosity and willingness to explore the world around them and engage it with their whole self. We are therefore committed to developing programs that are first and foremost Child Directed. We believe that children learn best when they are able to follow their inclinations and sense of wonder where it leads.

Each day at The Lab, children have the opportunity to engage with a variety of materials, projects and activities, such as:

2D and 3D art
Recorded music and musical instruments
Sensory and messy materials
Fine motor objects
Dance, yoga or movement
Quiet reflection
Reading and research
Outdoor gross motor movement
Living creatures
Building materials
Hand tools
Electronics or robotics
Natural loose parts
Found objects
Fabrics, string and rope
Cooking utensils and recipes
Physics, chemistry and biology experiments
And much, much more...

 

Why We Need Your Help

We truly believe in the work we doing at The Lab, and we hear from parents every week how important we are to their homeschooling or parenting regimens. And we have been embraced and encouraged by our Eagle Rock neighbors, both residents, and other small businesses alike. So, we are not alone on our belief that we are a resource worth preserving. We hope that you share that belief with us.

In many ways, The Lab is a passion project, a work of the heart, a way to build a community of parents and learners that can challenge the prevailing educational model of teaching to the test; that can help children develop empathy for others instead of simply following behavioural rules without context;  and can provide a space for children to feel both free and supported at the same time. We believe it is what children need today in order to build a safe and healthy tomorrow.

But there is also more than simply belief and passion at stake in our mission, current research is behind us also. There is ample evidence suggesting that the push-down of academics onto kinder and even preschool aged children leads to early academic burnout in students later in life. Countries like Sweden and Denmark have recognized the value of play and social interaction for young learners, and have decreased or eliminated homework while increasing play and free time in public schools. There is a nationally increasing shift away from “helicopter parenting,” with the rise in popularity of “adventure playgrounds” where children can engage in risky play without an adult over seeing the risks at every moment. And more and more value is being ascribed to outdoor play in general, and there are even whole pre-schools in Germany that are held entirely in the forest.

We also know, from watching both local and national trends, and from our interactions with parents each week, that families are taking education into their own hands in greater and greater numbers. In the short time that The Lab has been a resource for homeschooling families, we have talked to dozens of parents that are currently making or have already made the switch away from public education within the last year alone, some of them crediting The Lab with helping them to make their decision.

Because of this rising trend, The Lab is part of a growing, and in many ways, precedent setting network of parents, educators, therapists, and researchers that are redefining the methods and priorities of American education.

We are a new, and growing business in a quickly growing field, and this campaign with provide a bridge to our next phase of growth.

Check out our perks to see how you can get involved when you contribute!

 

The Plan

The $25,000.00 we are raising will be used for a three part initiative to grow into the next year. The three aspects of this initiative are:

  • Developing an Effective Community Outreach Strategy
    • Objective: To raise awareness of The Lab as a community resource for Homeschooling families in and around NE Los Angeles
    • Method: Conduct in-person outreach at meet-ups, schools, farmer’s markets, and other community events
    • Funding: Funding will be used for
      • Outreach materials, such as informational brochures, flyers and  digital presentations
      • Promotional items such as tee-shirts and banners
      • Professional sign painting for Lab facility
  • Constructing Outdoor Play-garden and Workspace
    • Objective: Create an outdoor space that can incorporate natural elements into an urban design
    • Method: 
      • Build and plant raised bed gardens
      • Construct a “Beehive” climbing structure and “playhouse”
      • Install a work shed for storage of outdoor tools and to house large-scale building and sculptural projects
      • Install play-ground quality turf and impact absorbing pads
  • Operational Expenses
    • Programmatic materials, including arts supplies, books, tools and building supplies
    • Staffing, including paid interns to maintain low adult to child ratio
    • Facility expenses including our upstairs parent retreat space, classroom spaces and play garden.

Your Contribution Matters

When you contribute to The Lab, you will be securing a resource that is an important part of many families lives and educational routine. You will allow us to gain exposure to a wider audience of parents, and help spread a method of teaching that treats children with the deep respect they deserve. You will be supporting a vital community resource that supports our neighborhood’s commitment to families.

And most importantly, you will be supporting a model of education that we hope will go continue to grow. We hope that with your help, we can make this period of growth count, as we prepare for the next steps in establishing ourselves as a vital community and family resource. Because we believe that the mission to build a foundation for creative and collaborative thinking, and negotiation based in empathy and care for the other, and a curiosity about the world that is able to explore the world peacefully is too important to lose.

And the rapid development and successes of The Lab to date shows a dedication to the work we are doing and the skill to follow through. Your contribution matters!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute there are ways that you can help!

  1. Let people know we are here!  Word of mouth (or social media) is still the best way for people to know about us. Please tell your friends; share our posts on social media, parenting groups and meet-ups; write a review on any of our social media sites; or if you are in town, come by and pick up some flyers to hand out on your way through Los Angeles each day.
  2. Tell others about this campaign! Do you know a family that believes in the kind of approach we take to education? Let them know that we can use their help too! Use the Indiegogo sharing tools and Spread The Word!
  3. Come by for a day! If you know us already, or have been thinking about giving us a try, now is the time! Sign up today!

Thank You for Supporting Progressive Education!

story:
We are encouraged by a very successful crowdfunding campaign on another platform. It was funded 150% to goal within 2 weeks of launch. All orders have been shipped.

------------

Our Mission and the impact on people:

Dear Champion,

Our mission is to spread our research outcome to as many people as we can, because we believe in it.

We present to you stories of the ‘magic’, the ‘power to change the destiny’, in the hands of anyone, however small or big, who is willing to work hard, who can dare to dream big and has the courage to pursue it despite the worst challenges. These are also the stories of the ‘magic’, which comes with the commitment to ‘utilize the success and wealth earned for the benefit of the underprivileged’. The true joys of the journey to success and the true joys of giving can be earned by anyone.

Please refer 'Sample story' and 'Paintings' at the end.

In short:

We researched several successful people of current times that are living their dreams. Although very diverse, yet they have the same basic ingredients, the fire within to excel and a big heart to give.

We urge you to find the fire already within you, stoke it, and race towards your mission with all your might. Enjoy the journey. You will love it. You will experience long term ‘true joys’, that, material distractions can never provide

Help others do the same, share your winnings, with the needy and the underprivileged. You will experience the ultimate in peace, joy and satisfaction that sometimes eludes the rich and powerful

Destiny will accumulate wealth in your hands, so that, like a good resource manager, you can utilize it well, not only for yourself, but also for the underprivileged

The book is also a collection of hand painted art masterpieces. These are our labor of love. 100% hand sketched and hand painted by talented artists. No computer work involved. A lot of thought and hard work has been invested in them. We hope these are able to connect you with the stories and help convey the message.

Please refer 'Sample story' and 'Paintings' at the end.

More details:

In this modern day and age, as we get busy with our life and career, sometimes we find ourselves and our kids getting influenced by material possessions. Unknowingly, we get exposed to evils such as greed, jealousy, anger, lack of awareness and inspiration about responsibilities towards our own self, our families and our society. Through this book, we are trying to prevent people from this distraction and help focus on true goals.

This is a compilation of real life stories of men and women who dared to dream big. Out of scores of living legends, we handpicked a diverse group with different nationalities, ethnic backgrounds and age groups. Several had a very modest background. They did not win a lottery, did not find a hidden treasure nor did they receive hereditary wealth. They were passionate about different things – few enjoyed entrepreneurship and business, while others enjoyed singing, dancing, writing, sports and few others enjoyed fighting for human rights. 

They had one thing in common - They all had a fire burning within to chase their dreams. They had the courage to follow their passion. They went all out to execute it. The road to success was not easy. Their journey was a roller coaster of successes and challenges. The strength of passion within them helped fight all challenges. They did not succumb. The universe conspired to make them succeed. It was magical. They experienced the true joys of their journey. They shared their winnings with the underprivileged and experienced the true joys of giving as well.

They always had a larger than life mission, to help other people, to work for a cause or to eradicate a social evil. After achieving fame and wealth, they did not squander it away. They were aware that they are managers and the not the owners of the wealth and resources. Realizing that, beyond a certain point, money had little importance for them and there are others in this world that are in dire need of resources. These champions used their time and resources to set up foundations that are helping the underprivileged across the world.  While Bill Gates founded ‘Bill and Melinda Gates foundation’ with a significant part of his own donations, Sindhutai Sapkal dedicated her entire life to caring for the orphans. She spent time educating them and providing them basic necessities such as food, water and shelter. All these champions experienced the Joy of Giving.

We urge you to be the force and take others forward. Spread the message amongst your kids, your relatives, your neighbors, colleagues and elders. We don’t control our entry into this world, but we have the power to decide how we want to exit, in a manner that there are no regrets. We truly believe that there is no age for chasing your dreams and helping the needy. So wherever you are, get started. You have already taken the first step as you believe in this and hence are reading this.

Each story of the book ends with suggested next steps on how you can make an impact as an individual.

Happy Reading Champion ! 

Please refer 'Sample story' and 'Paintings' at the end.

 

Raising Funds:

We have completed writing the book, 35+ stories. Our panel of talented artists have completed creating 75 + truly outstanding hand painted art masterpieces 

As we strongly believe in our mission, we have invested our own money and have self published the book. We have printed 2,000 copies that are ready to ship. Within 1 week of launch, we have shipped 200+ copies already. New orders are pouring in. We have received glowing reviews from our early readers.

Encouraged by the strong initial demand, we want to scale up our operations quickly. Hence we want to raise funds. We need about $10,000 to market the book internationally as well as scale up the operations of printing and shipping the books, hire a team and invest in technology.

Investment Plan:

International book marketing: $2,000

Technology investment: $2,000

Print additional books: $5,000

Operational scale up: $2,000

 

Risks & Challenges

 

We have already printed 2,000 copies so we are ready to ship immediately. In anticipation of immediate large orders from Indigogo campaign, we have kept our book printer on standby to be able to scale up rapidly, on demand. We have also identified additional reputed and established book printers to be able to print large orders quickly. They have been suppllied with necessary material to be able to ramp up printing on demand.

We have also tied up with reputed international shipping companies to be able to quickly ship across the world.

Our plan for book marketing, technology investment and operational scale up are intended to run in parallel. We don't expect any risk to immediately fulfill orders from Indiegogo.

 

Please help:

We truly believe this book will help fire up the energy levels of your kids, your family, your loved ones, your teams in your organizations and yourself.

1. Please buy the book for your loved ones

2. Please help spread the word to your friends and family

 

Book printing quality:

Book size: Book is of large size (coffee table book). Its 12.5 inches length by 12 inches width by 1.5 inches height.

Book cover: Hard bound

Paper Quality: 170 gsm premium quality paper

Shipping: Book will be sealed to make it water proof during shipping. Book will be shipped in a strong box to prevent any damages during shipping

 

Sample Story: Mia Hamm

 

 

Mia as a child was very shy. She was the fourth of six siblings. She was born in a military family who moved to a new place every 2 -3 years. Mia found it difficult to make friends because of her shy nature.  She wore corrective shoes as a toddler after being born with a club foot. She didn’t let her handicap discourage her and went onto become one of the most successful international soccer players.

The Journey:

 Mia was very different from other girls. She did not like playing with dolls or dressing up. Mia’s mother wanted her to be a dancer and enrolled her in ballet classes. Mia hated it and would run out of each class.  

Mia started playing soccer when she was very young. In that era, soccer was considered to be a boys’ game, however this did not bother her. She dared to play soccer when other girls were confined to the house. Her father encouraged her and coached her too. She often played soccer with her elder brother, Garrett, whom her parents had adopted. She loved him more than her own siblings. Sports helped Mia make friends whenever she moved to a new town. 

Mia was passionate about soccer since childhood and dreamt to be the best soccer player in the world. At 5, she joined her first soccer team. She was a natural at soccer. At junior high school, her talent and hard work made her excel at boys’ football team. She was able to achieve this, despite being short. Her height definitely did not provide her an edge in soccer.

The road to achievement of her goals was not easy. Mia had to manage school work and soccer practices and games together. Hence, she would wake up early in the morning and stay up late at night to finish school work. She also trained hard for her games. At 15, she was the youngest soccer player to play for the national team. She played with U.S. women's national soccer team for 17 years. 

With unparalleled dedication, Mia became one of the greatest female athletes of all time. She won the Women's World Cup in 1991 and 1999. She won Olympic gold medals in 1996 and 2004. She held the record for most international goals scored until June 2013. At 32, she retired with a record 158 international goals.

She is a role model for many girls. She proved all girls should chase their dreams no matter how unattainable or difficult they may seem. She also proved that girls are just as strong, determined and capable as boys.

Mia has been honored with many awards such as ‘U.S. Soccer Female Athlete of the Year’ five years in a row from 1994 to 1998. She made it to the ‘FIFA 100’list. In 2013, Mia became the first woman inducted into the ‘World Football Hall of Fame’, located in Pachuca, Mexico.

 

The Joy of Giving:

Mia lost her brother, Garrett, due to a rare bone marrow disease. She was heart broke. She made it her mission to help others in need of bone marrow transplants and to encourage people to become donors. She established ‘Mia Hamm Foundation’ dedicated to raising funds and awareness for bone marrow and cord blood transplants. The foundation is also focused on the development of opportunities for young women in sports. 

Mia along with her family printed up one-page flyers with her brother's story and his need for a bone marrow transplant. She took these flyers to every event she attended in order to educate people. She believed that educating people is very important as they will be able to help only when they are aware. Mia is optimistic that one day bone marrow donations will gain similar popularity as blood donations. The foundation sponsors all-star exhibition soccer matches, and during half time, marrow recipients are given the opportunity to meet their donors whom they had not seen before. Mia cherishes the emotional outburst she witnesses during this time.

After having set an example for girls to chase their dreams in sports without thinking about gender and other challenges, she hopes that young women will continue to participate in sports actively. She also hopes that the families will provide the required support to their girls needed for them to excel in sports. 

Mia’s message for the world is that “Failure happens all the time. It happens every day in practice. What makes you better is how you react to it”. 

 

Let’s help Mia in her mission to “Educate people on bone marrow transplants”

For Our Readers:

1. What did you like about Mia and what are ‘your leanings’ from this story? 

2. If you are passionate about sports and would like to contribute to Mia’s dream, here are some suggestions

3. Identify talented children in sports and provide them the support required to chase their dreams

4. You can organize fun matches and raise funds to help such children

5. Create awareness about bone marrow transplants. If you are a doctor, you may want to arrange a meet of the needy with the donors
story_txt:
We are encouraged by a very successful crowdfunding campaign on another platform. It was funded 150% to goal within 2 weeks of launch. All orders have been shipped.
------------
Our Mission and the impact on people:
Dear Champion,
Our mission is to spread our research outcome to as many people as we can, because we believe in it.
We present to you stories of the ‘magic’, the ‘power to change the destiny’, in the hands of anyone, however small or big, who is willing to work hard, who can dare to dream big and has the courage to pursue it despite the worst challenges. These are also the stories of the ‘magic’, which comes with the commitment to ‘utilize the success and wealth earned for the benefit of the underprivileged’. The true joys of the journey to success and the true joys of giving can be earned by anyone.
Please refer 'Sample story' and 'Paintings' at the end.
In short:
We researched several successful people of current times that are living their dreams. Although very diverse, yet they have the same basic ingredients, the fire within to excel and a big heart to give.
We urge you to find the fire already within you, stoke it, and race towards your mission with all your might. Enjoy the journey. You will love it. You will experience long term ‘true joys’, that, material distractions can never provide
Help others do the same, share your winnings, with the needy and the underprivileged. You will experience the ultimate in peace, joy and satisfaction that sometimes eludes the rich and powerful
Destiny will accumulate wealth in your hands, so that, like a good resource manager, you can utilize it well, not only for yourself, but also for the underprivileged
The book is also a collection of hand painted art masterpieces. These are our labor of love. 100% hand sketched and hand painted by talented artists. No computer work involved. A lot of thought and hard work has been invested in them. We hope these are able to connect you with the stories and help convey the message.
Please refer 'Sample story' and 'Paintings' at the end.





More details:

story:
Convert your watchX into an Arduino with standalone battery, OLED display, Bluetooth and various sensors. (check watchX specs below the page for more detail)

The Arduino Adaptor allows you to use the full power of watchX hardware in Arduino form. So that you can make your custom projects in only a single package that will usually require much more Arduino shields.

What is in the box?

  - 1 x Arduino Adaptor for watchX

  * requires watchX to work

Create your own games. Or play 100+ games developed by others. With this G-Pad accessory, watchX becomes fully Arduboy compatible. Thanks to great Arduboy Community, you can start programming games right away.

What is in the box?

  -  1 x G-Pad for watchX

  * requires watchX to work

Robots are everywhere! They challenge the harsh conditions from the bottom of the oceans up to far planets orbiting around the sun. To get started with robotics you must learn about motor control, reading sensors and decide what to do with a smart algorithm.

The Rover Robot uses the watchX as it's brain and controls two tracks connected to two motors. We have designed it in a way to maximize it's roving capability. You can climb up and down through and cover different styles of terrain with ease.

It also has an ultrasonic distance sensor looking forward for obstacles and two line following sensor for different projects. But! there is more... It is also Pixy 2 compatible. This means that you can learn image processing with Pixy and use it in real-life applications right away.

* Please not that the video belongs to an early prototype of the Rover Robot. The final design will be the same as the rendered images.

What is in the box?

  - 1 x Rover Robot chassis

  - 1 x Rover Robot PCB

  - 1 x Ultrasonic distance sensor 

  - 1 x Track Set

  - 1 x AAA Battery holder (doesn't includes batteries)

  - 1 x Assembly components package

  * requires watchX to work, comes as disassembled out of the box.

 

watchX in Detail

Ok, you liked the accessories but you want to know more about the watchX? It is a smartwatch that you build and code yourself.

Roadmap

 

Team

We are a group of engineers who are passionate about what they do. We believe in the power of iteration. So, we wake up every day and do our best to improve ourselves and deliver the best products we can.

Risks & Challenges

There are always challenges in mass production. We have to make sure our products will be secure and reliable and they can be manufactured efficiently at large volumes.

Thankfully, we have strong experience in PCB design and manufacturing process from our ex-work. We still keep in touch with people whom we supplied electronic components and bare PCBs. We also established very good relations with manufacturers in Shenzhen/China. Moreover, watchX does not require the same tooling cost and manufacturing risks as products with injection molded plastic require.

And as you know, we have successfully finished our first campaign. We got backed by people from 45 different countries. Thanks to their support, there are more than 2000 people using the watchX all over right now. And we have a groving community day by day.

Of course, there are risks involved with the manufacturing. Unexpected changes in component lead times or availability are examples of factors that can affect the delivery timeline. We are doing our best to minimize these risks and deliver the products right on time.

The other risk with our product or any other product is shipping. There are a number of unforeseen incidents that can cause problems during shipping of the products. We plan to work with proven companies that will carry the products safe and sound to your doorstep.

story:
Short Summary

We should be happy to engage with trenchant criticisms of aid – it is important to do so if those of us involved in the development sector are to retain credibility in the long-term.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Rich countries might be going through some tough times but that doesn't change the fact that they owe the rest of the world

The Impact

We have mixed impacts, can harm as well as help development and takes the focus away from other more important things rich countries should be doing to spur development. African governments should set out medium-term plans to reduce aid dependency, while rich countries need to switch from traditional forms of aid-giving to supporting global goods (like clean energy, vaccinations, security) in new ways.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
[If there is any issue while contributing, Kindly Tez at Mukesh Babu 7896889029 or contact us at ysbhargav123@gmail.com or mukeshdes14@gmail.com]
 

ABOUT US

Hi there! Thank you for taking the time to go through our campaign. We are Bhargav www.linkedin.com/in/sreebhargav and Mukesh www.linkedin.com/in/mukeshbabu25. We are students from IIT Guwahati who are about to graduate this year. We’re from the Mathematics and Design department respectively. One thing common to both of us is the hunger to create impact in this world by building sustainable solutions for the future. We both have our own journey through which we developed inclination towards entrepreneurship.

We are driven by two things - our passion for the process of building a user-centric product, and the need to create a positive impact in people’s lives and the environment.

But how exactly did this take shape? When we went beyond our comfort zones, classrooms and started looking around us. We understood the issues we wanted to solve.

To create the next revolutionary start-up for future India


The top 1% of the Indian population owns 73 % of the wealth generated in the country and hence there is a huge financial irregularity in the society. Resources are rapidly drying up and there is now a need to optimise consumption and reduce wastage. Financial irregularity, affordability and sustainability are the major issues we want to solve, and so, we’ve decided to start LensHood, a Peer to Peer creative equipment rental platform with a focus on building a trustworthy community which shares equipments amongst its members .

We aim to empower people by increasing affordability via renting and giving them an avenue to earn via lending, and in the process drive sustainability.

 

GIVING BACK TO THE SOCIETY

We have always wanted to add value wherever possible. We focus on leadership and empowerment. One trait that we both share is compassion . We only want anybody who comes in contact with us to do better in their life and hence always think how we can make a difference.

Head of Entrepreneurship Development Cell, IIT Guwahati

Built the start-up ecosystem in the region with focus on many grassroot-level entrepreneurs who lack support and exposure.  https://www.facebook.com/ecell.iitg/?fref=nf

Offering a platform for root level entrepreneurs of India to gain exposure

Organised a 2-day entrepreneurship summit which is the biggest in the whole of North-East to create a platform where the local entrepreneurs and students can interact with the nationally renowned entrepreneurs.

Notable ones include Dr.Ritesh Malik - CEO,Innov8 - Serial Investor , Mr. Balaji Vishwanathan - CEO,Invento Robotics , Mr. Ankit Nagori Ex-CBO Flipkart, Dr. Roshni Kumar Yambem - CEO Globizs.

Organised the first Social Entrepreneurship Conclave

With a strong will to promote social entrepreneurship in North-East India, single-handedly brought 7 social entrepreneurs across the globe.

Notable ones include Dr.Rich Fletcher directs Mobile Technology Lab at MIT D-Lab Boston, Mr. Abhishek Mazumdar - CEO Logical Indian, Mr. Aashish Beergi - CEO, Mash Project.

How we changed the life of a school student from rural Assam

Mr. Amlan Jyoti Khanikar  was a class 11 student from tier 2 city in Assam, when he participated in the entrepreneurship summit. He was full of dreams was struggling to find a mentor. He found a mentor in the summit and it changed his life forever. He got into the right direction and went on to inspire more students from Under-developed North-East India. 

 

ABOUT MIT BOOTCAMP

MIT Global Entrepreneurship Bootcamps are intense week-long programs that challenge participants to develop a sustainable new venture in a week. Innovators come from around the world to learn from MIT faculty and MIT-trained mentors. Bootcampers learn the same innovation framework and curriculum taught in core entrepreneurship classes at MIT, and practice critical skills required to be leaders and drive innovation and collaboration: teamwork, leadership, communication, mutual goal reinforcement, and giving feedback. The Bootcamps are a key component in MIT’s Global Strategy and focuses on shaping the future of education and learning.

MIT Bootcamp Video

 

 

 

MIT Bootcamp Alumni Progress

MIT​ ​Global​ ​Entrepreneurs

There are 381 Bootcamp participants (Bootcampers) from 70+ countries. Collectively they have launched over a 100 new ventures raising over $36 million. Five Bootcampers were selected for Forbes​ ​30​ ​under​ ​30​:

Leonika Sari, Class 1 (Healthcare & Science)

David Anderton, Class 1 (Media)

Nasir Yammama (Class 2)

Karan Jerath, Class 4 (Energy)

Keiana Cavé, Class 4 (Energy)

Recently, Simplify a startup founded by Yen Pei Tay (Class 2) was named to Fast Company’s Top 50 Most Innovative Companies list for 2017.

Acceptance letters:


 

IMPACT OF ATTENDING THE MIT BOOTCAMP

After three rounds of interviews, we are privileged to have been accepted into the MIT Entrepreneurship and Innovation Bootcamp, and we believe that this experience will help bolster our skills and confidence as we go forward building our solution in India. We are the ones after just 33 Indians who have got selected for this prestigious bootcamp in the previous years. This is the first time ever that anyone from IIT Guwahati will be attending the bootcamp, and we hope to raise IIT-G's flag high!

The camp is an intense 20 hours/day week long program, over the course of which a team of around five people have to identify a problem or an opportunity, create a solution, understand if it works financially and then pitch it.

  • To be able to attend the camp would mean the opportunity to attempt such a formidable challenge and in the process, push ourselves beyond our limits. Just surviving this, would bring about a tremendous change. Working with other participants from all across the world, each with their own diverse perspectives, will expose us to a global viewpoint.
     
  • Exposure to global problems to understand global markets.
     
  • We would also be mentored by the world class faculty of MIT including, _ and _ , which helps validate our thought process and the decisions we make.
     
  • We would build and be connected to a vast network of current and future entrepreneurs.
     
  • Moreover, after returning from this week-long convention, we aim to share our learnings and experiences with the rest of the students community in various colleges, and instill motivation among students like us to continue this culture of business innovation and entrepreneurship.
     

HOW YOU CAN HELP US

Hailing from middle-class families in India, it’s extremely difficult to finance ourselves. Hence, to transform this into a reality, we require financial support.

We have been in talks with the institute for some assistance, as Alumni departments from other IITs fully support their students to go to such conventions and conferences. But unfortunately, there is no centralised system in Guwahati, yet.

Not the ones to sit back, we have decided to raise the funds ourselves and bring about the change that we want to see. We are positive that we can make it, thanks to fellow entrepreneurs, caring IIT-Guwahati family we all are a part of. Today it's us, tomorrow it will be more from our country. All this process needs to kick-start is a small push, initiative and kind-hearted individuals like you!

 

What we need

Tuition fees: $6000 x 2 = $12000

Airfare ~ $2250 x 2 = $4500

Living expenses ~ $450 x 2 = $900

Our contribution : $ 2500

Total cost : $17500 - $2500

Need to be raised : $ 15000

 

We understand that this is a huge goal to meet, but we would be grateful for any amount that you could chip in. Your financial support will really make a difference and help us embark on this transformative journey. You can do so via the following:

Tez - 7896889029

 

 

Other ways to help

Please share this fundraiser with your network, friends, and family. Use the Indiegogo share tools or any other methods of getting the word out there.

We all have a dream; we have started working on ours, will you support us?
story_txt:
[If there is any issue while contributing, Kindly Tez at Mukesh Babu 7896889029 or contact us at ysbhargav123@gmail.com or mukeshdes14@gmail.com] ABOUT USHi there! Thank you for taking the time to go through our campaign. We are Bhargav www.linkedin.com/in/sreebhargav and Mukesh www.linkedin.com/in/mukeshbabu25. We are students from IIT Guwahati who are about to graduate this year. We’re from the Mathematics and Design department respectively. One thing common to both of us is the hunger to create impact in this world by building sustainable solutions for the future. We both have our own journey through which we developed inclination towards entrepreneurship.We are driven by two things - our passion for the process of building a user-centric product, and the need to create a positive impact in people’s lives and the environment.But how exactly did this take shape? When we went beyond our comfort zones, classrooms and started looking around us. We understood the issues we wanted to solve.To create the next revolutionary start-up for future IndiaThe top 1% of the Indian population owns 73 % of the wealth generated in the country and hence there is a huge financial irregularity in the society. Resources are rapidly drying up and there is now a need to optimise consumption and reduce wastage. Financial irregularity, affordability and sustainability are the major issues we want to solve, and so, we’ve decided to start LensHood, a Peer to Peer creative equipment rental platform with a focus on building a trustworthy community which shares equipments amongst its members .We aim to empower people by increasing affordability via renting and giving them an avenue to earn via lending, and in the process drive sustainability. GIVING BACK TO THE SOCIETYWe have always wanted to add value wherever possible. We focus on leadership and empowerment. One trait that we both share is compassion . story:
Summary

Hi, I’m Mark Tilden.  I was an Investment Advisor for 18 years.  When my daughter was four, I really wanted to give her a head start in life by teaching her some good basic habits with money. Financial advisor or not, I didn’t know how or what to teach a four or five-year-old. I couldn’t find any literature for that age group either.

So I wrote “The Adventures of Princess Mikaila and Prince Pete” The first bedtime stories that can actually help your kids’ dreams come true. Financial literacy, in fun stories. 

This book is a start but we need more content for older age groups, more languages, and more games and activities. And I need help spreading the word. That's why I need your help.

Where your money goes

Your donations:

1-Create more new content for the next age groups, and other langauges

2-Over $20 sends out copies of these books where they can have the greatest impact in creating a culture of financial literacy.  Effectively making you an active particiapnt in creating positive change.

3-Over $10 gives you the very first sneak peak of The Adventures of Princess Mikaila and Prince Pete in PDF format for you to download.

The first edition cost roughly $15 000 to write,illustrate,edit,print,and promote.

Immediate plans call for two more books for older age groups (8-12yrs & 13-17yrs), and a french and spanish translation of The Adventures of Princess Mikaila and Prince Pete. Each of which is a new printing that will require roughly the same amount again for each translation, not to  mention a games and activities workbook.  

Please donate generously, to help me make the content that is needed for teaching literacy to our children, and spread the booksto where they will have the most impact!

Advocate Army

Your donation buys book(s) that are donated to LEARN (Leading English Education and Resource Network).  LEARN is a non-profit educational organization with a mandate to provide English learning resources and in Quebec to help elementary and secondary schools with teaching tools and content.  Thanks to your donation, they will distribute your book to where they are needed most to provide the foundations for Child Financial Literacy in our society

The Starlight Children’s Foundation

Besides being my muse, Mikaila is a medical marvel who’s story began by overcoming some very auspicious beginnings.  Starlight was there, helping to make the unthinkable bearable.  So now, I am very pleased to support this wonderful organization whose goal much like mine, is to make children smile and families cope.  $1 from every paperback sold, will go to smiling children and coping families

Risks and Challenges

No risks.  No shipping. No extra costs.  Just choices to help you help me make and spread content to help Solve Child Financial Literacy.

Books and Availablility

The Adventures of Princess Mikaila and Prince Pete are available for e-book download at www.kidsmartmoney.com; and the first edition paperbacks will be available at all on-line retailers by Dec 6th 2018.

Spread the Word

If you like the idea of Child Financial Literacy and the difference it can make, please become an advocate by spreading the word.  Use Indiegogo’s share tools, or share our website www.kidsmartmoney.com, or our Youtube video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uW4fqu0VDm0

story:
Short Summary

I require your support in order to make this dream a reality, because I believe that the experience gained from the bootcamp will fast track my project and give me the much need business knowledge to build a reputable start up, once the project is completed. 

My tuition fee for the bootcamp is $11,000, I need $4,000 for accommodation, flight ticket and other modalities. 
I greatly anticipate your support, thank.

What We Need & What You Get

My tuition fee for the bootcamp is $11,000, I need $4,000 for accommodation, flight ticket and other modalities. I greatly anticipate your support, thank. 

In order to raise funds also in order for me to attend the MIT bootcamp in Japan, I started a clothing store. 

www.godspeednaija.com

It has some cool sweatshirts, hoodies, t-shirts and bags. The profits raised from the sales on the site, would go into my funding my way to Japan. 

The Impact

This opportunity would help me achieve the following:

  • To build an AI system that can understand African intonation 
  • To gain the much needed knowledge to turn this idea into a viable business. 
  • An opportunity to inspire others Africans to break into the AI community 

Risks & Challenges

Some challenges I would face  and risks I would take are:

  • I have never been to Japan before and the culture would be new to me. I would study Japanese culture before the trip and get a visa in order to travel to Japan. 
  • I am relatively new to the AI world and I am still learning how to program an AI
  • I am committed to learning and I am willing to discipline myself and learn all I need to build this AI. I am currently taking courses on EdX in artificial intelligence, inorder to increase my knowledge in that field

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Visit www.godspeednaija.com and buy the products on the site. The profits from the sales would help go into the funding for the campaign. 
  • Share with others and tell people about this campaign.

story:
What does Jein suggest?

We decided to create a platform that will make it much easier for students to master the exact sciences, such as physics or maths. Parents will be able to clearly understand the advancement of their children; meanwhile tutors and teachers will get an opportunity to easily organize spare work.

 

The most important part of studying is the learning process. Using the app makes it is easy to customize this process for each user individually. As well as, organize the material as efficiently as possible.

 

In short, this is not an ordinary textbook with information and tasks, but a smart dynamic system. 

Learn everything with your smartphone

It will be possible to solve tasks of any degree of complexity, and ask for clues if something does not work out. No more need for a textbook and a notebook, or to constantly ask the teacher what to do next. 

Important diagnosis for adults

Parents are given a convenient opportunity to receive all the information about their child’s progress, as well as how it compares to other kids. 

 

It will also be helpful for teachers to understand the level of their students: they will be able to see students’ statistics quickly. Moreover, conveniently assign tasks without spending too much time recording, sending and checking - the program does it by itself! You can always create your own tests, tasks or lectures, and send them to the students you want. Each teacher even has the opportunity to create their own course and share it with anyone they want.

 

More precisely, you can send a task to several dozens of users at once. The program will automatically check them and show the scores with full description of any mistakes made.

Now a little bit of an interface...

Everyone has their own account, where it is possible to see their latest stats, posts from other users, achievements and ratings. Also, if you want, you can observe other users (for example, friends) for the competition.

The statistics for a week show the following items:

  • Number of lectures passed.
  • Solved tasks with information about the process itself (found in the editor).
  • Hours of lectures watched in Jein.
  • The topics learned by the user, and the percentage of their understanding. If the system sees what you have or may have problems with, it notifies and gives recommendations. For example, in the form of additional information or repetition of material, and specific tasks.
  • Achievements in comparison with other children.
  • Messages from other users.

  • Homework from teachers.

Let's consider the additional functionality in the example of geometry.

What is the editor?

Here you can bring to life all your creative ideas from strange and chaotic figures, to standard tasks even faster than on paper!

Jein is able to solve specifically your problems. And present solutions in the form of prompts of different types - invoking (remember the properties of an isosceles triangle) or specific (section AB = BC through the isosceles triangle ABC). However, the answers can only be unlocked by solving a few simple tasks. The system also memorizes when answers are used, so it's best to try solving it yourself. Of course, a parent or teacher may disable this feature if they deem it appropriate. The video shows all the basic functionality.

 

Now about lectures - one of the most important moments of studying. Here, Jein sets up for you a set of themes that you can explore by clicking on the button.

 

It will contain texts with theoretical knowledge, videos from professors and illustrations for a better understanding.

After learning theory, different tasks will be offered on the subject studied. There are different levels of difficulty, which is tailored to each user individually. When choosing a task, we automatically go to the editor, where the question is already drawn up and remains to be solved. If there are problems in the process, then the function of the tooltip might help. However, it does not solve all the tasks.

Competition is an excellent entertainment portal where you can test your knowledge and wit. The program automatically selects opponents matched to your level of knowledge.These competitions will be in the form of tests with time limits (5-15 seconds). Simple tasks are given on an idea, one formula, knowledge of a theory, or simply interesting questions.

 

Our platform for training can be launched on any smartphone, tablet, or even online in your browser.

This is where you come in

Your funds will be used to maintain servers so that everyone can quickly receive and store the required information. We also want to work with professional instructors who can create quality lectures for children. As for the program itself, a part of raised funds will be spent on acceleration of the creation of the functioning parts of the toolkit. After closing these issues, we have to register the product officially with all the documents and lawyers to enter the market. Well, at the very end, the remainders will go to advertising for a faster growth in the number of users within system expansion.

Well, in the end, you will find us on Google Play and the App Store in a few months.

story:
Short Summary

Hello contributors:

Do you have kids or grand-kids ? Are you always looking to learn more?

As an educationist, I see many young students with difficulties in understanding complex topics. The reason is that at a young age, students cannot visualize complex structures and processes behind it. When we make complex themes visual, it will become much easier for students to grasp the knowledge they need to excel in life.

With this product, we can add excitement to learning. Who does not want to see high-end animations in education?  

 

3D-Monoscopic video

 

3D-Stereoscopic video

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need 15,000 USD to complete the development of

    • Human Eye Video in 3D-mono (No glass version) and 3D-stereo (3D active glass version)
    • Human Eye interactive game in 3D-mono (No glass version) and 3D-stereo (3D active glass version)
  • Human Brain interactive game in 3D-mono (No glass version) and 3D-stereo (3D active glass version)

Example for Web or Mobile game

Once we are funded

  • We'll send you the perks you ordered. Be it our full 3D video's, or unique perks including 3D glasses, game and flash cards
  • If we are partially funded, we will move on with our passion for helping children excel. It may take a little more time to create additional contact, but we will already send all our backers the videos we ALREADY (put in bold) developed.

The Impact

 

It’s well known among educators that complex and abstract topics can be understood more easily (especially by younger students) when concepts are introduced visually. Visuals not only improve a student’s ability to understand how something works but also helps with retention. Furthermore, by seeing the “whole” of something, children are better able to understand the parts.

Even more importantly, research shows that 3D-animated models can represent information most efficiently to speed learning and comprehension. 85% of students prefer visual and kinesthetic learning, while only 15% prefer hearing about a topic as a way of education.

Research findings

  • Faster absorption of material
  • Deeper understanding of subjects
  • Increased attention span
  • Better retention of material
  • Greater motivation to learn
  • More engagement with content
  • Higher test scores for students

Case studies across the world

http://www.cubedigico.com/case-studies.html 

This resource will help a teacher to explain the topic visually in detail. Where as the students can learn and feel the excitement in learning with high-end visuals.These topics are curriculum aligned and written by USA teachers.

Product reviews:

 

Work Process

Below is our production pipeline to complete a topic from pre-production to post-production.

 

Risks & Challenges

To ensure the quality, we need to have better-rendering systems and a team of animators, modelers, riggers, post-production, Unity 3D and mobile app. If there is any shortage of funds, we need to take a little longer time than projecting dates to deploy the videos and games.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this project if you feel like somebody else might be interested in being part of this campaign.

People talking about 3D in Education

 

Kids get exited with 3D content

story:
Help bring Myrna and her Canaan Dogs home!

עברית בהמשך

 

Have you ever thought about how odd it is for one species to share their sofa, bed, and all of their every day life with another species?

 

To be a dog lover is not a special thing, a lot people share their lives with a sweet pooch.
But how did such a special and strong bond between two such distinctive creatures emerge and evolve during the history of mankind?

 

There is one special lady who has dedicated her life to preserving a living piece of this puzzle! Her name is Myrna Shiboleth. Myrna has taken on the task of preserving one of the most ancient dog breeds that still exists- the Israel Canaan Dog. The Canaan dog is one of very few dog breeds that are considered to be truly primitive, existing long before man created hundreds of dog breeds by selective breeding. The Canaan Dog is the dog that our ancestors shared their lives with. If you think about it, the Canaan dog is the dog from the bible. Cool, right?

 

Almost five years ago, Myrna was thrown out of her home in Israel after 47 years. When she moved in to Shaar Hagai in 1970, it was a ruin, and she spent a great deal of time, energy and resources in restoring it, making it into a comfortable home, and an internationally known farm for the breeding and preservation of the Israel Canaan Dog. Over the years, she was visited by many from all over the world that were interested in seeing and learning about these rare and very special dogs.


And then she was left homeless with her dogs and without any resources; she received no compensation.

When she had nowhere to go, her dear friend Isabella opened her home and heart to her and her dogs, and they moved to Italy, to share a house with her.

Italy is a wonderful country, spectacularly beautiful and full of kind people. But Myrna is not able to get a permanent residence permit there. Without residence, she has no health care and is not allowed to work. And despite all the problems involved, it is not home, her family is in Israel. She must return to Israel soon.

The return to Israel involves a great deal of expense. Things have changed a lot since she came to Italy; the laws in Israel for travel with dogs have changed, and the situation with flights has changed drastically due to the present COVID situation. Bringing the dogs home will be exceedingly expensive, but under no circumstances will she abandon her dogs – her Canaans, collies and podengos - wherever her home is, that must be their home as well.

Myrna has been just managing to get along and has no resources that she can use to pay for shipping the dogs. Friends have found a place for her and the dogs to live in Israel, but she will need all the household basic necessities, she has no furniture or housewares, and fences for the security of the dogs.

The domestication of dogs is still scientifically ”a big question”. Scientists still try to determine exactly when and where the beginning of domestication took place. In other words, how dogs became so integrated in human evolution, to the point that they are literally another family member in our lives today.

The Canaan Dog that exists today holds a concentrated and capsuled bulk of information that in fact shows us what the original dog was like when it chose to become associated with man. Not many understand how precious this information is. It can help us to shed light on many biological processes regarding psychological, emotional (and the neurobiology of those), genetics data and more. This information is a treasure not only for canine science, but also for other species research (including humans). There are very few other breeds that can provide this sort of information.

This fund has been started in the hopes of being able to collect enough to bring Myrna and her dogs home to Israel, so that she can continue her work with this fascinating breed.

If all her friends contribute even just a small amount, the goal will be achieved, and Myrna and her dogs will be able to go home.
 

Thanks to everyone for their interest, and hope to be able to give you all good news in the near future.

For anyone interested in the whole story of the eviction:

Changing Lives for the Better

The Shadow Foundation equips young woman ages 18 through 21 years old with skills and education necessary to become independent, productive adults. The program's goal is to help daughters of mothers who are incarcerated develop much-needed independent living skills.

http://theshadow.foundation

story:
The Sania Box embedded computer kit contains a one-of-its kind add-on board that aids in developing STEM skills in children. The kit is conceived by 13-year-old Sania Jain who wishes to introduce coding to kids from an early age. The add-on board and other components of the Sania Box kit bring all coding projects to life with their unique features.

 

THE SANIA BOX ADD-ON BOARD 

Central to the Sania Box kit is an embedded computer, an add-on board that fits on the Raspberry Pi 3 or Pi 4 board 40 Pin header. This add-on board is pre-designed to give children with a hands-on experience about coding. It features push buttons, LED lights, and multiple sensors such as the thermal sensor, and the gas sensor. It is also integrated with a 3-digit, 7-segment clock display. Can you imagine the level of fun that kids can have with this kit while learning to program? To make the Sania Box complete in itself, and to enable kids to learn coding right away, the kit supplements the add-on board with an SD Card containing pre-installed programs. The keyboard and mouse in the kit are essential items and the breadboard, wires, LEDs, and resistors create a perfect educational tool.

 

 

WHAT CAN YOU DO WITH IT? 

One of the features that makes Sania Box unique is the add-on board that is a pre-designed and pre-tested add-on circuit board. It is different from a breadboard and a cable kit that are difficult to assemble without adult help and supervision.  The add-on board is a safe and ready-to-use component unlike a breadboard and cable kit that can hurt kids while assembly. Sania Box plans to create more add-on boards in near-future by working closely with kids and parents.

 

 

PYTHON PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE

The Raspberry Pi is a compact computer that is preferred by every DIY tech-lover and depends on Python as its preferred programming language. Once you are acquainted with Python, there are very less chances that you will resort to other programming languages for your tasks.

MORE ABOUT THE SANIA BOX

The Sania Box is an embedded computer kit with a special add-on board made for children who are 8 years and above. This build-it-yourself project is made to encourage children to learn about computer engineering including coding, IoT, electronics, and more.

Sania wishes to open up the possibilities of learning computer engineering for every child.  Her mission is to take this fun project to kids nationwide and then worldwide including schools, after-care/enrichment centers, and camps to generate self-driven interest in coding and introductory hands-on electronics and IoT which is otherwise accessible to a select few. Please make a pledge to buy the Sania Box Embedded Computer Kit for the young computer enthusiast you know, or help us raise funds and achieve our goal to expand throughout the country and beyond for young learners.

What’s more, it is made by professionals with the help of Sania who lives and breathes coding in her life. Sania wanted to reach out to other kids, who wish to learn coding in a simple and engaging way with her add-on board and other components in the kit, and the Sania Box offers the perfect opportunity to do so.

WHAT’S IN THE BOX?

The Sania Box add-on board is a hands-on learning tool for all those kids who want to learn programming and create projects based on their codes. Therefore, we have created a kit that kids can start using right away.  Though the Sania Box is complete in itself, it will present the users with a problem where they will have to source multiple components from different places, which would not have been a pleasant experience. For example, the supplied SD Card contains the pre-loaded programs. The keyboard and mouse are essential items and the breadboard, wires, LEDs, and resistors create a perfect learning device.

 

Here is a comprehensive list of items in the kit:

1. Wired keyboard and mouse

2. Custom Case

3. USB-C Power supply

4. 16 GB SD card with pre-loaded software to help you start programming out of the box

5. HDMI cable to use a TV as your monitor

6. A Raspberry Pi Model 4 with 1 GB Ram and 64-bit quad-core processor to power the add-on board

7. The Sania Box embedded add-on board has the following features:

· 2 LEDs (Red and Green) that can blink, keep steady, and turn off

· Push Button

· Thermal Sensor

· Touch Sensor

· Three-digit, 7-segment Display

· Relay Circuit

· Light Sensor

· Gas Sensor (CO2, methane, etc)

 

WHY ARE KIDS EXCITED ABOUT IT?

No computer in the world is as easy to put together as Sania Box. The excitement of building your own computer is only the beginning of working on this computer kit.

The Sania Box makes children independent while learning, as everything they need to work is right here in this kit. Just connect it to a TV monitor with an HDMI cable and they are good to go. The kit is supplemented with a keyboard and a mouse so they don’t ask for yours every time they want to work on their computer. However, their freedom of learning on the Sania Box is assisted on every step of the way. The pre-loaded coding programs help them to learn the basics of computer engineering. As they learn, experiment, and evolve, they can access new programs on Sania’s website. The LED lights, thermal sensors, push buttons, gas sensors and other accessories bring their coding experiments to life. 

OUR FUTURE DREAM

We dream of a future where we can motivate every child to take up programming and learn it in a simple and easy way. Apart from the in-built programs that kids can learn at various levels, we also publish new programs on our website www.saniabox.com regularly so that young computer science lovers may never run out of projects. We want children to enjoy programming and take it up in the future as a profession. We are aware that technology is set to rule our tomorrow and we want today’s kids to be an important part of that future.

Sania Box aims to provide more add-on boards with various levels of complexity. Therefore, kids at various levels of learning can find useful and new projects to learn. These add-on boards can be purchased separately, or parents can subscribe to us to receive a new add-on board every month.

We want experimentation to be an important aspect of learning and therefore encourage all users of Sania Box to create their own coding projects. This way kids will be able to create their own IoT devices and programs for learning and entertainment.

 COMMUNITY OUTREACH  

 

 

As a part of her community outreach program, Sania visited a few lesser-privileged schools in India. She spoke to hundreds of children in these schools about coding and its role in the future who received her lectures enthusiastically. Unfortunately, most of the schools do not give enough emphasis on computer science in primary and middle school levels. She also demonstrated the use of the Sania Box especially with the add-on board with its multiple features.

WHY IS CODING A NECESSITY?

It is disheartening to know that only 20% of the developers who are between the ages 18-24 today, started coding before they were 16 years old as compared to kids of the 70s and 80s when this number was almost 50%. The availability of technology has lessened the drive to learn coding in today’s kids. This needs to change as the future will be ruled by technology and coders will play an important part in it. Most schools do not offer computer education to younger kids and the Sania Box can be quite handy when it comes to kids learning code on their own.

 

TEAM

Sania Jain, Alok Jain, Vikas Shukla, Vishwas Jain

The team involved in bringing this project to life is special in many ways. This project was conceived by our youngest team member Sania who wishes all kids to have a real-life, practical knowledge of programming and what it can do. Her dream became our mission and we as professionals stepped in to create the Sania Box, a DIY computer kit with one of the best add-on boards available that can offer hands-on learning of programming to its users. Our team of technology experts, designers, and programmers from the Silicon Valley at www.moonshotjr.com  have endeavored to build this computer kit to assist, educate, and empower kids to be the tech leaders of tomorrow.

story:
Make an impact on the lives of many

ALittle4ALot was started in order to help women and girls who have recently undergone surgical repair for obstetric fistulas  return to school or receive vocational skills training.  ​​

​A fistula is internal damage due to prolonged labor, sometimes several days, where the baby usually does not survive. Reasons for prolonged labor are often from girls being too young to carry, malnutrition, no access to medical care, or not enough money to afford medical care. 

These young women are often cast from their homes and villages and are left with nothing. By teaming up with a surgeon who repairs these girls, AL4AL ensures that these women are not only physically repaired but emotionally as well. This is done by empowering them with education, vocational training, and a community of support. 

Please visit ALittle4ALot.com to learn more!

​
​
There are currently three programs:

1. Scholarship Fund- funding girls to return to Primary or Secondary School.  Our scholarship is currently funding  girls in 6-11 grade to attend boarding school in Eldoret, Kenya. We are committed to sponsoring them through their graduation.

​2. Stepping Forward Program - a vocational training program to teach skills to Fistula Survivors in order to help them gain marketable skills in hopes of becoming financially independent or at least more financially stable.

3.Microloan Program- After the women succesfully complete their vocational training, we offer them microloans. The women learn to earn money and are encouraged to save. This program offers financial support so that the women may return back to their villiage or go work in the city.

​

 All of the girls in our program have been operated on by Dr. Mabeya at the Moi Referral Hospital and the GYNOCARE Fistula Center in Eldoret, Kenya.

Our organization is small and personal and can use your support!  This organization was started by Dr. Debra Matityahu and her daughter Arielle.  After visiting Eldoret, Kenya in November of 2010, and working in the hospital with Dr. Mabeya, we were inspired to help these girls and women gain independence.

Who is Kendall?

Kendall is a 24 year old Dominican University nursing student in California who is passionate about helping others. As a student supporting herself through school she feels like the best way to help AL4AL is to travel in June 2015 with their founders and several volunteers. In Kenya, she will gain valuable experience, work directly with the girls, and bring back her experience to share with you, her peers, and many others.

The Impact

By helping with travel costs, we can help so many people. Having Kendall in Kenya will help the girls in the program, all of the volunteers, and of course her learning and experience in the medical field. 

To make this trip possible, Kendall needs $3000 to add to her savings to cover flights and boarding.

Risks & Challenges

It may make more sense for some to donate directly to the program to cover the costs of education for our girls in Kenya. However, the most helpful thing that can be done is for people to go to Kenya to help, teach, and inspire the girls in the program. After Kendall's experiences in Kenya, she will share with so many people and through sharing she will generate more interest and support for AL4AL. And once she is successful as a nurse she will continue to contribute to the program for the rest of her life!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways to help! Please:

Visit AL4AL.com

Share this page

Make a donation to this cause or, if you prefer, directly to ALittle4ALot.com


THANK YOU!
story_txt:
Make an impact on the lives of many

ALittle4ALot was started in order to help women and girls who have recently undergone surgical repair for obstetric fistulas  return to school or receive vocational skills training.  ​​
​A fistula is internal damage due to prolonged labor, sometimes several days, where the baby usually does not survive. Reasons for prolonged labor are often from girls being too young to carry, malnutrition, no access to medical care, or not enough money to afford medical care. 
These young women are often cast from their homes and villages and are left with nothing. By teaming up with a surgeon who repairs these girls, AL4AL ensures that these women are not only physically repaired but emotionally as well. This is done by empowering them with education, vocational training, and a community of support. 
Please visit ALittle4ALot.com to learn more!
​
​
There are currently three programs:
1. Scholarship Fund- funding girls to return to Primary or Secondary School.  Our scholarship is currently funding  girls in 6-11 grade to attend boarding school in Eldoret, Kenya. We are committed to sponsoring them through their graduation.
​2. Stepping Forward Program - a vocational training program to teach skills to Fistula Survivors in order to help them gain marketable skills in hopes of becoming financially independent or at least more financially stable.
3.Microloan Program- After the women succesfully complete their vocational training, we offer them microloans. The women learn to earn money and are encouraged to save. This program offers financial support so that the women may return back to their villiage or go work in the city.
​
 All of the girls in our program have been operated on by Dr. Mabeya at the Moi Referral Hospital and the GYNOCARE Fistula Center in Eldoret, Kenya.
Our organization is small and personal and can use your support!  This organization was started by Dr. Debra Matityahu and her daughter Arielle.  After visiting Eldoret, Kenya in November of 2010, and working in the hospital with Dr. Mabeya, we were inspired to help these girls and women gain independence.   Who is Kendall?
Kendall is a 24 year old Dominican University nursing student in California who is passionate about helping others. As a student supporting herself through school she feels like the best way to help AL4AL is to travel in June 2015 with their founders and several volunteers. In Kenya, she will gain valuable experience, work directly with the girls, and bring back her experience to share with you, her peers, and many others.
    The Impact By helping with travel costs, we can help so many people. Having Kendall in Kenya will help the girls in the program, all of the volunteers, and of course her learning and experience in the medical field. 
To make this trip possible, Kendall needs $3000 to add to her savings to cover flights and boarding.
    Risks & Challenges It may make more sense for some to donate directly to the program to cover the costs of education for our girls in Kenya. However, the most helpful thing that can be done is for people to go to Kenya to help, teach, and inspire the girls in the program. After Kendall's experiences in Kenya, she will share with so many people and through sharing she will generate more interest and support for AL4AL. And once she is successful as a nurse she will continue to contribute to the program for the rest of her life!
    Other Ways You Can Help There are so many ways to help! Please:
Visit AL4AL.com
Share this page
Make a donation to this cause or, if you prefer, directly to ALittle4ALot.com

THANK YOU!

story:
NEPAL NEEDS YOUR HELP TO REBUILD INFRASTRUCTURE.

Friends--


We need your help.

We have spent the last five days helping those affected by the earthquake in Nepal. You have read the news, seen the pictures and know that if we do not act quickly things are going to get worse.


Thousands have lost their lives and loved ones. Millions of people have been displaced as they watched their homes crumble down. In addition to this loss, the country has lost its ancient art and architecture. They were a big part of not only our culture and heritage, but also people's daily lives. Children growing up now will only read in textbooks these ethereally beautiful wonders, that once were.

Already an unstable infrastructure, the earthquake has completely crushed it. The damage is significant, and the rebuilding efforts will have to be planned so that it is sustainable in the long-term.  

We have seen the whole world contribute for the immediate relief, and on behalf of all Nepali people, THANK YOU!!! :) 


We have found several local organizations that have been providing relief on the ground and have been donating funds to Nepal Ko Yuwa (www.nepalkoyuwa.org). 

Our goal with this fund is to help with the mid-long term recovery of Nepal by helping to build critical infrastructure like  schools, hospitals and bridges in affected areas. We are working with Janata Bank and News24 (a local TV channel) to channel funds to 11 affected districts. 

 Furthermore, Janata Bank already has a system set up for micro loans, and has made an effort to make their microfinance products more accessible to entrepreneurs who want to get their businesses back on its feet. I imagine a lot of farmers will want to catch up on plantation this monsoon season.

They are doing great work and are a worthy cause to donate to. As of right now, they only accept wire transfers, and all the proceedings will get directly wired to them.

Here is the wire details:
Standard Chartered Bank, New York, USA
Swift BIC : SCBLUS33
Account Number : 3582025535001


In the meantime, let's keep spreading the word and keeping Nepal in our thoughts. One dollar is 101.71 rupees so every dollar counts!


Thank You and Namaste.

College of Wooster Nepali and Nepal Study Abroad Student Community
